loans.name: Berkruhi

texts.en:
Berkruhi lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and three children, in Arevshat village of the Shirak region. She and her family members are involved in agribusiness and they run a small but successful farm which includes cows, calves, sheep, and hens and the cultivation of wheat, potatoes and carrots. Berkruhi’s house is too small for a family of five, but because of hard financial conditions, she and her husband haven’t been able to expand it to improve their living conditions.

The Shirak region, where Berkruhi and her family live and work, is considered a poor region where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs combine to make it difficult for people to develop their area businesses. 

Berkruhi is requesting a loan to pay for livestock forage. Her request has been approved within a joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva to provide loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them access markets and earn better livings.

loans.use: to pay for livestock forage

loans.name: Sincere (2) Group

texts.en:
Twelve years ago, Romio started up his own business as a barber in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. Having started with HOPE Congo back in 2012, he is returning for his 6th loan with HOPE and has requested an amount of 825,000 XAF. In addition to his barber shop, Romio also sells drinks to his customers and will use the loan to purchase a larger variety of imported drinks for his shop. 

Romio is a member of the community bank Sincere (2) and leads 5 other member of his group. With the expansion of his business, Romio hopes to build a house for his family and to visit other markets and countries, along with providing a solid education for his children. He hopes to accomplish this vision by expanding his drink business to sell as a wholesaler and by opening a more modern hair salon in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and supplies for his barber shop and general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products, machines, and lighting for her salon

loans.name: Ekome Feemo Group

texts.en:
Ekome Feemo is a group of two people, whose members are friends and belong to the same savings group. They are into maize and fresh fish. Morkor is the representative for the group and is 57 years old. She is single and has grown-up children who are not dependent on her.

To meet her needs, Morkor has been selling kenkey (cook corn paste) at her residence for the past 30 years. She gets the maize from the market, grinds it, and cooks the corn paste before selling it to customers.

To expand her business and become more competitive in this field, Morkor wishes to increase her stock of product (market, grinds it, and cooks the corn paste), which in turn will enable her to increase her turnover and income. For this reason, Morkor is requesting an eighth loan from ID Ghana, together with the other member of the Ekome Feemo group. All of her previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy maize from the market, grind it, and cook it into corn paste that she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es un padre ejemplar él trabaja como jornalero  para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar a delante a sus diez  hijos,  él tiene ya treinta y cinco años de ejercer esta labor, él es un padre responsable que ahora ve la necesidad de comprar un terreno donde sus hijos en un futuro puedan construir, pero para poder  realizar la compra el necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero, por tal motivo solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar un terreno. Manuel tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para que pueda realizar la compra y poder construir un casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is an exemplary father.  He works as a day laborer to earn his income and get his 10 children ahead.  He has 35 years of experience in this line of work.

Manuel's a responsible father who sees the need to buy a plot of land where his children can build in the future.  He needs a good amount of money to make the purchase, however, so he's requesting a loan.

He hopes to get the loan so he can purchase the land and be able to build a house for his children.

loans.use: to buy land for future construction

loans.name: Borimang Noo Kumya Group

texts.en:
Gurimpaga is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Tampion in the Northern region of Ghana. Gurimpaga is married and has six children. Gurimpaga is the individual pictured raising her hand among the members squatting.

Gurimpaga is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for many years. The name of the group is ‘Borimang Noo Kumya - Tampion’. Gurimpaga earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on a more improved way of processing shea butter, such that they can always produce premium quality for the Ghanaian market and for export.

Gurimpaga and Borimang Noo Kumya - Tampion have asked for a loan of GHS 8,500. Her share of the loan is GHS 300, which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. With this loan, Gurimpaga would earn more income so as to repay this loan and support her children with school fees and food.

Gurimpaga is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her sesame farming and buy sesame seeds.

loans.name: Tikondane Group

texts.en:
Carolyn is 28 years old with three children, and only one child goes to school. She owns a grocery which she depends on for her main source of income. She has been running this business for almost a year now. 

Carolyn will use the loan to expand her business in order to increase her profits; this will enable her to send her children back to school and help her parents in the village. She plans to hire someone to help her run the business and hopes to build a house for her family members.  

Carolyn has experienced a positive change since she started obtaining the loans as she is now able to send her children to better hospitals and she is able to cover their medical bills.

loans.use: to buy soap,biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: Dalitso Group

texts.en:
Melina appreciates Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her; she used the loan to further expand her business by buying grocery store items such as cooking oil, sugar and salt. And the profits she made from this business helped her to financially support her family.

She is requesting another loan in order to buy more commodities for her grocery store. 

She plans to send her children back to school, as the majority of them dropped out due to lack of school fees.

loans.use: to buy different commodities for her shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012, so as to benefit from training, especially from the enterprise development training. He is 65 years old, married and lives with his wife and his six children.

He operates a butcher shop and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more beef to add stock to his butchery business and earn more income. This will increase his income, which will give him more returns and provide basic needs for the family, especially food, school fees and clothing.

He is grateful for Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more beef to add stock to his butcher shop.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: This is Collins from a village in Kericho. He is married with two children. He is cattle seller. He buys cows from one village and sells them to another. With his business, he has been able to care for his family including school his children. He is a responsible man and very diligent in his work. He has to travel long distances in order to get the right breed of cows for his clients. He wants to expand his business and with a Kiva loan he will be able to buy more cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Jubwego Foundation Women Group

texts.en:
Tabitha, the lady raising a passbook in the photo, is a mother to three children; one of them is still in school. She is 28 years of age. She is a vegetable farmer who farms potatoes, kale, and cabbages. 

Tabitha joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and underwent the training for business management.

She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer that will help her increase the quality of cabbages and kale; this will increase her income.

Tabitha is happy about Kiva and their lenders, and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer that will help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Monicah. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She is a mixed farmer growing potatoes and carrots, and has a dairy cow. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a calf that after maturity will increase milk production, which will bring more income.

Monicah is happy about Kiva and their lenders promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy a calf so as to increase milk supply.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, wheat flour, sugar, frytol, etc

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 35-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two daughters in Jabalia city. For the past two years, Khalil has operated a grocery store in his neighborhood.

Khalil is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy grocery products to resell in his store. His loan will enable him to increase his sales and his income. Khalil appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house in Khan Younis city.  Three years ago, Mahmoud opened a grocery store in his neighborhood.

Mahmoud is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy grocery products to resell in his store. His loan will enable him to increase his sales and income. Mahmoud appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is 32 years old. He lives with his wife, two sons, and one daughter in Gaza. Rajab has a shop where he works selling and repairing phones. His house was partially destroyed by the war in Gaza and he would like to repair it. 

Rajab is requesting a loan to install pipelines and buy glass and planks to renovate his home. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him and hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family. In the future, Rajab wants to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to install pipelines and buy glass and planks to renovate his home

loans.name: Elizabeth Santos

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 45 años, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge e hijo de 02 años. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias y su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, su clima es cálido, habitada por gente amigable que se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y artesanias como adornos, collares, pulseras, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de un año, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace 04 años. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, así ella podrá generar mayor ingresos y mejores ganancias lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in the family house with her spouse and 2 year old child. She has good references and her family is very close-knit. She lives in a community located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque department on the North Coast of Peru, The climate is hot and the inhabitants are friendly and work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Elizabeth works selling groceries and handicrafts such as trimmings, necklaces, bracelets amongst others. She has been doing this for more than a year. She also works raising and selling small animals which she has been doing for 4 years. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to increase the stock of her business. Then she can generate greater income and greater profit which will allow her to improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to increase the stock of her store.

loans.name: Stockston

texts.en:
Stockston is 58 years old and supports seven family members. 

He has been a small-scale farmer for the last 12 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

Stockston has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him to make milk sales and in turn use the income to improve his agricultural produce through buying fertilizers and certified seeds.  

He plans to use the generated profits to start a grains store. His future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, a farmer of  horticultural produce. She has practiced farming for the last 10 years. She mostly farms tomatoes and kale, which she sells in her local market. The main challenges she faces are farming is unstable with the conditions, and rough roads to the market. 

She teams up with other farmers to transport their produce to the market and shares the cost of transport. She feeds her family from the income she receives from her sales. 

She wants to expand her farm, and with a KIVA loan she shall be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
The man in the photo is Joseph.  He is forty-seven years old and lives with his wife and five children. Two of his children are in primary school and the other three in secondary school. The group joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013.

Joseph is maize and poultry farmer. His produce caters for his family’s food, shelter and school fees. He appreciates Hand In Hand Eastern Africa for the training he received on record keeping and enterprise development that helped him commercialize his farming. He wishes to diversify his farming by starting poultry farming and dairy farming in order to increase his income so as to be able to pay school fees for his four children. It is for this reason that he is borrowing from Kiva to buy poultry feeds and other farm inputs such fertilizer and seeds.  He is  grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: buy poultry feed, seeds & fertilizer

loans.name: Mogusu

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mogusu; he is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. 

Mogusu was able to gain skills in enterprise management and financial management, which have currently enabled him to manage his business well. He does maize and beans farming. 

He is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds in order to boost the crop yield, hence increasing his income. 

Mogusu is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will help boost crop yield.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Marthias is 42 years old. He is married with four children ranging in age between six and 17 years. They all go to school. he is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for 20 years, while his wife a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence is 37 years old. She is married with five children aged between 1 and 11 years old. Three of her children go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 16 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plantains, tangerines, plums, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Brenda Johanna

texts.es:
Brenda de 52 años de edad, casado con tres hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de Managua,   se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En  la actualidad lucha para cumplir sus sueños y metas como terminas su casa de habitación, y que sus hijos se independice con su negocio propio.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como : frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jabón, fósforos, hielos cigarros, gaseosas, jugos etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para mantener su clientela y en un futuro cercano  obtener mejores ganancias.  El objetivo es surtir su negocio con productos comestibles  y comprarles a los diferentes proveedores. Brenda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Brenda is 52 years old, married, and has three grown children. She is originally from Managua. Brenda is known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. She is currently striving to fulfill her dreams and goals, such as finishing her house and seeing her children become independent at their own businesses.

Thanks to her desire to move forward, Brenda has been managing a small grocery store where she sells food and other products such as beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, matches, ice, cigarettes, sodas, juices, and other items. She works approximately 12 hours each day by offering her products and maintaining her clientele. In the near future, she would like to generate more earnings. Her goal is to restock her business with food products and buy them from different suppliers.

Brenda appreciates the help from Kiva lenders who provide people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, the means to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, matches, ice, cigarettes, sodas, juices, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: El Bien Comun Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario "El Bien Común" lo integran tres socios emprendedores, quien lo coordina es el señor José que a sus 66 años demuestra las ganas de seguir superándose, él comercializa tortilla y leche agría, comprando la leche para luego poenrla a cuajar, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la elaboración de tortillas, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de maíz, leche y útiles para este negocio. El resto de los integrantes son las señoras, Juanita que tiene la edad de 40 años y es propietaria de una pulpería y por último Idalia de 44 años de edad quien comercializa calzado en la capital y en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "The Common Good" has three entrepreneur members. The coordinator is José. 

At 66 years old, he's shown a desire to continue bettering himself. He sells tortillas and buttermilk, buying milk to curdle it later. He counts on help from his wife to make tortillas.

He's seeking the current loan to buy corn, milk and tools for this business. The rest of the group members are Juanita, who is 40 and runs a grocery store, and Idalia, 44, who sells footwear in the capital and her community.

loans.use: to buy corn, milk and tools for this business.

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Mithu is 68 years old. She is married and has two children aged 33 and 24. 

In 1985 Mithu established her livestock business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. Mithu wants this loan from Patan BPW to buy feed for her cattle. 

In the future, Mithu plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nicaraguita Group

texts.es: Nicaragüita es un grupo solidario integrado por dos mujeres y varón, quienes solicitan por quinta ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM para lograr capitalizar sus negocios y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, es coordinado por Meyling una joven que tiene la edad de 23 años, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 3 años, por quienes ha decidido seguir superándose, ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, cosméticos y bisutería de manera ambulante en los alrededores de su domicilio y el crédito lo invertirá en camisolas, blusas, pantalones, etc. El resto de los integrantes son la joven Karla de 19 años y quien se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva tanto en su domicilio y de manera ambulante, y el señor Isidro de 47 años de edad de los cuales ha dedicado trece años de su vida a la elaboración y venta de marcos para cuadros y fotos.
texts.en:
Nicaragüita is a group composed of two women and a male who are currently requesting , for the fifth time, funding through ADIM  [Asociación Alternativa Para el Desarrollo Integral de las Mujeres] to be able to take advantage of their businesses and improve the lives of their families.  

[The group] is coordinated by Meyling, a young woman who is 23 years old, is married and mother of two children ages 5 and 3 years, for whom she has decided to continue excelling.  She is dedicated to the selling of clothing, cosmetics and jewelry as a street vendor around her home area.  The loan will be invested on camisoles, blouses, pants, etc. 

The other members are Karla, who is 19 years young, and who sells new clothing both through her home and as a street vendor.   

Isidro is 47 years old, and has dedicated thirteen years of his life to the production and sale of picture frames.

loans.use: to purchase camisoles, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Alicia Edith

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con sus dos hijos y su cónyuge en la provincia de Callayuc, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, tiene una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio. Cuenta con más de 01 año de experiencia en este negocio y sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le generará mayor volumen de ventas lo que mejorará su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 24 years old, has a partner and lives with her two sons and her partner in the Callayuc province.  This is a community where life is tranquil and the inhabitants work in  agriculture, commerce and cattle and it is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the north coast of Perú.

She makes a living selling products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles among others. She has a store located in her house.  She has over a  year of experience in this business and the neighbors give good personal and work references of her.  The loan will be used to buy more products to increase the stock of her business. This will generate a greater volume of sales, which in turn will help her income level and therefore the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es un joven de 33 años de edad, Eduardo se dedica a  comercializar confites y también comida, Eduardo empezó su negocio desde que tenía 14 años y comenta que si le va bien en la comercialización de sus productos, Eduardo necesita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de confites y más productos para mejorar su negocio, Eduardo tiene la aspiración de que le siga yendo bien en su negocio y así salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a young man who is 33 years of age. He sells sweets and other types of food. Eduardo started his business when he was 14 years old. He says that he is doing very well at selling his products.

Eduardo needs a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of sweets and many other products to improve his business. He aspires to continue doing well at his business so that he can move forward.

loans.use: to buy sweets and other products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and small household appliances to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es: Por décima quinta ocasión solicitan el financiamiento en ADIM el grupo solidario “Chiltoma”, integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y laboriosas. Quien lo coordina es la señora Verónica que tiene la edad de 40 años y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de nacatamales en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de dos cerdos en pie, flete de leña, quintal de maíz, cajilla de tomate, hoja de chagüite, etc., ya que los créditos anteriores le han ayudado para el incremento de los productos ofrecidos. Las demás integrantes son las señoras, Fátima que tiene la edad de 46 años y vende cosméticos AVON y gaseosas en los al redores de su comunidad, y Teresa de 43 años de edad y ha dedicado dieciséis años de su vida a la elaboración de almidón y los comercializa en el mercado más populoso de la capital.
texts.en:
For the 10th time the “Chiltoma” communal bank, made up of 3 hard-working and enterprising women is requesting a loan from ADIM. Verónica is the coordinator. She is 40 years old and her business is making and selling nacatamales (a tradtional Nicaraguan food) at her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two pigs, a load of wood, a quintal of corn, a case of tomatoes, chagüite leaves, etc. The previous loans have helped her increase the variety of products offered.

The other members are Fátima who is 46 years old and sells Avon cosmetics and soft drinks in her community and Teresa who is 43 years old and has spent 17 years of her life making starch that she sells in the largest market in the capital.

loans.use: to buy two pigs, a load of wood, a quintal of corn, a case of tomatoes and chagüite leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport farm produce to the market

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: A los 17 años Pilar se incursionaba en el mundo de los negocios vendiendo ropa y después al poco tiempo puso una venta de cerdo y una pulpería a la vez el cual ambos negocios les dejo a sus hijos para brindarles un futuro próspero. Nuevamente volvió a retomar el negocio de venta de ropa ambulante la cual le ha sido muy provechosa ya que ha logrado diversificar sus productos y tener mayor clientela. Para seguir creciendo Pilar solicita un crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, shorts entre otros. De esta manera podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
At the age of 17, Pilar entered the business world by selling clothes. Shortly thereafter, he opened a grocery store and also sold pork. He passed both of these businesses on to his children so that they could have a prosperous future.

Pilar has now returned to selling clothes as a street vendor. Diversifying his products has been quite advantageous since it has helped him to attract more customers. In order to keep growing, Pilar is requesting a loan in order to buy trousers, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, and other garments. This will allow him to satisfy the demands of his customers so that he can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, and other garments.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.es:
Elmar tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge e hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad habitada por gente respetuosa y amable dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, realiza esta actividad desde hace 01 año por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo será para invertir en la compra de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros para incrementar el stock de su negocio así como la compra de alimentos para estos, lo cual le generará mayor volumen de ventas mensuales y aumentará su nivel de ingresos lo que va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmar is 32 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives in the family house with his wife and child in the district of Cayaltí. It is a community of respectful and friendly people who work mainly in agriculture and raising livestock. it is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

Elmar works raising milk cows which he has done for 1 year. He has experience in the field and good references from the inhabitants of his district. The loan will be used to buy small animals like chickens, ducks and turkeys amongst others to increase the stock of his business as well as buying feed for them. This will create a greater volume of sales per month and increase his level of income which will improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals like chickens and ducks amongst others as well as buying feed for them.

loans.name: Karla Lisseth

texts.es:
Karla tiene 25 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge, vive en casa alquilada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad tranquila donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos automotrices y su cónyuge se dedica al mantenimiento de motos, esta actividad la realiza hace muchos años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de repuestos y accesorios vehiculares para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Karla, 25, has a stable home with her husband.  She lives in a rented house in the Santo Tomás district, a peaceful community where the residents work in agriculture and ranching.  It's located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern highlands.

Karla earns a living selling spare car parts and her husband repairs motorcycles.  She has had this business for many years, so she has a lot of experience and good references in her region.

The loan is to buy a large quantity of spare parts and car accessories to increase her stock.  She'll earn more income and be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of spare parts and car accessories to increase her stock

loans.name: Evelin Vanessa

texts.es: A sus 24 años de edad Evelin esta casada, su esposo  trabaja de chofer, Evelin se dedica  a la  comercialización de ropa desde hace 5 años atrás, Evelin hace amistad con sus clientes y es muy amable con ellas y es así como tiene buenas ventas, con el dinero del crédito Evelin va a comprar ropa para mejorar su negocio y prepararse a futuro para la llegada de un  hijo que piensa tener.
texts.en:
Evelin is 24 years old and married. Her husband is a chauffeur. Evelin has been selling clothes for five years. She is friendly with her customers and shows them great kindness, which helps to generate good sales.

With the money from her loan, Evelin will buy clothes so that she can improve her business. In the future, she plans to prepare for the arrival of a child.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 33 años de edad, está casado tiene una linda familia de 6 hijos de los cuales dos ya están en la escuela y el resto aun no va,  esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Samayac.
Roberto con el propósito de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la venta de queso en el lugar de su domicilio,  desde hace cinco años.
Roberto ahora ve la necesidad de remodelar su casa porque se encuentra en muy mal estado, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero,  por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo para poder comprar, cemento, cal, arena, hierro y piedrín.
Sus sueños en el futuro  es que sus hijos tengan una casa  con sus servicios básicos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is 33 years old, is married, and has a beautiful family with 6 children, two of whom are already in school, while the rest are still at home. This humble family lives in a community of Samayac.

Roberto, in order to generate income and support his family, sells cheese out of his home for the past for five years.

Roberto now needs to remodel his home because it is in very poor condition, but to do so requires a good amount of money. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy, cement, whitewash, sand, iron, and gravel.

His dreams for the future are for his children to have a house with basic necessities, and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, whitewash, sand, iron, and gravel, to remodel his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for making pickles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy consumable goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is goal oriented woman. She was born into a family of hard workers in 1995. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a second year student and studying economics. Her parents are agrarians and have a land where they plant agricultural products. Also they keep, feed and sell livestock.

Sayora wants to graduate with excellence from her university and help her village. She has a willingness to help her native land become prosperous and beneficial. She is asking for financial support to pay University tuition fees. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Mariabeth

texts.en: Mariabeth is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She makes a living through her hog raising business. Mariabeth has been in the business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of her income. Mariabeth is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Bahtihon

texts.ru: Бахтихон, 45 лет, замужем. Уже 8 лет она занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 овец.Супруг оказывает услуги по перевозке грузов. Благодаря упорному труду, Бахтихон на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль от бизнеса около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Бахтихон очень уважаемый человек, она знает всю технологию ведения бизнеса, поэтому является лидером группы "Аялзат", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Бахтихон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Bahtihon is 45 years old and married. She has been raising livestock for eight years. She has two cows and 30 sheep. Her husband works providing cargo transportation services. Thanks to Bahtihon’s hard work, her monthly revenue now is about 20,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her business further, Bahtihon has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 90,000 KGS to buy livestock. Bahtihon is well respected in her community. She is very skilled at running this business, and so she is the leader of the Ayalzat borrowers' group, which includes two other members. Bahtihon plans to invest her revenues in an additional expansion of her business and the purchase of home furniture.

loans.use: to buy  livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to augment his capital and buy gravel in order to resell it to earn more

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She has a small piece of farm land near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 3,000 to buy farm fertilizers. She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, 40 years old, lives in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through selling snacks & food. She began by selling a small amount of food dishes & snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her capitalize on her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2014. Now, she applying for a 3,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zhiqiong

texts.en:
Zhiqiong, 44 years old, is a woman with 20 years experience purchasing oranges. She and her spouse  jointly run their own business. They now have an under-school child and a mother to support.

She is a very diligent woman, whose orange business supports the livelihood of all family members. Her son has grown up and the family is heading to a bright future, but the father is ill and they have medical expenses. Zhiqiong’s hard-working and diligent spirit has contributed a lot, but the family is short of money. 

She requests 20,000 CNY from MicroCred to purchase oranges and is confident that her family's life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase oranges.

loans.name: Sayorn

texts.en:
Sayorn, 33, is from a rural village located in the Loek Dek district of Kandal province. She is married with two children. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice. She and her husband have been in this business for years. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day.

Eath has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yogi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yogi. Yogi lives in West Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Yogi owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

As the business grows, Yogi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Yogi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, selling one of Ruma’s latest products called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Yogi is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats and chickens.

loans.name: Kanyshai

texts.ru: Канышай, 34 года, замужем, 3 детей. Несколько лет она занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Канышай есть 15 овец, 10 коз. Благодаря упорному труду, Канышай на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Канышай является членом группы "Аялзат", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Канышай планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и обучение сына.
texts.en: Kanyshai is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She has practiced animal husbandry for a couple of years. Kanyshai owns 15 sheep and 10 goats. Thanks to her tireless work she currently earns around 10,000 som (KGS) in profit each month. In order to further develop her business she is asking Bai Tushum Bank for a 10,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock. Kanyshai is part of the Ayalzat group, which has two members beside her, three in total. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further developing her business, and funding her son's education.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her headcount

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, etc, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Alicia espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the disctrict of Oyotún, in a rural area located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district make a living in agriculture, trade and rearing animals, which are the main economic activities.

Alicia makes a living rearing and selling animals such as ducks, cockerels, hens, chicks, turkeys, etc. She has over 10 years' experience in the business, which is located in her home. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals to increase her business stock. This investment will enable her to increase the variety and productivity of her animals, which will have a big impact on her business. 

Alicia hopes to increase her stock of animals to cater for her customers' diverse range of tastes and requirements, which will boost her profits so that she can improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase her business stock.

loans.name: Om Jamal Group

texts.en:
Om Jamal is a group from four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.
Boshra is a 20-year-old single woman who is a student in post-secondary school education. She is the leader of the group. In the afternoon, Boshra studies many courses on the computer and the language institute to be able to speak the English language fluently as well as to improve her skills on the computer, particularly when she became a student at the university. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a computer inside her house to practice what she studies daily. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a laptop to use it to learn the English language as well as to learn computer Microsoft office programs after she returns from the institute. Purchasing a laptop will help her to increase her skills in learning the Word, Powerpoint, the Internet, Photoshop, typing and other necessary things that she needs to enlarge her knowledge.  

Boshra looks forward to providing herself with all equipments, requirements, and materials that she needs in her study.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop to use in learning the English language as well as to learn  computer Microsoft office programs.

loans.name: Abdel Qader

texts.en:
Abdel Qader is a 24-year-old single man a village near Hebron city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. He started his own business two years ago where he opened a grocery store in his neighborhood.

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy grocery products for his store to resell. This will enable him to increase his sales and also his income. 

Abdel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Djènèba est la personne qui tient l’arrosoir qui jette de l’eau.
C’est une Malienne âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle n’est pas instruite, ces enfants sont âgés de 10 à 15 ans, elle vit dans un milieu rural au Mali avec sa famille.
Elle fait le maraichage depuis 15 ans. Son mari aussi fait le maraichage et cultive les champs pour gagner sa vie.
Elle fait recourt à l’IMF pour soutenir son activé de maraichage.
Le fond qu’elle reçoit du RMCR est investi dans son activité de maraichage. Elle achète des produits maraicher (semences de choux, de tomates, d’aubergines, d’engrais, d’insecticide) dans le marché local. Au moment de la production les acheteurs viennent acheter les légumes avec les minis car dans son village.
Le profit qu’elle gagne la permet de soutenir beaucoup sa famille tel que  les soins de santé de ces enfants, leur habillement ainsi que leur éducation.
Son rêve c’est d’avoir beaucoup d’animaux  domestiques (vaches, chèvres, moutons).
Son bénéfice prévisionnel mensuellement au moment de la cueillette est de   90 000FCFA par mois.
Souvent  elle a le problème d’eau dans les puits pendant la saison sèche.
texts.en:
Djènèba is holding the watering can in the photo. She is from Mali. She is 55 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She did not go to school. Her children are between 10 and 15 years old. She lives in a rural area of Mali with her family. 

She has been involved in market gardening for 15 years. Her husband is also a market gardener who plants fields to earn a living.

She is working with IMF in order to support her market gardening business. The funds that she receives from RMCR will be invested in her market gardening. She buys gardening supplies (cabbage, tomato, eggplant seeds; fertilizer; insecticide) in the local market. 

 When the crops are ready, the buyers pick up their vegetables with minibuses in her village. 

The profits she earns allow her to support her family—for example she helps with her children’s healthcare, clothing, and education needs. 

Her dream is to have a lot of animals (cows, goats, sheep). 

Her estimated monthly income at harvest time is 90,000 FCFA per month. She often has problems getting water from the well during the rainy season.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her garden.

loans.name: Zaenal

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Zaenal. Zaenal lives in West Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Zaenal owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Zaenal needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Zaenal’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Zaenal is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 23-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. He started his own business two years ago when he opened a grocery store in his neighborhood.

Khalil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy grocery products for his store to resell. This will enable him to increase his sales and also his income.

Khalil appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es:
Marcial Humberto tiene 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 19 años de edad, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la costa norte de Perú.

Marcial Humberto se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fitosanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcial Humberto is 65 years old and he has two children, aged 12 and 19 years. He lives in his own home made of rustic materials. He has very good personal and work references from his community, which is located in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region on the northern coast of Peru. 

He is a farmer with 30 years of experience specifically in rice cultivation.

The loan will be used for farming work, the application and incorporation of plant sanitation and fertilizer products, and to pay labor costs for the harvest. 

This will help him to improve the crops physiologically, morphologically, and productively. It will also ensure a timely harvest resulting in higher yields and quality. Marcial Humberto will then have no difficulty selling it and obtaining better income, which in turn will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to do farming work, apply and incorporate plant sanitation and fertilizer products, and pay labor costs for his harvest.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su familia en el ditrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pavos, cerdos, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Elena espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old. She has a domestic partner and five children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural area dedicated to agriculture and commerce, and located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Peru. 
She works raising and selling animals such as ducks, turkeys, pigs, etc., with more than 10 years of experience in the business. Her business is located in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals in order to increase her business's stock. Such investment will allow her to have more variety and productivity in animals, with greater influence on her business. Elena hopes to increase her stock of animals in order to serve the diverse tastes and needs of her customers in the area, which will increase her level of income and will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Neneng. Neneng lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only son. Neneng owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider. As a woman, Neneng realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Neneng needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Neneng’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Neneng is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Wiwi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Wiwi. Wiwi lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Wiwi works as a teacher. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to be an entrepreneur. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider. As a woman, Wiwi realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Wiwi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Wiwi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Wiwi is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Yuniarsih

texts.en: One of Ruma’s agents, Yuniarsih, lives in South Bogor, West Java, about two hours from Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia. She lives with her husband and children and owns a stall where she sells consumer products and mobile airtime credits. She decided to join Ruma to expand her technology business. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider and, as a woman, Yuniarsih realized that she has to help her husband increase their income. As her business grows, Yuniarsih needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime credit to people in her community. Her goal for the future is to provide e-commerce. She is grateful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communications by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Sougoura's Group

texts.fr: Sougoura,  au dernier rang au centre sur la photo et portant un foulard bleu, est membre d'un groupe de 6 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Dafara, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Sougoura, qui est âgée de 50 ans, vit dans une famille élargie composée de 93 personnes dont 80 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille.  Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Sougoura a acheté un paquet d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.125 hectares. A travers cet achat, Sougoura espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir acheter des animaux, bœufs et faire  les mariages de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sougoura, in the middle of the last row in the photo and wearing a blue scarf, is a member of a group of six agricultural producers who work and live in the village of Dafara, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. Sougoura, who is 50 years old, lives in an extended family composed of 93 persons, including 80 children. Farming enables her to ensure self-sufficiency in food for her entire family. 

For her first year with myAgro, Sougoura purchased a packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts in her field of 0.125 hectare. Through this purchase, she hopes to be able to increase her yields, so as to purchase some animals, cattle, and to marry off her children.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Famory's Group

texts.fr: Famory qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à l'extrême droite, et qui porte un tshirt à couleur noire et blanche de façon horizontale, est membre d’un groupe de 6 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Mana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Famory, âgé de 46 ans, est le père de 7 enfants dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Famory à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 26 ans. Famory cultive le mais et le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Famory entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Famory effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 26 ans que Famory cultive le mais. Famory planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de meilleurs rendements et acheter des chèvres et moutons. Enfin Famory espère aussi pouvoir protéger sa famille contre la faim.
texts.en:
Famory, in the first row at the far right in the photo and wearing a black-and-white striped T-shirt, is a member of a group of six farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Mana, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 46 years old and the father of seven children, of whom six are currently in school. 

Famory is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food security at home. So he was encouraged to do this work for 26 years now. He grows corn and sorghum on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and farm supplies. 

Famory has started his second year with myAgro and signed up because of the conviction of the myAgro representatives regarding the benefits brought about by myAgro methods. This year, he is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields  on his parcel of 0.125 hectare. He has been growing corn for 26 years. 

With an increase in yields and in his income, Famory is planning on purchasing some goats and sheep. Finally, he also hopes to be able to protect his family from hunger.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Rokia's Group

texts.fr: Rokia qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, et qui porte le foulard vert, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Niagadina au sud de Bamako au Mali. Rokia, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 16 à 25 ans, avec l’un d’entre eux actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Rokia à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Rokia cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Depuis qu’elle pratique l’agriculture Rokia a toujours cultivé l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation Rokia entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. De plus, Rokia souligne l'impact positif qu'ont eu dans le passé le système de paiement et la qualité des engrais  dans son quotidien d'agricultrice. Cette année Rokia effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Rokia planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des animaux pour agrandir son troupeau d'éleveur. Enfin Rokia espère aussi assurer un avenir serein pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Rokia, who is on the left in the photo wearing a green scarf, is a member of a group of 7 farmers signed up with myAgro, living and working in the village of Niagadina, south of Bamako in Mali. Rokia, age 40, is the mother of 6 chidren, ages 16-25, one of whom currently attends school. The anchoring of the family tradition of farming, the principal source of revenue and food self-sufficiency for the family, led Rokia to practice farming, which she has been doing for 20 years. Rokia cultivates peanuts on her plot but must face a farmer’s challenges, such as the lack of rain and farm equipment. Since she’s been farming, Rokia has always cultivated peanuts for it’s food-producing value, explaining that peanuts are directly consumable by families and is used as a base sauce in food products. Rokia is starting her second year with myAgro, and signed up again to be able to augment her yield with myAgro’s services. In addition, Rokia underlines the positive impact the payment system and the quality of fertilizer has had on her daily life as a farmer. This year, Rokia is making payments to buy a myAgro package of fertilizer to cultivate peanuts in order to increase her plot’s yield by 0.125 hectars. Rokia plans to grow her yields and her revenue to buy animals to increase her farmer’s herd. Finally, Rokia also hopes to ensure a serene future for her children.

loans.use: to buy a package of fertilizer for the cultivation of peanuts

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue y su hijo de 9 años de edad en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 11 años y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustin, 42 years old, lives in his own rustic home with his spouse and his 9-year-old son. They live in the Cañaris district of the Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. It is a rural community where life is quiet and the people work in livestock farming and agriculture.

He is a farmer with 11 years of experience specifically in coffee cultivation. He has good references from the residents of his district.

The loan will be used for farming work, the application and incorporation of plant sanitation and fertilizer products, and to pay labor costs for the harvest. 

This will help him to improve the crops physiologically, morphologically, and productively. It will also help produce a timely harvest resulting in higher yields and quality. Agustin will then have no difficulty selling it and obtaining better income, which in turn will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do farming work, apply and incorporate plant sanitation and fertilizer products, and pay labor costs for his harvest.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Alma works hard to support her family by making food in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by raising chickens and ducks. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-making business. Alma has sustained this business with the help of 13 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business

loans.name: No'aman Al- Mahmodi* Group

texts.en:
The members of No'aman Al- Mahmodi* Group are five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 250,000 YER from Kiva's partner AMB.

The coordinator of this group is Jida, and she is responsible for its members. Jida is a 45-year-old married woman with eight children who applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new refrigerator for her house. Jida lives with her family in a very humble house which needs to a lot of home appliances. 

Yemen's summer season is very hot, so securing a refrigerator for Jida's house is very necessary. It will make all the members of the family feel happy, because they will be able to cool a large amount of drinks and water inside it. Purchasing a refrigerator with the loan funds will enable Jida's purchase of some additional necessary appliances such as a washing machine and an oven to furnish her house.

Jida hopes to open a saving account in a bank to provide her children with better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Vidiyanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Vidiyanti. Vidiyanti lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. Vidiyanti owns a stall that sells stationeries and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she had heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and kind mobile provider. As a woman, Vidiyanti realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Vidiyanti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Vidiyanti’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, via Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Vidiyanti is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer de 49 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos  de 32 y 26 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas y refrescos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona central un área que agrupa a universidades, colegios, oficinas públicas, privadas, etc., de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Evangelina es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo hasta los hombros, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es qel guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo menor porque el hijo mayor es independiente y tiene su familia. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas y jugos tradicionales; la empanada es una fina masa de pan, rellena con una preparación salada llamada ‘jigote’, dulce o agridulce y frita en aceite. El jigote incluye carnes de res o de pollo y verduras. Los jugos tradicionales que prepara y vende son de; Mocochinchi (preparado con duraznos secos hervidos), Chicha (preparada en base a maíz), Somó (similar a la Chicha pero incluye el hervido del maíz). Actividad que realiza de martes a domingo durante el día, el lunes es su día de descanso que lo utiliza para organizar sus actividades. “las empanadas con muy demandadas a media mañana y a media tarde, se pueden servir con un refresco o con un café…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la costumbre de los clientes de comer a media mañana y a media tarde, la desventaja es la falta de capital para ampliar su negocio ofreciendo otros alimentos. Su sueño es tener un negocio conocido con ventas continuas, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de gaseosas y refrescos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Evangelina solicita un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas y refrescos para vender junto a sus empanadas.
texts.en:
Evangelina is 49 years old, single, and has two children aged 32 and 26. She has a business selling empanadas and soft drinks.

Evangelina is a good mother, and is enterprising, independent, patient, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the centre, which is an area which brings together universities, schools, public and private offices, etc. It has a tropical climate, with temperatures ranges from 21-35 degrees celsius during the daytime.

Evangelina has olive skin, brown, shoulder-length hair, brown eyes, and is of medium height and build. Her mother tongue is guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she also speaks Spanish, which she uses in her business. She shares her life with her youngest child, because her eldest is independent and has a family. They live in their own home, made of bricks and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and drinking water, electricity, and drains.

Evangelina sells empanadas and traditional juices. An empanada is a thin pastry case which is filled with a savoury mix known as ‘jigote’, or a sweet or sweet and sour filling, which is then fried in oil. The "jigote" contains beef or chicken and vegetables. The traditional juices that she prepares and sells are: Mocochinchi (prepared with boiled dried peaches), Chicha (prepared with corn), and Somó (similar to Chicha but containing boiled corn). 

Evangelina works from Tuesdays to Sundays during the day. Monday is her day off, which she uses to organise her activities. She says that "empanadas are very popular mid-morning and mid-afternoon with a soft drink or a coffee". The advantage of her business is customers' habit of eating them as a mid-morning and mid-afternoon snack. The disadvantage is a lack of capital to expand her business to offer other foods.

Evangelina's dream is to have a well-known business with continuous sales. She wants to expand her business by buying fizzy drinks and soft drinks. This is her first loan with the institution in the one year she has been doing this activity.

This is why Evangelina is requesting a loan to buy fizzy drinks and soft drinks to sell with her empanadas.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks and soft drinks to sell with her empanadas.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en: Lovelyn is 51 years old, is married and has two grown-up children. She is a business-minded person aiming for good profits in her businesses. She sells longganisa (pork sausages) to the people in her village. She also sells AVON products such as powder, cosmetics and perfumes. They also operate a motorcycle transport business within their village. Lovelyn wanted to increase her merchandise and that is why she is now asking for additional capital of 23,000 PHP. She will buy more longganisa (pork sausages) and AVON products to sell. Additional merchandise will also help increase her income. She will save it for her family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more longganisa (pork sausages) and AVON products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and install pipes and a new washer so that the drain water is deposited at a suitable distance and will not continue damaging the wooden kitchen, which needs to be repaired.

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Annie Rose hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing, supported by her loan of Php 50,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

 Annie Rose also hopes to sustain her retailing business so that she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Elena is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: As the married mother of five children, Perlita works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by raising chickens and ducks. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Perlita has sustained her business with help from 12 prior loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will allow her to secure the future of her family by expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a food production business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional storage for her ice candy making.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like dried fish and fattening pigs. 

Lucila dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional storage for her ice candy making.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Lolita aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 62 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.
