Novie has a buy-and-sell recycled metal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more recycled metal to sell.

Novie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more recycled metal to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en: Mae is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She is also a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling soft drinks in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy more drinks to sell. She has been in this business for four years and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support herself. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Liza requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tarini Group

texts.en:
Gandharabandh village is a remotely located rural village, situated about 110 kilometers away from the district headquarters of Balangir in Odisha, India. In January 2015, ten active women from this village formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Tarini and came up to Mahashakti Foundation to access loans for expansion of their existing businesses. Mamata, the cheerful 23-year-old  lady standing with raised hand in the photo, is one of them. She lives with her husband and one baby son of two years of age. 

The main business of Mamata is vegetable cultivation and vending. She has been doing this business for the last six years with the help of her husband. Her husband is a hard-working man who manages her farm. Traders from the nearest town come to her farm for vegetables. She grows all types of vegetables like tomatoes, brinjal (eggplant), cabbages, chillis, radishes, etc. Now she is earning a monthly income of 4000 INR. With this income somehow Mamata is managing to cover living expenses for her family. 

When Mahashakti Foundation started working in that area, Mamata, along with other nine members of the Self Help Group (SHG), approached Mahashakti Foundation and Mamata accessed a loan of 16,000 INR. From this loan she is planning on purchasing a water pump, seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for the farm. Mamata hopes to save enough for construction of a house and better education for her son.

Among the other nine members, four members are doing animal trading businesses, one member is running a general store, one member is running a cycle store, and the other three members are doing cultivation.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a water pump, seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to renovate their house

loans.name: Deden

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Deden. Deden lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his family. 

Deden owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he had heard that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Deden needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Deden’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Deden is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Tiene una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio donde ofrecen abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos y verduras, su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ocasionalmente Benjamín brinda servicios de jornalearía en las fincas de sus vecinos. El ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de cerveza y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in  a rural zone of the Oyotún district, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The residents work farming rice, yucca, and corn, as well as in commerce and livestock farming.

He has a small store located at home, where he sells groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, and vegetables. His wife works raising and selling poultry. Occasionally, Benjamin offers his services as a day laborer on his neighbors' farms.

He is requesting a loan to purchase beer in order to expand his business, so that he can generate more income for his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beer in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Koemhong's Group

texts.en:
Koemhong is originally from a rural area of Thmor Koul district of Battambong province. She is 31 years old, and she is a married woman who has two dependent children; one of them is in school. The main source of her family's income for ten years has been from rice farming, and to earn more income to support her family, she is also a worker. She can earn around 47,000 KHR per day and save around 34,000 KHR daily for future necessities. 

This is the third microloan for Koemhong’s group which consists of two members. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to do farming. She hopes that she can earn more income and have enough to be able to repair her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Allien

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Allien works hard to support her family.

She has a pina weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Allien is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional pineapple fiber cloth and other materials needed for her weaving business.

Allien has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pina fiber cloth and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lily is 38 years old and has five children who are in school.

Lily has a personal products business in the Philippines. Lily requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of personal products to offer for sale.

Lily has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Putri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Putri. Putri lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. 

Putri owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she had heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider. As a woman, Putri realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Putri needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Putri’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community,using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

Neneng is seen standing in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and all of her children are in school.

Ma. Teresa has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like sugar, shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Oswaldo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Oswaldo Lorenzo tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, se encuentra ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y patos, son una familia emprendedora. Ha solicitado un préstamo para cubrir gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo ya que se encuentra en mal estado y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio que le permita generar mayores ingresos para su familia y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Lorenzo is 58 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Pomahuaca district. This is a community with a warm climate and the people earn a living in farming and business. It is situated in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He offers public transport services in his own motorcycle taxi. He takes passengers to the neighbouring small villages in his district. His wife earns a living breeding and selling small animals such as hens and ducks. They are an enterprising family. He has asked for a loan to cover the costs of upkeep and repairs to his vehicle as it is in a bad state so that he can offer better service which would allow him to generate better income for his family and eventually improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to cover the costs of upkeep and repairs to his vehicle as it is in a bad state.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y las actividades que se desarrollan principalmente son el comercio y la crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, cerdos, etc; con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad y variedad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Susana espera mejorar la productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Susana is 41 years old, is single and has two children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún in a rural area where life is very calm and the main jobs carried out are in business and animal breeding. It is in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

She earns a living breeding and selling animals such as ducks, chickens, roosters, hens, pigs, etc. She has over eight years of experience in this business and it is located in her own home. She is asking for a loan to buy more animals to increase the stock of her business. This investments will help her to have more of a variety and different animals. With a lot of influence in this business Susana hopes to improve the productivity of the animals in order to meet the different needs and tastes of the customers of the area which will increase her level of income and allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, soda, instant noodles and toiletries which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. The income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Regina dreams of having a bigger General Store and prays to have a more loving marriage and obedient children. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Silvera

texts.en:
Silvera is 30 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Silvera is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Silvera has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Silvera would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

Leonora has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall like mangoes, apples, tomatoes, onions, garlic, cabbage, eggs, eggplant and spices.

Leonora has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall like mangoes, apples, tomatoes, onions, garlic, cabbage, eggs, eggplant and spices.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 49 ans, Elise est une femme qui a quatre enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Elise est une revendeuse de bouillie et des beignets dans son quartier afin d’avoir une bonne rentabilité. Elise s’approvisionne au marché une fois par mois. Pour commander  quelques sacs de farine de blé et de maïs, Elise sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and aged 49, Elise is a woman raising four children. Living in Adidogomé, she sells porridge and fritters in her neighborhood so as to have a good source of income. 

She buys her ingredients once a month in the market. To order some sacks of wheat flour and maize, Elise is requesting this loan to carry out her intention and have more income to use to cover the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of flour and two sacks of maize.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: A 29 ans, Adjovi  est une femme mariée et vit avec deux enfants à Adidogomé. Bien consciente de son état elle vend des pagnes dans son quartier afin de générer un bénéfice pouvant couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Adjovi  achète son stock auprès de ses fournisseurs trois fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Adjovi désire ce crédit pour commander des pièces de pagne afin de trouver son bénéfice pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
At the age of 29, Adjovi  is a married woman and lives with two children in Adidogomé. Well aware of her state, she sells pagnes (lengths of African print cloth) in  her neighborhood in order to generate an income and cover her daily expenses.

 Adjovi buys her stock from her suppliers three times a month and makes a good deal of profit from that. She would like to have this loan to order some lengths of pagne so as to make her profit and be able to advantageously support her family.

loans.use: to buy 12 lengths of brightly colored African print cloth (pagne)

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 47 years old, widowed, and has four children. She is managing a store for income. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She wants to increase her sales and profits, and that is why she is now asking for a loan of additional capital of P23,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and soap to sell. This will help increase her sales so she will get more revenue and keep growing her business for continuous progression.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and soap to sell

loans.name: Caracol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Caracol se originó en una comunidad de raíces mazatecas donde la actividad principal es el cultivo de caña de azúcar, maíz, frijol y la pesca. Los integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

María - Venta de Ropa
Epifanía - Servicio de Transporte
Lucia,  Isidoro - Venta de Mojarra
Emma - Venta de Abarrotes 
José - Venta de Zapatos 
Emilia - Venta de Frutas Y Legumbres 
Esperanza - Venta de Refresco

Doña Epifania de 54 años es una mujer que se entrega día a día a su familia. Hace un año enviudó y sola se hace cargo de sus tres hijos menores de edad quienes continúan estudiando gracias a las ganancias obtenidas de la actividad que inició hace 10 años junto con su esposo. Entonces, la pareja notó la falta de transporte en su comunidad y así, nació su pequeño negocio.

Al principio sólo contaban con una camioneta de cabina y media, la cual adaptaron para brindar un mejor servicio. Transcurrido el tiempo, con las ganancias, el apoyo de su esposo y los préstamos, Epifania compró otra camioneta. Ahora, la actividad es fuente de empleo de dos jóvenes, choferes de las llamadas “fleteras”.  En el futuro, le gustaría adquirir una nueva camioneta o incluso un automóvil para ofrecer servicio de taxi.

Epifania necesita un préstamo para dar servicio a ambos vehículos y comprar un radio que le ayudará a brindar un servicio seguro y con un poco de entretenimiento a niños y jóvenes, sus mejores clientes.  

“Kjuechire Nga Tjibisenjinnji” son las palabras de doña Epifanía en mazateco, las cuales significan “Gracias por apoyaros” refiriéndose a la oportunidad que tiene el grupo de recibir un préstamo. 

*La fotografía fue capturada en casa de doña Epifanía quien viste blusa de encaje color rojo y delante de ella, posa su hija menor.
texts.en:
The Caracol Group originated in a Mazatec community, where they mainly produce sugar cane, corn, beans, and fish. The members of the group and their businesses are:

María - Clothing sales
Epifanía - Transportation services
Lucia, Isidoro - Fish (Bream) sales
Emma - Grocery sales
José - Shoe sales
Emilia - Fruit and vegetable sales
Esperanza - Beverage sales

Epifanía is a 54-year-old woman who takes care of her family every day. One year ago she became widowed and by herself, she raises her three underage children who continue studying thanks to the income received from the work she started doing ten years ago with her husband. The couple noticed the lack of transportation in their community and this is how their small business began.

At the beginning, they only had a van with one and a half cabins, which they converted to offer better service. Time passed, and with the income, the support of her husband and the loans, Epifanía bought another van. Now, the business is a source of work for two young men, so-called chartered drivers. In the future, she would like to get a new van or even a vehicle to offer taxi services.

Epifanía needs a loan to offer service with both vehicles and to buy a radio, which will help her provide a safe service and some entertainment for children and teenagers, her best customers.

“Kjuechire Nga Tjibisenjinnji” are Epifanía's words in Mazatec, which means "thank you for supporting us" referring to the opportunity the group has, because of the loan.

*The photo was taken at Epifanía's home. She is wearing a red lace top, and in front of her is her youngest daughter.

loans.use: to offer service with both vans and to buy a radio.

location.town: Cosolapa Caracol, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Her name is Christy, 28, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Ryan Jay, a cook, they have two kids, both of whom are still in the elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school.

Christy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 600 a day.

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Christy hopes to maintain and grow her business so they could have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Reynerio

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijas de 7 y 3 años, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de transporte urbano para terceros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años por lo cual cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar arreglos y reparaciones a su vehículo que se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Segundo espera brindar un mejor servicio lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 41 years old and lives with his partner. He has two daughters who are 7 and 3 years old. He lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural area where life is calm and where the people earn a living in farming and livestock. It is in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

He earns a living offering urban transport services for others. He has been doing this for over 2 years and therefore has experience in this business and has good references in his district. The loan will be used to fix and repair his vehicle as it is in a bad condition. With this, Segundo hopes to offer a better service which will have a positive impact on his income and eventually will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to fix and repair his vehicle as it is in a bad condition.

loans.name: Wilyn

texts.en:
Wilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like snack food, soap, school supplies and other groceries for her general store business.

She has been in this business for eight years. Wilyn earns more income from food vending.

Wilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, soap, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business farming rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Marilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Pacifica is 56 years old and married.

Pacifica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Pacifica has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Pacifica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Amalia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, eggs, soap and other groceries.

Amalia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, eggs, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es: Olga es madre soltera, a sus 32 años de edad tiene 3 hijitas la mayor de 13, la segunda de 9 y la ultima de 4 años de edad, todas sus hijas están estudiando, Olga es una mujer muy responsable con sus hijas, Olga se dedica a la crianza de ganado y también es empleada cosechando flores,   Olga necesita el dinero del crédito en la compra de una vaca ya que mediante el ordeño a sus vacas, la obtención de leche y la venta de este  producto es como obtiene sus ingresos , Olga con esta actividad piensa obtener mas ingresos y  sacar adelante a sus hijas, sobre todo que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Olga, 32, is a single mother with three young daughters, all of them in school.  The oldest is 13 years old, the second one is 9, and the youngest is 4.  She's very responsible with her children.

Olga earns a living raising livestock and she's also employed harvesting flowers.  She needs the loan to buy a cow to obtain milk to sell.  This is how she earns her income.

Olga hopes to earn more income and get her daughters ahead.  She especially hopes they'll finish school.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est âgée de 25ans et vit à Adidogomé. Mariée, elle a deux enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari pour leur épanouissement. Marie vend des pagnes en les livrant aux clients dans tout le quartier. Marie s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Marie demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de la famille.
texts.en:
Marie is 25 years old and lives in Adidogomé. Married, she is raising two children and works hard to help her husband offer them a good life. Marie sells pagnes (lengths of African print cloth), delivering them to clients all over the neighborhood. She buys her supplies once a month in the market. 

In order to buy lengths of pagne, Marie is asking for this loan so that she can achieve her goal, earn a profit, and contribute to improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy six lengths of African print cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 38 años de edad  está casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos dos de ellos estudian en la escuela de su comunidad y uno se encuentra bajo el cuidado de la madre, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel es un hombre trabajador y honrado  que para obtener sus ingresos se dedica  a la venta de banano desde hace seis años.
Manuel desde  hace un tiempo había pensado en incrementar su negocio, pero no lo había logrado, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para poder comprar diferentes clases de banano como seda, oro, chocolate para luego venderlos.
Él tiene las esperanzas de conseguir, el crédito para poder obtener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Manuel, 38, is married and has a beautiful family with three children.  Two of them attend school in the community; the mother takes care of the other one.  The family lives in a community in Soloá.

Manuel's a hardworking and honest man who has earned a living selling banana trees for six years.

Manuel had been thinking about expanding his business for some time but hadn't been able to manage it.  That's why he's requesting a loan to buy different types of banana trees to sell: silk, gold, and chocolate.

He has goals to realize from the loan so he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy silk, gold, and chocolate banana trees

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run is originally from a rural area of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She is 57 years old, and she is a married mother of seven children. Four of them are dependent children that she needs to look after. Only three among her four dependent children are in school. For twelve years, the main source of her family's income has been from potato farming;  to earn more income, she  sells groceries as well.

Run’s group consists of two members. This is the second loan for Run with KIVA’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan helped her to have a better standard of living. Now, she has decided to lead the group to apply for this loan, with her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to do farming. She hopes that she could earn more income and be able to rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Connielyn

texts.en:
Connielyn is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her sewing business. She makes shorts, pajamas, and children's clothes, which are increasingly in demand in her town. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She is confident of a good outcome for her business, which will surely help cover their daily needs and fund her children's education.

Connielyn hopes for her children to finish school and to get a college education. She prays that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is 43 years old and married. She has four dependent children, one of whom is in school. She is a resident in a rural area of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming, potato farming and also working for other farms in her village. She has been doing this for the past 12 years. 

Mom’s group consists of three members; they are existing clients of VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid off the previous loans. The previous loans helped Mom to earn more income and enabled her to repair her house so that it looks better. Now she is leading the group to borrow this fourth loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to hire workers to work on her farm. She hopes that she can gain more profit so that she is able to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to hire workers

loans.name: Yevalyn

texts.en:
Yevalyn is a married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Yevalyn is 45 years old.

Yevalyn has a business selling bread in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more bread to offer for sale.

Yevalyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Yevalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more bread to offer for sale.

loans.name: Kumura

texts.ru: Кумура, 53 года, не замужем. У нее среднее образование, в марте 1988 года она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, этому делу она верна и по сегодняшний день. Благодаря упорному труду, Кумуры на сегодня у нее в хозяйстве есть 15 коров. Вместе с братом выращивают хлопок. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кумура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность приобрести земельный надел для полеводства.
texts.en: Kumura is 53 years old and not married. She has a secondary education and became involved in animal husbandry and farming in March of 1988, and is loyal to this business to this day. Thanks to Kumura's hard work, today her farm contains 15 cows. She and her brother also grow cotton. The monthly profit amounts up to 25,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Kumura requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep for fattening up and resale. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business in order to have an ability to buy a land plot for farming.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Neyda Alejandra

texts.es:
Neyda es una joven de 26 años, es la mayor de tres hermanos y  vive con su mamá en el departamento de Cochabamba – Bolivia, ya que sus padres se separaron hace años atrás, ella comenta que no pudo continuar con sus estudios universitarios luego de salir del colegio por falta de recursos económicos, por lo que comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar en la economía de su hogar, tiempo después con mucho esfuerzo inicio sus estudios en la universidad pero tuvo que abandonarlo nuevamente debido a que su trabajo le exigía mucho tiempo.
Actualmente Neyda trabaja como asistente en una empresa de venta de automóviles y durante las noches estudia la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial en la universidad, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para lograr cumplir su sueño de ser profesional, ya que considera que esto le permitirá ascender en su actual trabajo u optar por mejores puestos laborales, lo cual le ayudara a tener estabilidad económica para continuar ayudando a su mamá y apoyar a sus hermanos que siguen en colegio.
Neyda agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes a cumplir su sueño de ser profesional.
texts.en:
Neyda is only 26 years old. She is the oldest of three children and lives with her mother in the department of Cochabamba in Bolivia. Since her parents separated years ago, she was unable to continue with university studies after high school for lack of economic resources. For this reason, she began working at a young age to contribute to household expenses. Through much effort, she later began studying at university but had to abandon her studies again due to work demands.

Neyda currently works as an assistant in a car dealership and at night is studying Business Administration at the university. She is requesting an education loan to achieve her dream of becoming a professional. She believes this will allow her to move up in her current workplace or opt for better working positions, which will help her have economic stability to continue to help support her mother and siblings still in school.

Neyda is thankful to the people who provide the economic resources to help young people fulfill their dreams of becoming professionals.

loans.use: to pay for her coursework in Business Administration .

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad cuyas actividades principales son el comercio y la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una finca de café, esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola. El destino del crédito será para invertir en en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, así logrará una mejor producción y de esta manera podrá adquirir mayores ingresos para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 26 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and has one son.  He lives with his family in the Pomahuaca district, a community that specializes in trade and agriculture.  It is located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

He works in agriculture, and has a coffee field.  He has been doing this work for more than 10 years and so can count on his experience in this business and the good references from the people in his community.  Additionally, he works offering his services as a farmhand.

The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops, so he will achieve a better yield.  In this way he will be able to increase his income so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан, 47 лет, замужем. Уже 5 лет она занимается животноводством, супруг активно помогает по бизнесу. В хозяйстве Майрамкан есть 10 овец, 2 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду, Майрамкан на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Майрамкан является одним из 3 членов группы "Аялзат". Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 47 years old, married. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 5 years. Her husband actively helps her with the business. Mairamkan's farm contains 10 sheep and 2 cows. Thanks to her hard work, today she has a profit of about 10,000 som (KGS) per month. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Mairamkan is one of the three members of the Ayalzat group. Mairamkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and building a barn for livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: Juan de la Cruz tiene la edad de 31 años, con su ex pareja procrearon un hijo a quien le pasa una pensión alimenticia, Juan labora como Operario de limpieza en la Municipalidad, realizando limpiezas en las calles y cuneta de las zonas asignadas por su jefe inmediato, su jornada laboral son 8 horas diaria de lunes a Viernes, esta labor le permite mantener su familia y superar sus necesidades que se le presentan a diario. Con el crédito anterior que le brindó Afodenic mediante hizo un cuarto en casa de su mamá que es donde habita, esta obra le permite mayor espacio y comodidad; Don Juan que se siente muy alegre de poder ayudar a su mamá pues con otro créditos en fechas pasadas que obtuvo de Kiva pudo reparar el techo y así ah venido mejorando esta vivienda. Por sus gastos que ha presentado con sus mejoras no ha podido comprar su propio televisor y actualmente usa el que está en la sala que es de su mamá, pero ahora que tiene su cuarto piensa comprar un equipo aunque sea pequeño, no olvidando que su mayor necesidad de invertir este crédito es comprar tubos, duchas y otros accesorios para iniciar un baño dentro de su cuarto; posteriormente hará las divisiones de concreto, por ahora estará dividido con cortinas plásticas, a la vez hará las conexiones para salidas de aguas negras y pagara mano de obra de esta inversión razón por la cual solicita este financiamiento. Don Juan es una persona humilde y solo con el préstamo haría realidad este sueño de adquirir su equipo tener su baño dentro para mayor comodidad, como toda persona desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan de la Cruz is 31 years old. With his ex-partner, they had a child for whom he pays alimony. He is employed as a sanitation worker by the municipality, cleaning streets and gutters in zones assigned by his immediate supervisor. His work schedule is eight hours daily from Monday to Friday. This work allows him to support his family and cover his own daily needs.

With the previous loan received from AFODENIC, he built a room in his mother's home, which is where he lives, and this allows him a better, more comfortable living space.

Juan is very happy to help his mother. He used an older Kiva loan to repair the roof and has thus been improving her home. 

With the expenses incurred on the home repairs, he has not been able to buy his own TV set, so he's currently using his mother's set in the living room, but now that he has his own room, he is looking to buy his own set, even a small one.

He is not forgetting that his greatest need for a loan at the moment is to buy plumbing pipes, shower parts, and other accessories to start building a bathroom inside his room. Later he will install concrete walls, for now he will use plastic curtains.

He currently needs to install the wastewater drainage connections and pay for the plumbing, which is why he is asking for this loan. 

Juan is a man of humble means. Only with a loan would he achieve the dream of having his own TV set and his own bathroom for a more comfortable home. Like everyone else, he wants to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plumbing pipes, shower parts, and pay for labor to install a bathroom in his room. Also to buy a TV set so he can stay informed of local and world news.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentin tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 04 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su cónyugue en el caserío de Ñuruñupe, distrito de San Felipe. El caserío de Ñuruñupe es un caserío mediano el cual se encuentra ubicado a unos 60 minutos del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. En dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Valentin se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de maíz, los cuales se encuentran con 25 días de sembrado, dichos productos son comercializados en el distrito de San Felipe y se encuentran en muy buen estado, Valentin cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, además él se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, frejol, etc. los cuales son para su consumo, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Valentin is 42 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and has 4 dependent children.  He lives with his family in the village of Ñuruñupe, in the San Felipe district.  The Ñuruñupe village is moderately sized and is located some 60 minutes from the district of Pucará, in the Chiclayo province, within the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.  In said district, the main economic activities are agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Valentin works in agriculture, and has corn fields, which have been planted for 25 days.  The yield from his crops are sold in the San Felipe district and are of good quality. Valentin has more than 10 years of experience in agriculture.  He also farms subsistence crops such as yucca, beans, etc. which are for his own food.  He has very good personal and business references in his community.

The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his corn crops.  In this way he will be able to earn a decent profit to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his corn crops.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 38-year-old married woman who engages in fishing. She has two children, ages 18 and 13 years old. She and her husband have been engaged in fishing for ten years. In addition to that, she also grows and sells seaweed.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, nylon, and seaweed seedlings. These will help improve her farming livelihood. It will increase her ongoing catch at the same time, so she could sell a huge volume of fish. In these ways, Angelina could now expand her business and be able to handle her finances.

She is hoping that she will be able to continue to send her children to school and be able to manage both her businesses properly for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon, and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 36 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Lea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lea has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Lea aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support herself. She is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for making dried fish.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making dried fish.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей (сын и 4 дочери). У Карамат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Карамат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 20 овец. На 0,82 Га земли она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Карамат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья и удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Карамат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Karamat is 48 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 5 children (a son and 4 daughters). Karamat has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry, having started her business 15 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Karamat's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows, 20 sheep, and 0.82 hectares of land, where she grows clover. Her monthly income amounts up to 20,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Karamat requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and to buy fertilizers for cultivating the land. Karamat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and to buy fertilizers for cultivating the land

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jackielou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to resell in her store.

Jackielou has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Jackielou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell in her store

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is a resident in a rural area of Koh Sotin district of Kompong Cham province. She is 59 years old and a widow.  She has two children. One of them is still a dependent child who Chantha needs to look after. The source of her family’s income is from smoking tobacco farming, corn farming and sesame farming. She can earn around 50,900 KHR for her family's daily needs.
 
Chantha’s group consists of four members and this is their third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped Chantha to have a better standard of living. Now, she is leading her group to take this loan and will use her portion to hire farm workers. 

She hopes that she will earn more money to support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to hire farm workers.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Rocio Juanita

texts.es:
Rocio es una mujer de 26 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 3 y 1 año, y su negocio es la venta ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, alegre, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘mutualista’ un área céntrica que alberga a edificios de comercios, públicos, universidades, escuelas y todo tipo de empresas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Rocio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como plomero y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y los menores son bebés. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano;  su trabajo consiste en escoger las mejores ropas de segunda mano para venderlas en su puesto de venta fijo, ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otro negocio; la venta de productos naturales para la salud. “inicié mi negocio de forma ambulante con la venta de algunas prendas, poco a poco fui creciendo y ahora cuento con un puesto fijo de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la facilidad con que sus productos se venden, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio y mejorar los ingresos. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para aumentar su oferta y mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para competir en el mercado y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Rocio is 26 years old, lives with her partner, has 3 children aged 10, 3, and 1, and has a business selling secondhand clothes. She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, is cheerful, steady, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is in the 'mutualista’ zone: a downtown area that houses shops buildings, public buildings, universities, schools, and companies of all kinds. It has a warm tropical climate with temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Rocio has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she ties up. She is short, with a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish when she is in town and dealing with her business. She shares her life with her partner who works as a plumber, and with her children; the oldest of whom studies in school, and the children are babies. 

Her business is selling second hand clothes; her job is to choose the best second-hand clothes to sell in her stall. She needs to stock her business with a greater variety and quantity of clothing to compete in the market, and also wants to open another business: selling natural health products. "I started my business selling door to door, selling some clothes, and little by little it grew and now I have a permanent stall ..." she says. The advantage of her business is the ease with which its products are sold, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in her business to improve revenues. 

Her dream is to open a clothing store, and she wants to buy second-hand clothing wholesale, in order to increase supply and improve her income. This her first loan with the institution in her three years working in this field.  It is for these reasons that Rocio is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale clothing to compete in the market and open a store.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale to be able to compete with the market and open a store.

loans.name: Segundo Alejandro

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y las actividades principales son la agricultura y la crianza de animales, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalero y agricultor contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más herramientas así como para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento sus cultivos, con esto Segundo espera brindar un mejor servicio lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 41 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and lives with his family in the Oyotún district.  He lives in a rural area where life is calm and the main economic activities are agriculture and livestock.  The district is located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

He works as a laborer and farmer, counts on his own tools to work, and has more than 3 years of experience in the business.  He is requesting the loan to buy more tools as well as manure and fertilizer to maintain his crops.  With this loan, he hopes to offer a better service that will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm tools as well as manure and fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
María Tomasa tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, conocida en el medio por la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores. Vive en casa familiar con su hijo de 15 años quien estudia en colegio nacional de la zona, su cónyuge trabaja en una empresa agrícola de la zona desde hace más de 02 años. María es una persona con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti, habitada por gente de campo que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Tomasa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos y patos, desde hace más de 05 años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en arreglo de motor de su moto carguera, ya que es con esta con la transporta a sus animales para la venta, con esto María podrá asegurar el traslado de sus animales para su posterior venta y asi sus ingresos no se vean afectados, esto le permitirá tener una estabilidad económica que mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Tomasa is 45 years old, is married, and known in the middle for her work raising and selling small animals. She lives in a family home with her son who is 15 years old and studies in a local school in the region, and her husband has worked on an agricultural farm in the area for more than 2 years. María is a person with good references from her neighbors. She lives in a community located in the district of Cayalti, inhabited by country people who make a living in agricultural and animal husbandry, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.

María Tomasa makes a living raising and selling small animals such as pigs and ducks for more than 5 years, and she has experience in this business and with good references on the part of her neighbors. She needs a loan to invest in accordance with a freighter jet engine, as it is with this that her animals are transported for sale. With this María will be able to ensure the movement of her animals for resale and thus her earnings are not affected. This will permit her to have economic stability which will improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to invest in fixing the motor of her bike freighter, which is what she uses to transport her animals for sale.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 53 años de edad, es separada, vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta de estación como chirimoya, piña, naranja, lima entre otras, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de fruta para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le generará mayores niveles de ventas lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paula is 53 years old, is separated, and lives in her own house made of rustic materials. She lives in the rural district of Pucará, a community where life is quiet and its inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock farming, and is located in the province Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Paula sells seasonal fruit such as custard apple, pineapple, orange, and lime, among others. She has experience in this business and regular customers who provide very good personal and work references. 

She will use this loan to invest in buying a larger amount of fruit to increase the stock of her business, which will generate higher sales, and have a positive impact on her income level and thus may improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: invest in purchasing more fruit to increase her business supply.

loans.name: Icah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Icah. Icah lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her children. Icah owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and kind mobile provider. As a woman, Icah realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Icah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. In the near future, Icah’s goal regarding Ruma is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community.  This is Ruma’s latest product which is called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Icah is the one who is standing in front of her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit.

loans.name: Vinai

texts.en:
Vinai is 30 years old. She is a married woman who has two children, who are all of the dependent children she needs to look after. She lives in Kompong Siem district of Kompong Cham province.

The main source of her family’s income is generated from her career as a goldsmith jeweler and also selling groceries for more than ten years. She can earn around twenty-three dollars per days to meet her family’s needs.

Vinai is an existing client who has been borrowing loans from VisionFund for two cycles already, and completely paid back the loans. The previous loan helped her to increase her income and have a better living condition. Now, she decided to borrow the third loan in order to buy a goldsmith motor to support her career.

She hopes that she can earn more income and enough ability to send her children to school when they become six years old.

loans.use: to buy a goldsmith motor to support her career.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Narcizo tiene 47 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue y sus cinco hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad rural donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganaderia, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo de café. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle llevar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Narciso is 47 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic material with his spouse and five children in the district of Pomahuaca, a rural community where villagers work in agriculture and livestock, located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Narcisco works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee of the catimore variety, and has about 15 years of experience. The loan he is requesting will be used for his farming, application and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers and labor for weeding his coffee crops. This will help the physiological, morphological and production of his crops, as well as allow for a timely harvest and therefore have increased production and better product quality, so he won’t have problems selling his product that will generate higher income that will allow lead a better quality of life.

loans.use: used for his farming, application and incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers, and labor for weeding his coffee crop.

loans.name: Teth

texts.en:
Teth and his wife (both seen here in the picture) own a small grocery shop, where they also fix motors. Besides this business at home, Teth has five hectare of big land, hired to the neighborhood to do farming. 

Teth's wife Sovi needs to stand by in the shop the whole day, and Teth is in need of energy to fix his customers' motors at night time. They need to consume a lot of energy to run their business through the night time; however, the car battery they use is not reliable. Sometime the battery runs out without notice. Therefore, they have to stop business after the night turns to dark. They have to spend a lot of energy and time to charge the car battery for everyday use. 

For this reason, Teth and his wife have decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system for sustaining the business’ energy usage, and also their family usage. They believe solar home energy can help improve their business condition, and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Abla est une femme divorcée et mère de cinq  enfants.  Pour avoir son revenu, Abla prépare et vend du riz préparé avec de l’haricot et des œufs qu’elle vend dans son quartier. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Abla demande ce crédit pour commander des œufs, du haricot et du riz afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour soutenir  les charges quotidiennes de ses enfants
texts.en: Abla, 46 years old, is divorced and has five children. In order to make a living, she cooks rice with beans as well as eggs for sale in her neighborhood. In order to meet customer demand efficiently, Abla stocks up at the market twice a month. She is seeking this loan in order to stock up on eggs, beans and rice to earn a higher revenue and be able to cover her children’s everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy 36 packs of eggs and some bowls of rice and beans.

loans.name: Condor Tiana Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CONDOR TIANA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytrambo, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Catalina tiene 47 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zanahorias, tomates entre otros.
Los se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Condor Tiana communal bank.  The bank is located in the Ollantaytrambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Catalina, age 47, is single and has two children.  The member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling vegetables.  She has been in her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

The member is requesting the loan to buy carrots and tomatoes, among others.

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to makes her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy carrots and tomatoes, among others.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en:
Bunafsha is a hardworking woman. She was born in small village in 1987, and is now married with four children. Bunafsha is a responsible, confident, generous and kind person. She is a businesswoman, and does business selling and buying clothes and shoes. Her start-up business was trading kid’s wear. She has enough experience to do her business better in order to live in good conditions. 

Bunafsha is asking for financial support to buy additional goods and attract more clients. She awaits Kiva project mercy.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and attract more clients.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Purisunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS PURISUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Fidel 48 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
Los socios que salen adjuntos en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, carpintería y negocio de venta de comida.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “Llapanchis Purisunchis.”  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member Fidel is 48 years old, has 3 children and is in a relationship.  He works daily in the carpentry business.  He is a responsible and persevering person.  He has spent a good amount of time in this business which is going well thanks to the diligent effort he puts every day into his business. It is in this way that he supports his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood.

The other members work at selling clothes, selling handicrafts, selling groceries, and selling food.  The members whose pictures are attached to the photo asked permission to arrive late for work reasons.  

Fidel is thankful to those who form part of his dream in this way, and he commits to making the loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Saturdinop

texts.es:
Saturdinop tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue sus 4 hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el crédito que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes y mano de obra para deshierbo de su cultivo de maíz. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Saturdinop, age 38, lives in his own house, which is made of rustic material.  He lives with his wife and their four children in the Pucará district.  The community devotes itself to agriculture and livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He works in agriculture, and he grows corn.  He has ten years of experience in the field.  He will use the loan that will be granted to him in his agricultural work, applying and incorporating plant health products and fertilizers, and paying for labor to weed his corn crop.  

This will help to improve his crop, physiologically, morphologically, and productively.  It will also help him to have a timely harvest, and in the end he will have greater production and better quality of product.  For this reason he will have no problem selling his product, which will generate better earnings and improvements in his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, applying and incorporating plant health products and fertilizers, and paying for labor to weed his corn crop.

loans.name: Jimmy Junior

texts.es:
Jimmy Junior tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz y café, comercio de los mismos, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público por medio de una mototaxi, hace un promedio de hace 6 años. Ha solicitado un préstamo para realizar mantenimiento en su mototaxi y de esta manera brindar un servicio más seguro a sus pasajeros lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jimmy Junior is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and son in the Pucará district, a community with warm weather. 

It is a community of farmers. They grow and sell fruits, rice and coffee. It is located in the Jaén Province, which is a part of the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru. 

For the past six years, he has provided a public transportation service via a ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle]. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to perform maintenance on his mototaxi and, in this way, provide his customers with a safer service.  This will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ma. Junosie

texts.en:
Ma. Junosie runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as noodles, bread, pouch vinegar and soy sauce, cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, soap and other goods. She is a 50-year-old, married woman with five children. Four of them are still attending school. Her husband earns a living through being a driver.

Ma Junosie has requested for a loan to buy stock for the store such as soft drinks, rice, corn and other assorted stocks. These will fill her store with various goods, and could attract more buyers to come and shop, thus, improving her sales and augmenting her income. Ma. Junosie hopes that with the additional capital she will be able to expand her sari-sari store for the improvement of her livelihood, and also provide her children with their basic needs including quality education.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as soft drinks, rice, corn and other assorted stocks.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham province, Saroen is aged 46 years and married. She has three children, two of whom are dependents and one who is still in school. The others have their own employment to support their living. To support her big family, Saroen does potato farming and has also worked for other farms for 26 years. The current business earns her family about 32,900 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Saroen is an existing client and has borrowed a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for one cycle already. She completely repaid the first loan, which helped her to have a better standard of living. Now, she is leading this group, consisting of two members, to apply for a second loan, with her portion used to buy fertilizer for her farm. Saroen hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is 44 years old. She is a married woman with five children, four of whom are dependent children that she needs to respond for. Only two dependent children among the four are in school. Phalla lives in a rural area of Sangke district of Battambang province. For twelve years, the sources of her family's income have been rice farming, fishing and selling groceries.

Phalla’s group consists of three members. She has been an existing client of VisionFund for eight cycles already and has completely paid back her loans. The previous loan helped her to have a better standard of living and gave her the ability to send her children to school. Now, she is leading the group to apply for this loan, which she will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer for farming and more groceries to sell. She hopes that she can earn more money and expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer for farming and more groceries to sell

loans.name: Chaerudin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Chaerudin. 

Chaerudin lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around  5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his family. Chaerudin owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system.
