His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Chaerudin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Chaerudin’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community, using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Chaerudin is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en: Samet and his wife (both in the picture) run a grocery store in Preaek Chamlak Village with three dependent children. Samet wants his grocery store to be famous in his area. Their grocery store has many products; therefore, they need to get up early to prepare their shop before the sun rises. Currently, they use a car battery to provide energy to their business; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes, the car battery runs out during night time. After getting a good recommendation from their neighbor who uses a solar home system, Samet and his wife decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve energy to run their business and also save on the utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Preaek Chamlak Village, Kanh Chor Commune, Chhlong

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.en:
Mahmudjon, a capable man, was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1993. Single and living with his parents in a small village, he is a university student, well known among friends and students. 

Mahmudjon lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition fees, and so is requesting a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders for that purpose. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans et mère d’un enfant. Akouavi vit à Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Akouavi vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Akouavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Akouavi demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz et de sucre afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Akouavi is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of one. Akouavi lives in Adidogomé to start her business. Akouavi sells general food products to earn her living and help her family. Akouavi stocks up once a month at the market. Akouavi is asking for this loan to buy bags of rice and sugar in order to make some money to support her husband with the family’s expenses and to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 5 backs of rice and 4 bags of sugar

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée, Antoinette vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Agée de 31 ans, Antoinette est une commerçante de petits poissons fumés qui circule dans tout son quartier et satisfait agréablement ses clients. Antoinette trouve son revenu à travers ce commerce. Antoinette s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander des paniers de poissons, Antoinette sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le bénéfice qui pourrait soutenir son mari à favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: A married woman, Antoinette lives in Adidogomé with her two children. At 31 years old, Antoinette sells small smoked fish and circulates all over her neighborhood and satisfies her clients nicely. Antoinette earns her income through this business. Antoinette stocks up twice a month at the market of Lomé. To order baskets of fish, Antoinette is seeking this microloan to make this purchase in order to get the income, which will help her husband in paying for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of small fish

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 66 ans. Habitant à Adidogomé, Afi est une mère de huit enfants à sa charge et travaille activement pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Afi  vend des éponges en parcourant tout son quartier afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients. Afi achète ses articles une fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander quelques éponges. Afi souhaite tirer un bénéfice afin de contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman who is 66. Living in Adidogomé, Afi is the mother of eight and actively works for their flourishing. To meet her needs, Afi sells sponges all over her neighborhood in order to satisfy her clients nicely. Afi buys her items once a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order some sponges. Afi hopes to earn a profit in order to help pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen sponges

loans.name: Raim's Group

texts.en:
Raim is 48 years old, and she is a married mother of two dependent children who are in school. She lives in a rural area of Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. The source of her family's income for over ten years has been from rice farming, potato farming and feeding ducks and chickens. She could earn around 25,000 KHR and could save around 10,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan cycle for Raim's group, which consists of two members, with VisionFund. She is leading the group to apply for this loan, which she will use her portion to buy seeds and hire workers to work on her farm. She hopes that she could earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire workers

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mutumba Business Group

texts.fr:
Agricole fait partie du groupe  Mutumba Business et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 65 ans et est marié à Séraphine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 22 à 30 ans.
Il a sous sa charge 2 petits enfants  qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de la bière industrielle   depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une maison en matériaux  durables, et voir ses petits fils  étudier.
texts.en:
Agricole is a part of the Mutumba Business group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 65 and married to Séraphine, a farmer. Together, they have 3 children, ages 22 – 30. He takes care of two grandchildren who attend school.

He has been in the business of selling factory beer for 10 years. 

He is on his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he gets, he is going to augment his capital and buy a lot of cases of beer to resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to build a house with durable materials and to pay for his grandsons to go to school.

loans.use: to augment his capital and buy a lot of cases of beer to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
This is Jesse, a 56-year-old resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Regina, who manages their household, they have three children, Jesse has been working hard selling generic medicines for the past four to provide for his family's needs and for his children's education. He also has a mineral water business which his wife manages for extra income.

Jesse buys medicines at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations, Jesse is requesting a Php 19,000 loan to pay for generic medicines and gallons of water to sell. He expects a boost in  income as he expands his business. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help and a good return on his investment; it will be of great help in sending his children to school and maintaining their daily sustenance.
 
Jesse hopes to be able to grow and increase his sales, and dreams of giving all his children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for generic medicines and mineral water to sell

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Kolab is originally from a rural area of Bovel district of Battambang province. She is 53 years old, and she is a widowed mother who has three dependent children; one of them is studying in a university. The sources of her family income are rice farming, potato farming, and working for another farm for 10 years. She can earn around 64,000 KHR per day.

Kolab has been borrowing from Kiva’s partner VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles already and has completely paid back her loan. The previous loan helped her to earn more income to support her family. Now she has applied for this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming. She hopes that she will be able to gain more profit and have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mouk's Group

texts.en:
Mouk is 58-years-old, married,  and the father of three children, one of whom is a dependent child. He is a resident in a rural area of Chhloung district of Kratie province. The sources of his family income are from potato farming and working for other farms for the past thirty-eight years. He could earn around 52,000 KHR and could save around 25,000 KHR for when needed. 
Mouk’s group consists of two members, and this is the fifth loan for him with KIVA’s partner, VisionFund. He is leading this group to take this fifth loan and will use his portion to buy farming supply for his farm. He hopes to earn more income and for his potato farm to be fruitful.

loans.use: to buy farming supply for his farm

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is a generous woman. She was born in a rural area in 1987. She is married and has three children. She is a businesswoman with five years experience running her own business, and her husband helps her.

Her first business was sewing traditional women's dresses, and than she kept cattle. She has the right conditions to keep livestock at her house because there is a lot of grass on their land and in the nearby garden. She is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 44 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsie has been farming rice for four years and also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Turinah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Turinah. Turinah lives in Cirebon, located in West Java, around five hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. Turinah owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and trusted mobile provider.  As a woman, Turinah realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Turinah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Turinah’s goal for her Ruma service in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product, which is called Mapan. In the photo, Turinah is shown sitting in front of her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, thus giving her community better access to communication services

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es una señora casada, Cristina tiene 19 años de edad y su hijo tiene 2 años, el esposo de Cristina se dedica a trabajar de obrero en una planta florícola, Cristina se dedica  a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, cristina necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para criarlos en un corral que tiene en la casa de su madre, Cristina es una joven alegre que lo que aspira es sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman who is 19 years of age and has a two-year-old son. Her husband works as a laborer for a company that produces flowers.

Cristina raises and sells small animals, so she needs a loan in order to invest in chickens to raise. The animals will be kept in a coop at her mother’s house. Cristina is a cheerful young woman who aspires to get ahead on behalf of her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 92 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 92 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Ils habitent dans le même quartier et font pratiquement différentes activités. Ils se réunissent aussi tous les fins de mois et organisent des tontines. Maïmouna est leur présidente, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter du sucre, lait, chocolat et des jus pour fabriquer des crèmes glacées. Elle détient un congélateur dans la maison qu'elle a acheter avec ses propres revenus. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Avec les revenus de son activité, elle voudrait acheter un autre congélateur pour pouvoir augmenter ses produits et élargir le nombre des employés qui vont vendre les crèmes glacées au marché.
texts.en:
Jiguène Bakhna 92 is a sub-group of the Association des Femmes Commerçantes (Association for Business Women) in Pout. They live in the same neighborhood and work different businesses practically. They also meet at the end of every month and organize group finances. 

Maïmouna is their president; she is married and a mother. She has more than 5 years of experience and is requesting this amount to buy sugar, milk, chocolate, and some juices to make ice cream. She possesses a freezer that she bought with her own revenues in her home. She helps her husband in managing daily expenses and the costs of schooling their children. With the revenues from her business, she would like to buy another freezer to be able to increase her production and expand the number of employees who go out to sell the ice creams at the market.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, chocolate, and juices for making ice cream.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
Guzal is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is widowed and has three children. She is busy in agriculture and basically plants cereals. She is a responsible, honest and kind person. She tries to work hard because she needs to feed her family and have a better standard of living.

Each year, Guzal plants cereal and wheat. If there is less water and a dry season, she cannot have a good harvest. She loves to do business in agriculture.

Guzal wants to buy livestock and land for agriculture. Unfortunately, to accomplish her plans, she had not enough knowledge and opportunity. She asked for help from IMON and had a great opportunity to participate at Startup training.

Now she has enough knowledge and asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy cattle. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hilola

texts.en: Hilola is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of the country in 1991. She is married and has three children. Hilola is an honest and capable person. Her husband is a construction worker in Russia. Their annual income is very small to feed and provide for their growing children. Hilola decided to help her husband and asked IMON for advice about how to start a business. She participated in Startup training, which was provided by IMON and provided her with enough knowledge to start her own business. She planned to start an agriculture business, but she did not have enough money. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and onion sets. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy livestock and onion sets

loans.name: Jacaranda Group

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la fabricación de puertas metálicas.
Él es emprendedor, inteligente, de buen carácter, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona central que es una mixtura entre lo ancestral, colonial, republicano y moderno, es donde se fusionan costumbres ancestrales de los pueblos originarios con la vida moderna y actual, de clima privilegiado: templado, primaveral y de días soleados durante casi todo el año.
Vicente es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la comparte con su padre que trabaja. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la cerrajería; él se ocupa de fabricar puertas, ventanas, mesas, sillas, mostradores, etc., todo de metal, actividad que realiza durante el día de lunes a sábado en su taller que se encuentra en su domicilio. “inicie mi negocio como ayudante, después me independicé y necesito un préstamo para trabajar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con amplia experiencia, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de planchas metálicas, tubos de acero y otros. Su sueño es tener un taller amplio y con muchos clientes, él desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo como; planchas metálicas, tubos de acero, material de soldadura, lijas, limas y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Vicente solícita un préstamo para la compra de material de cerrajería para continuar trabajando e independizarse.
texts.en:
Vicente is a 27 year old man who is single and without children, and his business is the manufacturing of metal doors.

He is entrepreneurial, intelligent, of good character, responsible and hardworking. He does in job in the central region which is a mixture of ancestral, colonial, republican and modern, where ancient customs of the indigenous people are fused with modern and contemporary life. There is a privileged climate: mild, spring and sunny days for most of the year.

Vicente is of dark complexion, with brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, and robust physique. His maternal language is Quechua which he speaks in this location and he speaks Spanish in general culture and for the business that he does. He shares his life with his father who works. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a tin roof that has electric energy and well water. His business is in locksmith; he deals with the manufacture of doors, windows, tables, chairs, desks, etc., all metal which he does during the day from Monday through Saturday in his workshop at home. "I started my business as an assistant, then I went solo and I need a loan for working..." he says. The advantage is that his business has extensive experience, and the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy metal plates, steel pipes, and others. His dream is to have a big workshop and many customers, he wants to make the purchase of work material such as: metal plates, steel pipes, solder, sandpaper, files, and others. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 4 years since developing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Vicente is requesting a loan to buy locksmith materials to continue working and becoming independent.

loans.use: to buy locksmith equipment to continue working and becoming independent.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria esta casada, cruza por los 40 años de edad, Gloria tiene una hija de 16 años, un hijo de 20 y el otro de 22 años de edad, la señorita de 16 años se encuentra estudiando, el esposo de Gloria se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, Gloria se dedica a apoyar a su esposo en sus actividades y el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca que es la fuente de sus ingresos para su familia y Gloria  espera por medio de su negocio mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children: a 16-year-old daughter who attends school, and two sons who are 20 and 22 years old.

Gloria and her husband are farmers and ranchers, and she will use the funds from this loan to invest in the purchase of a cow. Animals are the family's source of income, and Gloria is hopeful that her business will allow her to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Wijayanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Wijayanti. Wijayanti lives in Semarang, located in Central Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.

Wijayanti is a young lady who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. She owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as a kind and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Wijayanti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community.

Wijayanti’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product, called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Wijayanti is the one who is sitting in front of her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a bright woman who was born in a rural area in 1987. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in a small village. Fotima is a farmer who wants to widen her business of keeping cattle and growing crops. She doesn't have the money to improve her business but she tries her best in order to live better. 

Fotima's husband is also a farmer  Each year they plant onions, watermelon and cereals but because of lack of water, they did not have a good harvest. Fotima is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders and IMON to buy cattle and agricultural products. She hopes to be supported and have a good business.

loans.use: To buy cattle and agricultural products

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Juliet successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. NWTF is re-listing Juliet's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 38 ans, Séraphine est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses cinq enfants. Commerçante ambulante, Séraphine vend des oignons et des tomates dans son quartier et ses alentours afin d’avoir son revenu. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Séraphine s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Séraphine demande ce crédit pour commander des oignons et des tomates afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Séraphine is a 38 year old married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her five children. Itinerant merchant, Séraphine sells onions and tomatoes in her neighborhood and nearby in order to make her revenue. To effectively respond to her needs, Séraphine resupplies once per month at the market. Séraphine is requesting this loan to order onions and tomatoes so as to achieve even more profit to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of onions and one basket of tomatoes

loans.name: Nuraiym

texts.ru: Нурайым 42 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Нурайым, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 0,4 ГА собственной земли, на которой она выращивает картофель. В хозяйстве есть 7 коров, 3 из них дойные. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 3 молодых бычков для откорма и реализации. Нурайым намерена расширить свой бизнес, что позволит накопить на строительство сарая.
texts.en: Nuraiym is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her perseverance, dedication and hard work, she currently owns 0.4 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes.  She also has seven cows, three of which are dairy cows.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy three young bulls for fattening and resale.  Nuraiym intends to expand her business, which will help her to save some money to build a barn.

loans.use: to purchase three young bulls for fattening and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Heriansyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Heriansyah. He lives in Semarang, located in Central Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Heriansyah is a young guy who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. Heriansyah decided to join Ruma because he had already heard that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Heriansyah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Heriansyah’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to service an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. Heriansyah appears in the photo standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits

loans.name: Burulbubu

texts.ru: Бурулбубу 61 год, вдова, 4 детей, образование среднее. С 1982 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Бурулбубу имеет 3 коровы, 43 овцы. Также на 2,0 ГА собственной земли она выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации. Бурулбубу знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, увеличения прибыли от ведения бизнеса, Бурулбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Бурулбубу намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на постройку сарая и улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en:
Burulbubu is 61 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming since 1982.  She currently has three cows and 43 sheep on her farm.  She also grows potatoes and alfalfa for resale on two hectares of her own land.  Burulbubu is familiar with agricultural technology and she knows how to invest her money for the intended purpose.

In order to further grow her farming business and increase the income she makes from her activity, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening and resale.  Burulbubu intends to increase her livestock headcount.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to save some money to build a barn and improve the material situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy some livestock for fattening and resale in order to boost her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, contante, amable, alegre, resposnable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, área residencial y muy poblada, casas antiguas y rústicas,  muchas sin acceso a servicios básicos, conviven formando un lugar de comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas. Los suelos de esta parte son predominantemente arenas; finas y otras limosas,  de clima cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), y otros.., actividad que realiza en su domicilio; con unas mesas y sillas ordenadas en las afueras cubiertas con un par de sombrillas, de lunes a sábado dejando el domingo para abastecerse y organizar su siguiente semana. “fue mi abuela quién me enseñó a cocinar, mis familiares me animaron a independizarme y ahora soy dueña de mi propio negocio… ” Comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la zona es muy popular y los clientes no le faltan, la desventaja es la competencia y la falta de capital de inversión. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una cocina, una garrafa y utensilios como; cubiertos, ollas y sartenes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina, garrafa de gas y utensilios de cocina para cocinarles a muchos clientes.
texts.en: Juana is a 25 year old woman. She lives with her partner, and has no children. Her business is to sell traditional food. She is entrepreneurial, independent, content, kind, joyful, responsible, and hard working. She handles her business in the southern zone of the city, a residential, very populated area with old and rustic homes, many without access to basic services. They have partnered to form a place of business and manufacturing in all areas. The foundation in this area is predominantly sandy, fine and limy, with a warm climate and a temperature which fluctuates between 21-35 degrees Celsius. Juana is dark complected, with ong, black hair tied back, dark eyes, short stature, thin built. Her native tongue is Guarani which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish as general knowledge and for business. She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver. They live in a rented room, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof. They have drinking water, electricity and sewage. Her business is traditional food, such as:  Sopa de Remojado (bone soup,) cogote relleno (creole chicken neck with a stuffing which could be of potatoes and churiqui,) sopa de mani (peanut soup,) rice with cheese (rice, milk, cheese,) and others. She does this at her own home,  with tables and chairs arranged outdoors and covered with a couple of sunshades. She works from Monday to Saturday, leaving Sunday to organize herself and prepare for the following week. "It was my grandmother who taught me how to cook, my relatives encouraged me to work by myself and now I own my own business.." she stated. The advantage of her business is that the zone is very popular and she has many clients. The disadvantage is the competition and the lack of investment capital. She wants to expand her business by buying a stove, a can of propane gas and utensils such as silverware, pots, and skillets. This is the first loan with the institution in one year of doing business independently. Thus, Juana is asking for a loan to buy a stove, a can of propane gas, and kitchen utensils to cook for many clients.

loans.use: To purchase a stove, a large can of propane gas, and kitchen utensils to cook for many clients.

loans.name: Tuychibek

texts.en: Tuychibek is a bright man. He was born in a rural area in 1996. He lives with his parents in a small village. He is single. This is his first time getting a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders. He is an honest, capable, responsible and hardworking student. He graduated with excellence from his secondary school and entered a university. His parents do not have money to pay the university tuition, but they want to educate their child. He is seeking a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to pay his tuition fee. Otherwise, he would not be able to pursue his education. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay university tuition

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene, 51 years old, is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past eleven years, Marlene has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Alma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is single and she works hard to support herself. For the past five years, Anabelle has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Anabelle would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Jona works hard to support her family. She has a retail clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jona is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as pants, school uniforms, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing for her business.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, school uniforms, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn, 42 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 18 years, Roselyn has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Alimahan

texts.ru: Алимахан 55 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Алимахан занимается животноводством и земледелием, стартовав 35 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Алимахан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Алимахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы накопить на образование ее внучки.
texts.en: Alimahan is 55 years old and the mother of two children.  For the past 35 years, she has been working in animal husbandry and crop farming.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows on her farm.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy one additional cow.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business, in order to save some money toward her granddaughter's education.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Aly  est l’homme  au milieu attrapant la corde attaché  au   mouton. 
Aly  est un cultivateur âgé de 48 ans  marié, père de 05 enfants tous âgés de 12 à 02 ans dont 03 sont scolarisés et 02 non scolarisés, et sa femme fait l’élevage et le ménage, une chose qui l’aide à subvenir au bien être de la famille. Il est  alphabétisé car il a eu une chance d’aller  d’aller à l’école.  
Ali est un éleveur  de moutons dévoué dans son travail et  n’ayant pas en procession  beaucoup de  fonds pour exercer au mieux son activité d’embouche ,donc  c’est suite à ce manque de fonds qu’il  a  fait recourt à L’IMF pour avoir plus d’ argent pour pourvoir générer son activité ,pour pouvoir acheter plus de moutons pour le développement de son activité .
Aly a un rêve préférentiel pour le développement de son embouche  c’est avoir de l’argent avec  l’IMF au besoin. Il s’approvisionne dans les foires de la localité et il les revend dans les mêmes foires locales. Il est confronté souvent à quelques obstacles sur le marché tel que la chute des    prix.
texts.en:
Aly is the man in the middle holding the rope tied to the goat. 

Aly is a 48 year old married farmer and father of five children, from ages 2 to 12, three of which are in school and two are not. His wife raises the children and takes care of the house, which helps him provide for his family's wellness. He is literate, since he had the opportunity to go to school. 

Aly is a goat farmer devoted to his work and does not possess much funding to optimize his animal raising business. So, following this lack of funds, he appealed to the IMF for more money to be able to generate business and to buy more goats to develop his business.

Aly has an advantageous dream for the development of his farming of having money with IMF if needed. He resupplies in the local fairs and he sells them again in the same local fairs. He is often confronted with some obstacles in the market, such as falling prices.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell later.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carmencita works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Carmencita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Femy

texts.en:
Femy is 52 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Femy works very hard to provide for them.

Femy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Femy has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Femy would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en: Celeste, 34 years old, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Celeste has operated a livestock business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell. In the future, Celeste would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Consolacion works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Consolacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, etc. for her store.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is the age of 20, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them through his shop. He has been selling gent's shoes only but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well according to customer’s demand but the major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Asma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushing ladies shoes as well. 

Asma is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her husband's shoe shop.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is 35 years old and living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a costume jewelry shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and lives near his shop. His shop is situated in the main market and it is challenging for him to sell his products with his competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales. To grow his business and income and abstain from the competitors, he decided to offer some additional and stylish jewelry items. Saima's husband hopes that this strategy will work positively and the customers will be attracted toward his new products. Therefore, Saima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy some additional and stylish jewelry items. She says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some additional and stylish jewelry items for her husband's jewelry shop

loans.name: Om Hanin Al- Setin Group

texts.en:
These are the four members of Om Hanin Al- Setin group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of Hodeidah, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Joma'a is the group's coordinator. She is 25 years old and married with one child. Selling ice cream in the streets is the sole source of income for Joma'a family. Her income is very small. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase the necessary ingredients to make ice cream to further expand her business. This loan will help Joma'a to make ice cream in different and delicious flavors that will make her able to attract a lot of customers, which will increase her profits. Joma'a will use most of this loan's profits to renovate her house, which is very old, to provide her family with a safe living space.  

Joma'a hopes to increase both her clientele and her income.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary ingredients to make ice cream to further expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new oven for her kitchen

loans.name: Seang Ly's Group

texts.en:
Seang Ly is originally from a rural area of Kampong Svay district of Kampong Thom province. She is 60 years old, and she is a widowed woman who has four dependent children, two of whom are in school. The main source of her family income is from rice farming for 30 years, and to earn more income to support her family, she is also a worker. She could earn around 30,000 KHR per day and save around 15,000 KHR daily for when it's needed. 
This is the eighth micro-loan for Seang Ly’s group, which consists of two members. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan with the portion to build a toilet. She hopes that her family will live in sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to build a toilet

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru: Садафмо 34 летняя замужняя женщина. Она вместе семьей проживает в районе Чиликул. У нее трое детей. Садафмо талантливая женщина. У нее золотые руки. Садафмо раньше занималась швейным делом. Сейчас Садафмо занимается поваром.  Она вкусно готовить. Садафмо любить готовит вкусное блюдо. Она хочет открыть столовая, где основным блюдом является “Курутоб”. “Курутоб”- это национальное блюдо, которое готовят с лепешкой и помидорным салатом. У нее большая мечта вбудушем. Ей никому обратится кроме Вас. По этой причине она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Садафмо будет очень рада за Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Sadafmo is a 34-year old married woman. She and her family live in the Jilikul region. She has three children. 

Sadafmo is a talented woman with golden hands. She used to work as a seamstress but now is a cook who makes delicious food. She loves to prepare tasty dishes and wants to open a cafe where the main dish will be "kurutob", a local dish made from flatbread and tomato salad. She has great dreams for the future and no one to turn to but you. For this reason she is looking for a loan. Your support will make her very happy.

loans.use: to open a cafe specializing in the local dish "kurutob"

loans.name: Dora Yanet

texts.es:
La socia  Dora pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur”, la socia sigue dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa  de administración pública , la socia Dora está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, a la vez la socia sigue dedicándose a elaborar chompas, chalecos entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lanas de colores entre otros.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the "Cusco Sur" communal bank. She continues to dedicate herself to working in a public administration business.  Dora is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and she commits herself to paying back in installments according to her payment schedule.  

At the same time, the member continues to dedicate herself to making sweaters, vests and others.  The member is responsible and diligent, as this is the way she helps her family to move forward.   The member will use the loan to buy colored wool yarns, among others.

loans.use: to buy colored wool yarns, among other things

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom is a hardworking man. He is living in the northern part of Tajikistan in a small village named Lolazor. He was born in 1977. He is married and has four children. He has 15 years practice of doing business. He is an honest, capable, responsible and goal-oriented person. 

It is hard for rural citizens to find  good work and feed their family. Ikrom is the head of his family and feeds his family by himself. He is a rental worker and searches for a work from nearby villages and areas. His wife is a housekeeper and sometimes seasonally helps agrarians with land and earns money. They have no income during the winter season. He has not saved up money for living more. That is why he needs to be supported financially. He is planning to use this loan to buy construction supplies to build a house. 

He has good conditions to keep livestock and plant agricultural products. The village of Lolazor does not have enough land for planting, and doing business in agriculture is not efficient. Last year he had experience with planting barley (sty) and because of less water that season, they did not get a good harvest. Now he is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy construction supplies and build a house. He awaits your mercy and hopes to have good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en:
Fredelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells goods like noodles, biscuits, chips, shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar, and other items. She is a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 21 and the youngest is 8.  She has been operating a store for 10 years now. Her husband earns a living by being a farmer. 

 Fredelina has requested a loan to buy rice, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages. In this way, these will help improve the stock and also create a variety of goods on display. This could attract more buyers and this would also help augment her income. Thus she would be able to provide her children with healthy diets and better living conditions.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to be able to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy  rice, canned goods, soft drinks and beverages

loans.name: Almirena

texts.en:
Almirena is 63 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Almirena has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Almirena requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Almirena has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Almirena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by selling flowers in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more seedlings for her flower garden.

Thelma has been selling flowers for two years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for her flower garden.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 27 years old with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jonalyn has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Geraldine works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish.  Geraldine is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the renovation of pig pens and to buy sacks of feeds for her pig-fattening business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the renovation of pig pens, and buy sacks of feeds

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old, married, and has five children. 

Edna is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

Edna has been farming vegetables for 34 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Zenaida has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Zenaida has been in this business for three years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elma is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elma has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials needed like wood, etc.

Elma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed like woods, etc.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 27 years old, married, and has one kid. 

Leonie is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Leonie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Leonie has been farming vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Leonie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Reserita

texts.en:
Reserita is 45 years old and has six children.  Reserita is married and has three children who are in school.

Reserita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Reserita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Reserita has been farming vegetables for 26 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Reserita would like to save enough money to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leoniza is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leoniza has a fish vending business in the Philippinesa and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

Leoniza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leoniza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is 57 years old and has eleven children. Natalia is married and has five children who are in school.

Natalia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Natalia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Natalia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Natalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is a 27-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse. She wants to get a loan to support her husband who is doing a job as a salesman. His daily practice is to take rubber bands from wholesalers and deliver them to retailers by using his bike. Nowadays, he has observed that their household expenses are exceeding their income. Therefore, he decided to increase his efforts regarding business. Therefore, Shaheen requested a loan so that her husband could buy rubber in more quantity to deliver to the retailers. Shaheen hopes that now her husband can easily establish his business and can contribute more in household expenses than he has previously. Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's salesman business

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zevar

texts.ru:
Зевар 39 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она замужем мать четверых детей. У нее трое сыновей и одна дочка. Зевар из тех жителей, которая сохранила один из многих национальный символ народа. Она шьет "курпа" и "курпача" 
   "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Зевар более 15 лет занимается изготовлением "курпа" и "курпача". Она научилась сшить в школе. Ее старший сын собирается, занимается разнорабочем в Российской Федерации.  Поэтому, Зевар просит кредит, и  за счет кредита она хочет купить билет для сына и тратит на его документы. Вы можете поддержать Зевар сейчас.
texts.en:
Zevar is a 39-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is married with four children, three sons and one daughter. She is among those who preserve one of the many national symbols of her people, by sewing quilted mattresses called "kurpa" and "kurpacha". The kurpa is usually made in a square shape and used for bedding. The kurpacha is a long mattress used as seating. Zevar has been sewing these items for more than 15 years. She learned to sew in school.

Zevar's oldest son is preparing to go to Russia to work. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy him a ticket and pay for his documents. You can support her right now.

loans.use: to purchase a ticket

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Ражабгул 41 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Ражабгул вместе семьей проживает в районе Чиликул. Ее муж занимается ремонтом домов. Ражабгул сейчас занимается животноводством. Она идет по стопам отца. Ражабгул во дворе занимается выращиванием малый рогатого скота. Этой видом деятельности она занимается уже 5 лет. Ражабгул покупает малый рогатого скота и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Она хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность, увеличения поголовье скота. Так как у нее не хватает денег, она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Rajabgul is 41 and married with three children. She and her family live in the Jiligul region. Her husband does home repairs and she works in animal husbandry, following in her father's footsteps. She raises small livestock in her yard, a business she has had for five years. She buys animals, fattens them over a period of time and then resells them at the market. 

Rajabgul wants to expand her business by increasing her head count. Since she doesn't have enough money, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her food stall business. Her earnings help her to support herself and take care of the needs of her aging parents.

She would like now to apply for another 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients like fresh chicken, pork, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and meat needed to cook dishes to sell at her food stall. She is encouraged by the positive response of her customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her, and the good return on her investment, for it will surely help cover her and her parents' daily sustenance. 

Ludivina hopes to renovate her canteen to attract more customers, and dreams of opening a restaurant in a commercial area someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: Melody is 26 years old and single. She lives in a rural community with her beloved parents. She was engages in reselling fruits and vegetables to help her parents to earn income. She aspires to further improve this business in order to earn a higher a higher income. She has inadequate capital. She would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell. She hopes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. Kinabuan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en:
Ranulfa earns a living by selling coconut lumber. In addition to that, she also engages in buying and selling rice.  She is a mother of four grown children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in these kinds of businesses for several years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy lumber and additional capital to purchase rice. These are very important tools that would help Ranulfa be able to continue her livelihood. Thus, her income will begin to balance her finances. In this way, she could now start to expand her business and set aside some of the savings for emergency use.

Her dream is to become more sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy lumber and additional capital to purchase rice

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is grateful she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her only child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan to pay for tire replacement, fuel and maintenance of her tricycle. It is very important that her tricycle is always  in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and the safe trips of her transport service. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and for her child's education.

Daisy hopes to buy another tricycle unit. She wants to save enough to give her child the best education and see her become professional someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and buy and sell charcoal. Lucy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shydel

texts.en:
Shydel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shydel is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Shydel has a coffee shop business in the Philippines. Shydel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her coffee shop.

Shydel has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Shydel would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and married with nine children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut wine.

Norma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Herlita

texts.en:
Herlita is 38 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Herlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Herlita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Herlita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Welda

texts.en:
Welda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Welda is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Welda has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Welda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials like nail polish, etc.

Welda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Welda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs  in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Arceli Josephine

texts.en:
Arceli Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Arceli Josephine has been in this business for five years. Arceli Josephine earns more income from raising pigs and fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arceli Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio Víctor pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.
El socio continúa dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de contabilidad, el socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el  cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
El socio Víctor está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Victor belongs to the "Cusco South" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He continues to work in his career as an accountant.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments as scheduled.  Victor has been making his living at this job for some time, which is going well thanks to the effort he puts in every day.  This is how he supports his family.  

Victor is requesting a loan in order to purchase a laptop.  He is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to stay in his occupation supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia is 40 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school.

Rosenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosenia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosenia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luida

texts.en:
Luida is 38 years old and married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Luida has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Luida has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Luida has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Luida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Con

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Con works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bananas.  Mary Con is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of woods to sell to customers.

Mary Con has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of woods to sell.

loans.name: Claressa May

texts.en:
Claressa May is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, chips, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Claressa May has been in this business for four years. Claressa May earns more income from selling vegetables and raising pigs and selling wood.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Claressa May has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, chips, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Camaria

texts.en:
Camaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her business.

Camaria has been in this business for 10 years. Camaria earns more income from buy and sell fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and married with two children.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell.

Analiza has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Analiza aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Troub's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham province, Troub is 48 years old and a mother of seven children. She earns income to support her family’s condition via rice cropping and sesame. She has been involved in this business for 28 years, and it earns her about 44,400 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed, and pay for the labor fee.

She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed, and pay for the labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme célibataire sans enfant et âgée de 31 ans. Ama habite dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Ama est très entreprenante et dynamique et vend des pagnes  en se déplaçant aux besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Ama s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses marchandises. Pour acheter des pièces pagnes, Ama demande ce crédit pour réaliser sa commande et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire
texts.en: Ama is an unmarried woman and has no children. She is 31 years old and lives in the Adidogomé district. Ama is very entrepreneurial and energetic, and she sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) by going from place to place according to the needs of her customers in order to earn a profit. She gets her supplies of goods once a month at the market. To purchase lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, Ama is asking for this loan to fulfill an order and to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase 13 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Dinarkul

texts.ru: Динаркул 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Динаркул занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, у Динаркул на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 20 овец и лошадь, 1,67 ГА земельной доли, где она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динаркул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 10 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Динаркул планирует вложить в образование ее дочери, ей 14 лет.
texts.en:
Dinarkul is 43 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 17 years ago with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has a cow, 20 sheep and a horse, as well as 1.67 hectares of land where she grows beans both for her own use and for sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Dinarkul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase a cow and 10 sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan toward her 14-year-old daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy one cow and 10 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатима, 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 25 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Фатимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 20 овец. На участке, мерою 2,0 Га собственной земли, она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фатима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Фатима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
