Fatima is 49 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 25 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a cow and 20 sheep on her farm as well as 2 hectares of her own land where she grows beans. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Fatima has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase a heifer to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to increase her number of livestock

loans.name: Soeung's Group

texts.en: Soeung’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Soeung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller by selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme veuve qui vit avec deux enfants à sa charge. Abla habite à Adidogomé et est âgée de 46 ans. Pour réaliser des gains et subvenir favorablement à ses besoins, Abla prépare de la pate bandée faite à base du maïs qu’elle vend dans son quartier et arrive à subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens grâce à cette activité génératrice de revenus. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché  et demande ce crédit pour acheter des bols de maïs. Abla désire améliorer sa prestation et augmenter son profit pour aider ses enfants
texts.en: Abla is a widow who lives with her two children she supports. She lives in Adidogomé and is 46 years old. To make a profit and support herself, Abla makes “pate bandée” made from corn that she sells in her neighborhood. She manages to meet her day-to-day needs, thanks to this revenue-generating business. She gets her supplies once a month at the market and is asking for this loan to purchase tubs of corn. Abla would like to improve her offerings and to increase her profit to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase 150 tubs of con

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un joven de 31 años, vive en el departamento de Cochabamba – Bolivia, es el tercer hijo de cinco hermanos y su mamá es ama de casa por lo que los ingresos que percibe su familia provienen de la jubilación de su papá, quien falleció cuando él era muy joven. Él menciona además que solo uno de sus hermanos mayores logro culminar sus estudios universitarios y los dos últimos continúan con sus estudios. Actualmente Marco trabaja en una empresa que brinda servicios de seguridad en electrónica.  
Marco comenta que terminó la carrera de informática en la universidad estatal, sin embargo, no pudo obtener su título profesional, ya que no pudo realizar su defensa de grado por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poder titularse ya que considera que esto le permitirá ascender en su actual trabajo u optar por mejores puestos laborales, lo cual le ayudara a cumplir su sueño de tener una casa propia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Marco agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes a cumplir su sueño de ser profesional y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en: Marco is a 31 year old who lives in the department of Cochabamba, Bolivia. He is the third of 5 siblings and his mother is a housewife. So the income that the family has comes from his father's pension who died when he was very young. He mentions that only one of his older siblings managed to finish their university studies and the youngest two are continuing their studies. Currently Marco is working in a company that provides electronic security services. Marco says that he finished his IT studies at a state university buy he has not received his professional title and he has not been able to defend his degree. So he is requesting an educational loan to get his degree as he thinks this will allow him to move upwards in his actual work and open better employments positions. This will help him fulfill his dream of having a house and improve the quality of living of his family. Marco is grateful to the people who with their economic resources help young people to achieve their dreams and generate new opportunities to grow.

loans.use: to buy for his IT courses.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 25-years-old single man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

He works, selling fruits and vegetables from a stall. It is a very good business but the income is not enough to cover all the family needs and also to improve his fruits and vegetables stall.

Isam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy fresh crops for his stall to resell. This will improve his business and also his income.

Isam appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy fresh crops for his stall to resell.

loans.name: Carminia

texts.es:
La socia  Carminia pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia continua dedicándose a su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Carminia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Carminia belongs to the communal bank "Cusco Sur" in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues making a living with her grocery store business.  She has been with this business for some time, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.  

Carminia is requesting a loan for the purchase of rice and sugar, among other things.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Braulio Luis

texts.es:
El socio  Braulio pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
El socio sigue dedicándose a trabajar para una institución  del estado, el socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, el socio es una persona  responsable y empeñoso, él socio a la vez sigue dedicándose a la compra y venta de artesania, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
El socio está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y crecer en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
texts.en: Braulio is a member of the “Cusco Sur” communal bank of the city of Cusco, Perú. He continues his work at a State institution. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of his installments according to the set times. He is a responsible person. He will continue working buying and selling of handicrafts, this being the way he gets his family ahead. Braulio is requesting the loan to buy sweaters amongst others. He is very grateful to Kiva to allow him to maintain his business and grow and supporting him and his family.

loans.use: to buy sweaters amongst others.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina engages in a food vending business. She makes suman (a rice cake originating from the Philippines). It is made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed and wrapped in buli or buri palm leaves. It is usually eaten sprinkled with sugar. She is a married woman with two grown children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.  

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, and many others. These ingredients will be used in preparing more suman to sell. In this way, she could be able to improve her income and handle her finances. 
  
She is determined that someday her food vending business will be productive.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, and many others

loans.name: Merizol

texts.en:
Merizol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, egg, chips, etc for her general store business.

Merizol has been in this business for four years. Merizol earns more income from fishing and raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merizol has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, egg, chips, etc

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married, with two children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Shaef

texts.en:
Shaef received his first Kiva loan to purchase grocery items for his grocery store. He is very grateful for Kiva's lenders for their first loan which helped him in expanding his business as well as in increasing his profits. Shaef has completely repaid Kiva's first loan and has applied for a second one of 100,000 YER from Kiva lenders in order to purchase construction materials to expand his house which is very narrow and small. 

With this loan, Shaef will be able to build other two rooms to make his house more spacious as is necessary. Building these rooms inside the house will improve the living conditions of his family and make them feel happy. This loan will create great motivation for Shaef to build a second floor to rent out.
 
Shaef thanks Kiva lenders again for their first loan and hopes that this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to expand his house

loans.name: Elikplim

texts.fr: A 23 ans, Elikplim est une femme mariée et avec ses deux enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elikplim  vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des céréales pour réaliser ses gains quotidiens. Elikplim s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local du quartier. Elikplim réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Elikplim nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des bols de maïs  pour gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en: Elikplim, aged 23, is a married woman, who lives with her two children in the Adidogomé district. She sells grocery items and grains for a living. She gets her supplies twice a month at a local market in her district. Elikplim makes a good profit from her commerce. She needs this loan to purchase some tubs of corn to earn a profit and to help out her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 25 tubs of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh crops for his stall to resell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of a country in 1976. She lives in a small town and has ten years experience doing a business. She is married and has two children. She started to do a business of buying and selling clothes. Her husband and relatives supported her in starting a business. Recently she has a trade place in a domestic market. She trades women's clothes and has permanent satisfied clients around. The season is coming and Firuza wants to buy a new collection of clothes to enlarge her assortment. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy a new collection of women's clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of women's clothes

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MUJRES EMPRENDEDORAS, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales, la socia continúa preparando desayunos, almuerzo y cenas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
Doris belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurial Women).  She continues making a living in her restaurant business.  She appreciates and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.  She continues preparing breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  This is how she supports her family.  

Doris is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, and beans, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and beans, among other things.

loans.name: Virgelyn

texts.en:
Virgelyn is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Virgelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Virgelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Virgelyn has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Virgelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mabel is 33 years old and both of her children are in school.

Mabel has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Mabel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell.

Mabel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jocklyna

texts.en:
Jocklyna works hard to support her family.

She has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jocklyna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fertilizers and a new variety of seeds for her farming vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocklyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and a new variety of seeds

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 60 years old, and married with six children.

Magdalena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, and other groceries to sell.

Magdalena has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from selling fruits.

Magdalena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adeha

texts.en:
Adeha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Adeha has been in this business for 15 years. Adeha earns more income from buy and sell fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Adeha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 53 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecil is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

Cecil has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and her general store businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business for her food vending business.

Gemma has been in this business for ten years. Gemma earns more income from buy and sell crabs and shrimps.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase embroidery raw materials for the shop.

loans.name: Samut's Group

texts.en: Narin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and this woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eat's Group

texts.en: Eat’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Eat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 44-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She is the mother of one small son. 

Her husband was working as a construction worker in the past, but now he has no job. Amal opened a small grocery store where she sells basic grocery products. She would like to improve her store and expand it.

Amal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy fruits and vegetables and resell it in her grocery store. This will improve her business and also her income.

Amal appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and resell them in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-years-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small simple house. 

He has been working at selling fruits and vegetables from a stall for the past two years. It is a very good business but the income is not enough to cover all the family needs and also to improve his fruits and vegetables stall.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy fresh crops for his stall to resell. This will improve his business and also his income.

Ahmad appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy fresh crops for his stall to resell.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
La socia Yessenia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa , la socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, la socia continua vendiendo a sus amistades ,familiares, clientes entre otros ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos entre otros.
texts.en:
Yessenia belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru.  She still has her business selling clothing.  She is thankful for her loan and promises to make her payments according to the payment schedule.  She is still selling to her friends, relatives, and customers, among others.  She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  

She requested this loan to buy sweaters and t-shirts, among other items.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and t-shirts, among other items

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia María Teresa  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo casacas, chompas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia María Teresa solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
María Teresa belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru. 

She still has her business buying and selling clothing; she has had her business for a good while and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She is still selling coats, sweaters, and other items to all the customers who order form her.  She wants to be able to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.  

She is thankful for her loan and promises to make her payments according to the payment schedule, as this is how she gets her family ahead.  

María Teresa requested this loan to buy coats and other items.

loans.use: to buy coats and other items

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.  Vivian is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Battambang province, Toch is 43 years old. 

For her family, she grows rice on five hectares area and drives a motor taxi to earn more income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay the laborers' fee. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed and to pay the laborers' fee.

loans.name: Nosheen's Group

texts.en:
Nosheen, age 30, is a mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nosheen, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase the stitching machine with the help of the loan. 

Nosheen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine for her husband's tailoring work

loans.name: Edwar Joseph

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Edwar continua trabajando para una empresa  estatal, el socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para su uso personal como en la compra de vivieres.
texts.en:
This is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank.  The bank is located in Cuzco Province and Cuzco Department.  

Edwar is still working for a state business.  He is thankful for the loan he has received and promises to make his payments on time.  He is a responsible and hardworking person, which his how he gets his family ahead. 

He is requesting this loan for personal use, such as to buy groceries.

loans.use: for personal use, such as to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jalie

texts.en:
Jalie is 44 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jalie has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Jalie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her dried fish making.

Jalie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Jalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish making.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and raising pigs.  Zenaida is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
An older woman living in Battambang province, Nai is 60 years old and a mother of six children. To support her family, she grows rice and vegetables as the main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 24,400 KHR per day. 

For Nai, this is her seventh loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy household supplies to support her living. She hopes that her family’s living conditions can get better than before.

loans.use: to buy household supplies to support her living.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 35 and living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and customers as well.

Due to the quality and low reasonable rates, many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in a large quantity, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in a large quantity.

Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

Abida is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk in bulk for her husband's business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home, as she is a good and responsible housewife. 

Her husband provides services in painting work to buildings and shops as well. In this regard, her husband was in need of some painting related tools such as paints of different colors, brushes, distempers, etc., for increasing his work. Therefore, Farzana made contact with BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan.

Farzana is so much thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's paint work

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
Isolina tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se encuentra sobre el valle de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, patos y gallinas desde hace 04 años, esta labor lo realiza para cubrir una parte de los gastos familiares ya que sus hijos aportan otra parte, es una madre emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de cuyes de raza y de esta manera mejorar su producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, esto le ayudará a incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isolina is 69 years old, lives with her children in the district of Cayaltí, a community found in the Zaña valley where its residents work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo Province in the north cost of Peru.

She has been raising and selling guinea pigs, ducks and chickens for the past four years. This work helps cover part of the family expenses as her children provide the other part. 

She is an enterprising mother that has asked for this loan to purchase feed to fatten up her animals and the second part to buy breeding guinea pigs. With these purchases she can improve her production to offer her customers.  This will help to increase her income and as such will in turn better her  and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed to fatten up her animals and the second part to buy breeding guinea pigs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a dealer of a personal collection products like hair care, skin care, fragrance, food supplements and apparel. She is 50 years old and a married woman with five children. Two of them are still attending school. Her husband earns a living by being a security guard. 

She has requested  a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy more stock of personal collection products and RTW (ready-to-wear clothing). These will be helpful for Carmelita to be able to cater to her customers' needs. With this, her income will be improved and will start to balance her earnings. She could now prepare nutritious diets for the whole family.

She is determined that someday she would like expand her business for the welfare of her children and also for sustainable living in the coming future, as well.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products and RTW (ready-to-wear clothing).

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 45 years old and married and works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Leonida has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Leonida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Esmeralda Stefania

texts.es: Esmeralda tiene 24 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres y su hijo de 5 años en Guranda provincia de Bolivar, Ella tiene un bazar de ropa, perfumes y carteras, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderia ya que en esta epoca es bueno comprar por se vende bien y para comprar en efectivo que sale mas conveniente, para asi tener ganancias mejores. Realiza las compras en Guayaquil en la importadora Norte, su sueño es tener un negocio mas grande y formar una familia mas grande ya que es soltera y tiene a su hijita, en su tiempo libre le guta estudiar, escuchar musica y bailar.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 24 years old, single and lives with her parents and her 5-year old in Guranda,  province of Bolivar.  She has a clothes, perfumes and purses store.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise because at this time it is good buy since the merchandise sells well and buying in cash is much more convenient and results in better earnings. 

She makes her purchases in Guayaquil at Importadora Norte.  Her dream is to have a bigger business and form a larger family since she is single and has only her little daughter.  In her spare time she likes to study, listen to music and dance.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia belongs to a poor family. She is living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories for doors and windows that are used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding equipment became out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy new welding equipment, but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from BRAC, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy the welding equipment for manufacturing.  

Nazia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new welding equipment for her husband's welding shop

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Rath is 28 years old. She can earn income to support her family’s living via working in a factory and driving a motor taxi to earn more income. She has been involved in this work for ages, and it earns her about 38,200 KHR per day. 

This is first loan for Rath with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to renovate her old house. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle to be better than before.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 18 y 25 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por encontrarse las redes viales que comunican a la ciudad y porque se encuentran 1 de los 2 aeropuertos internacionales, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro lo usa corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por la manufactura que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja junto a ella y con sus 3 hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación y venta de zapatos para niños; su proceso comienza con la compra de los materiales necesarios como; piel sintética, tintas, lacas, suelas, adhesivos y otros, luego corta las piezas y las moldea, fija la planta con pegamento o mediante costura, desmancha el zapato de los residuos de los procesos anteriores, retoca los zapatos con laca para darle brillo, y lo encajona para su posterior venta. “heredé esta actividad de mi familia, trabajo con mi pareja y deseamos incrementar nuestra producción…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la experiencia que tiene y cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para ampliar su actividad. Su sueño es fabricar zapatos en grandes cantidades, ella desea incrementar su producción mediante la compra de moldes para zapatos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que se dedica a  esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de moldes de zapatos infantiles para incrementar su producción y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Maria is a 46 year old woman and she lives with her partner. She has 3 children of 15, 18 and 25 years old. Her business is making shoes. 

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, patient, steadfast, responsible and very hardworking. She has her business in the southern area of the city, characterized by road networks that connect the city, because 1 of the 2 international airports are located there. It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Maria has short black hair, is dark skinned and short and has brown eyes and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks among family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and because of the work she does. She shares her life with her partner, who works with her, and her 3 children who study and work. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a metal roof. It has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.

Her business is making and selling children’s shoes. Her process begins by purchasing the necessary materials like synthetic leather, ink, varnish, soles, adhesives and others. Then she cuts the pieces and molds them. She sets the sole with glue or by sewing, removes the residue stains from the shoe from the previous processes, retouches the shoes with varnish to make them shine and boxes them up for the subsequent sale.

“I inherited this business from my family. I work with my partner and we wish to increase our production” she says. The advantage of her business is the experience and regular customers she has. The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to expand her business. Her dream is to make shoes on a large scale. She wishes to increase her production by buying shoe molds.

This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 30 years that she has done this work. For these reasons, Maria requests a loan to buy infant's shoe molds to increase her production and to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy infant's shoe molds to increase her production and to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Her son owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes, he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market, and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers, which becomes good advertising. One of his brothers also helps him in the clothing business; both give part of their time to the shop. 

Azra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loans from BRAC and investing in the business. Azra hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

Azra dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing of various colors and designs for her son's clothing shop.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ester has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Ester would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Abdulbaset

texts.en:
Abdulbaset inherited a piece of land from his father inside one of Taiz areas, Yemen. Over time, he built a small house on that land. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete it due to his low income. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase windows and doors for his house to provide his children with a safe living space. The rain and winds come easily to the house and cause disease for the children. Purchasing the doors and windows will protect the children from any danger. The house without windows makes the family feel inconvenienced particularly if any relatives or guests come to their house but now the family will feel very happy. After purchasing the windows and doors he will be able to renovate the house from the inside through plastering and painting it's walls.

Abdulbaset hopes to guarantee a safe future for his children, particularly these days.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors for his house to provide his children with a safe living space.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 26 years old, mother of three children, and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize vegetable sales. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetable for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband's newly established green grocery shop.

loans.name: Grupo Antonio Group

texts.es:
A pesar de ser tan joven Alejandra es inspiración de muchas mujeres en su comunidad. Tiene 18 años, está casada y es madre de una niña-
“Mi papá era taxista y desde muy pequeña me encantaba salir con él para acompañarlo a trabajar”. Gracias al ejemplo de su papá, ahora ella es una de las mejores taxistas de la región. Aprendió a manejar a los 15 años y poco tiempo después, su papá le regaló su taxi. 
Alejandra presta su servicio desde muy temprano, trabajando 12 horas diarias, de 8 a 8. “Para nosotros el tiempo es dinero”. Mientras ella trabaja, su suegra le ayuda a cuidar a su niña que aún no asiste a la escuela. 
Los integrantes del grupo comentan que un amigo les recomendó el apoyo de VisionFund México por el trato y la tasa de interés que es mejor a la de otras instituciones. “Realmente confiamos en que esta inversión nos ayudará  a mejorar nuestras actividades”.
Alejandra está muy contenta porque el préstamo le permitirá comprar refacciones para su taxi para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su meta es comprar otro vehículo y dar empleo a otra persona.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Lucía quien invertirá en artesanías; Eusebio, en accesorios para teléfono y Abel, en su taxi.
Todos ellos viven en una comunidad tranquila que se identifica por tener un pozo que es muy importante para los habitantes que aprovechan el agua para beber o para bañarse. 
*En la imagen aparece el taxi de Alejandra,  ella es quien el pantalón verde, la fotografía fue tomada en calles más importantes del municipio donde viven los integrantes*
texts.en:
Despite being so young, Alejandra is an inspiration for many women in her community. She is 18 years old and the mother of a little girl. 

“My father was a taxi driver and since I was very young, I loved to go out with my father and accompany him at work." Thanks to her father's example, now she is one of the best taxi drivers in the region. She learned to drive when she was 15 years old and a short time later, her father gave her his taxi. 

Alejandra offers her service starting very early. She works 12 hours a day, from 8 to 8. 'For us, time is money." While she works, her mother in law helps her care for her little girl, who isn't in school yet.   
 
The members of the group say that a friend recommended the support of VisionFund México because f the good treatment and the rate of interest is better than in other institutions.  “We really trust that this investment will help us to improve our activities”.

Alejandra is very happy because the loan will allow her to buy replacement parts for her taxi to offer a better service. Her goal is to buy another vehicle and give someone else a job.  

The other members of the group are Lucía, who will invest in handicrafts, Eusebio, who will invest in telephone accessories, and Abel, who will invest in his taxi.

All of them live in a peaceful community which is identified by its well, which is very important to the residents who use the water to drink or to bathe.  

*In the image, Alejandra's taxi can be seen. She is wearing green pants. The photo was taken in one of the most important streets in the town where the borrowers live.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts.

loans.name: Familia H Group

texts.es:
“Familia H” es un grupo integrado por cuatro personas a quienes une un lazo familiar. Ellos viven en una comunidad mazahua caracterizada por tener una vista espectacular con colinas llenas de árboles frondosos. 
Su sencillez  y carisma son características que identifican a Don Gilberto, mejor conocido como Beto. Él tiene 59 años de edad y aunque trabajó como profesor, actualmente es jubilado. Está casado con Aurelia y aún tienen un hijo que depende de ellos y continúa estudiando. 
Don Beto está solicitando un crédito a Kiva y Vision Fund para comprar productos de abarrotes y abastecer la tienda que inició hace 17 años en la carretera más transitada y el único camino que había para llegar a su comunidad. “Inicié solo poniendo una tablas y unas cajas para mostrar mis abarrotes y con el tiempo vi la necesidad de comprar anaqueles y refrigeradores nuevos para poder vender carnes frías y refrescos”. Después de un tiempo cerraron la carretera y construyeron una barda lo cual provocó una baja de ventas en la tienda. Don Beto decidió comprar una casa en otra comunidad donde pudiera abrir nuevamente su tienda y tener todavía más clientes. 
Don Beto y su familia están muy agradecidos por todos los créditos otorgados porque su negocio continúa mejorando, ahora puede comprar con facilidad sus productos, ha hecho algunos arreglos a su vivienda y puede comprar más bienes para su familia. 
La dificulta de Don Beto es la competencia y las tiendas que continúan abriendo en la región, pero esta situación no lo desalienta sino que lo impulsa para tener la mejor tienda, con más variedad de mercancía y sabe que los préstamos son el apoyo que necesita para lograrlo. 
Doña Aurelia invertirá su crédito en ropa; su hija Aurelia, en su zapatería y Doña Elena, en su tienda de abarrotes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio donde viven los integrantes. Cerca también se encuentran el palacio de gobierno, un quiosco y una iglesia católica.
texts.en:
Familia H is a group made up of four people who are related.  They live in a Mazahua community known for having a spectacular view with hills full of leafy trees. 

Modesty and charisma are the qualities that Don Gilberto, better known at Beto, is known for.  He is 59 years old and, though he worked as a professor, he is currently retired.  He is married to Aurelia and they still have one son who is dependent on them and who is still in school.  

Beto is requesting a Kiva and Vision Fund loan to buy grocery products to stock the store he founded 17 years ago on the most-trafficked street and the only road that reached their community.  "I started by just putting out some boards and boxes to display my groceries and with time I saw that I needed to buy shelves and news refrigerators so I could sell cold meats and soft drinks."  After a while they closed the road and built a wall, which hurt sales at the store.  Beto decided to buy a house in another community where he could reopen his store and have even more customers.  

Beto and his family are very thankful for all the loans they have received because their business keeps improving; now he can buy his products easily; he has made some repairs to his home; and he can buy more things for his family. 

Beto's challenge is competition and the stores that keep opening in the area, but this situation does not discourage him, rather it motivates him to have the best store with the widest variety of merchandise and he knows that the loans are the support he needs to achieve this.  

Aurelia will invest her loan in clothing; her daughter Aurelia in her shoe store, and Elena in her grocery store.  

*This picture was taken downtown in the city where the bank members live.  Nearby there is also the governor's mansion, a kiosk, and a Catholic church.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, such as bread, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mawuko

texts.fr: Mariée et âgé de 57 ans, Mawuko est une femme très entreprenante et active dans la gestion de ses besoins. Avec deux enfants à charge, Mawuko habite à Adidogomé pour vendre de la pate bandée pour la restauration de ses clients. Ce commerce lui apporte son bénéfice et Mawuko s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour acheter des bols de maïs et des poissons, Mawuko demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mawuko is 57 years old and married. She is a very energetic person and  works hard to make a living. She has two dependent children and lives in Adidogomé. She cooks corn mush for sale. This allows her to earn a revenue. She stocks up from her from her suppliers once a month. Mawuko is requesting this loan in order to finance restocking bowls of corn and fish and earn sufficient revenue  to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 125 bowls of corn and seven packs of fish.

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FE EN DIOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina Yomira ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the Fe en Dios [Faith in God] Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

The featured borrower is Vicentina Yomira. She is single and 37 years old. She has 2 children. She buys and sells clothing for a living, selling pants, blouses, and shirts. Through this business, she wants to support her children. She is an enterprising woman, and her dream is to have a permanent store where she can sell the clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, and shirts.

The member who is added to the group photo had her photo taken after the meeting, due to her work commitments.

The other members have businesses in photocopying, clothing sales, groceries, and a restaurant.

Vicentina Yomira thanks those who are part of her dream through Kiva, and she promises to make make her repayments in the proper installments.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and shirts

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Judas Tadeo” está conformado por personas muy trabajadoras y responsables, viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por tener mucha vegetación, la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la venta de borregos. 
Graciela es muy joven, pero con un gran espíritu emprendedor; tiene 27 años de edad y está casada con Israel, juntos formaron una familia de tres hijos que aún se encuentran estudiando.
Desde hace seis años ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, actividad que inició gracias a una de sus primas que la motivó a iniciar el negocio explicándole que las ganancias le ayudarían a sacar adelante a su familia. Entonces, comenzó a vender en la capital del país, donde también hacía el delicioso postre con el apoyo de una persona que tenía todos los utensilios necesarios. Después salía a recorrer las calles de la Ciudad de México para vender el helado.
“Desafortunadamente tuvimos que regresar a nuestra comunidad porque los gastos comenzaron a aumentar”. Graciela le compró a su prima algunas herramientas para continuar vendiendo. Ahora, gracias al préstamo podrá pagar la renta de un local en su municipio. “Es difícil caminar entre las calles de la comunidad por eso mismo prefiero tener un local estable” comentó Graciela.
Durante la época de calor, las ventas de Graciela aumentan considerablemente y la dificultad del negocio llega con la temporada de invierno, pero ella sigue apoyando a su esposo sobre todo para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y ayudarlos a continuar sus estudios. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Daniel quien invertirá en cerdos; María Elena, Agustín, Mirna, Araceli, Amir y Patricio, en borregos; Rosalina y Clara, en su tienda de abarrotes y María Graciela, en ropa y zapatos.
*La fotografía fue capturada en el centro del municipio donde viven los integrantes. Cerca, se encuentra el palacio de gobierno, una plazoleta, la iglesia católica y el quiosco que se alcanza a observar en la imagen.
texts.en: The “San Judas Tadeo” group is formed by hardworking and responsible people. They live in a community characterized by heavy vegetation. The majority of the population works growing corn and selling sheep. Graciela is very young, but with a great entrepreneurial spirit. She is 27 years old and is married to Israel. They formed a family with three children who are still studying. For the last six years, she has worked making and selling ice cream, an activity which she started thanks to one of her cousins who motivated her to start the business. She explained to her that the earnings would help her support her family. She then started to sell in the capital of the country, where she also made the delicious dessert, with the help of one person who had all the necessary equipment. Afterwards, she walked the streets of Mexico City to sell the ice cream. "Unfortunately, we had to go back to our village because the expenses began to mount up." Graciela bought some equipment from her cousin to continue selling. Now, thanks to the loan  she will be able to pay the rent of a commercial space in her community. "It is hard to walk the streets and sell, that is why I prefer to have a stable location" Graciela stated. During the summer months, her sales increase considerably and the difficult times begin when winter comes. But she continues to help her husband, especially to improve the quality of life of her children and to help them continue studying. The other members of the group are Daniel, who will invest in pigs; Maria Elena, Agustin, Mirna, Araceli, Amir and Patricio, in sheep; Rosalina and Clara in their grocery store, and Maria Graciela in clothing and shoes. *The picture was taken in the center of the community where all the members live. Nearby, there is the government palace, a small plaza, the catholic church and the kiosk which can be seen in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for the rent of a commercial space.

location.town: SAN JOAQUIN LAMILLAS, SAN JOSE DEL RINCON

loans.name: Javier Hilarion

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años y una hija de 5 años, y su negocio es el servicio de transporte urbano e interdepartamental.
Él es buen padre, comprensivo, paciente, alegre, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la ciudad con destino a poblaciones del norte; donde la vegetación es espesa y abundante, se planta, café, plátano, hoja de coca, se practica la apicultura y otros, de clima cálido con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 16-18 grados centígrados.
Javier es de tez morena, cabello negro lo usa corto, ojos pardos, baja estatua, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la efectúa en compañía de su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; el mayor está iniciando la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto que es propio y está construido de cemento y ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de transporte interprovincial; diariamente él viaja a las provincias del norte, llevando y trayendo pasajeros. “inicie mi trabajo como ayudante de chofer, posteriormente con la ayuda de un préstamo compré una movilidad y viajo todos los días…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las rutas son nuevas eso hace que exista un flujo constante de pasajeros, la desventaja es la distancia de los viajes que no le permiten estar mucho tiempo con su familia. Su sueño es comprarse otro vehículo, él desea comprar una batería para su vehículo y realizar el mantenimiento del motor para continuar trabajando. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que trabaja como transportista.
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para la compra de una batería para su vehículo y para realizar el mantenimiento del motor para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Javier is a 34-year-old man, who lives with his partner and has a 2-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. His business is an urban and interdepartmental transport service

He is a good father, understanding, patient, happy, responsible, and very hard-working. He carries out his work in the city, heading toward northern towns. In that area, the vegetation is thick and abundant; they plant coffee, bananas, and coca leaves and practice bee-keeping and other trades. It has a warm climate with a temperature that varies between 16 and 18 degrees Celsius.

Javier is tan with short, black hair, dark eyes, short stature, and a robust build. His mother language is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in daily life and in his work.

He lives in the company of his partner, who works in commerce, and his children. The oldest is starting school and the younger one isn't school age yet. They live in a room that they own, which is made of cement and brick. It has a corrugated iron roof and running water, electricity, and a sewage system.

His business is an inter-provincial transport service. Every day he travels to the northern provinces, bringing passengers to and from. "I started my business as a chauffeur's assistant. Later, with the help of a loan, I bought a vehicle, and I travel every day," he says. The advantage of his business is that the routes are new, which means that there is a constant flow of passengers. The disadvantage is that the length of the trips don't allow him to spend much time with his family.

His dream is to buy another vehicle. He wants to buy a battery for his vehicle and complete maintenance on the motor, in order to continue working. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in his 10 years working in transportation.

For these reasons, Javier is requesting a loan to buy a battery for his vehicle and complete maintenance on the motor, in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a battery for his vehicle and for maintenance on the motor to continue working

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 39 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos varones de 15, 8 y 6 años, y su negocio es el servicio de chapa y pintura para automóviles. 
Él es buen padre, emprendedor,  independiente, luchador, solidario, comprensivo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘Mariscal Santa Cruz’ que se caracteriza por su arquitectura colonial y republicana, que actualmente conforma el casco viejo de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-16 grados centígrados.
David es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna  es el Aymará que habla en familia y hablar español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja como costurera de polleras y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. David tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela primaria, ellos son muy felices al lado de su padre porque él se esfuerza mucho por su bienestar y sus estudios. Su negocio es el servicio de chapa y pintura para vehículos, trabajo que viene realizando desde hace más de 20 años. Las ofertas de una feria lo impulsaron a comprar un auto en mal estado, para arreglarlo y hacerlo trabajar como taxi. “junté todos mis ahorros y compré un auto en mal estado para repararlo; mi intención es que trabaje como taxi y mejore nuestro ingresos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes le recomiendan a otros clientes, la desventaja es que su taller no está en la avenida y eso dificulta la captación de nuevos clientes. El sueño de David es generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, él desea realizar la compra de un motor para su automóvil para que trabaje como taxi. 
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para comprar un motor para cambiarle a su movilidad y hacerlo trabajar como taxi para generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
David is a 36-year-old married man. He has three sons who are 15, 8, and 6 years old. He makes a living doing body work and painting for vehicles.

He is a good father, enterprising, independent, determined, supportive, responsible, and very hard-working. He works in the Mariscal Santa Cruz area, which is known for its colonial and republican architecture and today forms the historic center of the city. It has a cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies between 0 and 16 degrees Celsius.

David is tan, with short, black hair and medium height. His mother language is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in daily life and in his business.

He shares his life with his wife, who works as a seamstress, and with his children, who are in school. They live in their own house made of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof. It has running water, electricity, and plumbing. David has three children in primary school. They are very happy living with their father because he works hard for their welfare and their studies.

His business is a bodywork and vehicle painting service. The sales at a fair motivated him buy a rundown car to fix up and make into a taxi. "I pulled together all my savings and bought a rundown car to repair. My intention is that it can be used as a taxi and improve our income," he says. The advantage of his business is that his customers recommend him to others. The disadvantage is that his workshop isn't on the main street, which makes it hard to attract new clients.

David's dream is to make more income for his family's well-being. He wants to purchase a motor for his car so it can be used as a taxi.

For these reasons, David is requesting a loan to buy a motor to change his vehicle and ready it for use as a taxi to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a motor to change his vehicle and ready it for use as a taxi to earn more income

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 58 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 23 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, generosa, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad que es la región más industrializada, representada principalmente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, es la zona más importante de producción hidrocarburífera. Situada a una altura de 437 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados.
María es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por la manufactura que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de prendas para dama, como; faldas, blusas, soleras y otros. Actividad que realiza en su domicilio para realizar la venta por mayor a clientes constantes que hacen pedidos por docena. “realizo blusas a pedido, pantalones a pedido, confecciono cualquier prenda según el pedido del cliente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de tela. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de cortes de tela por mayor para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución e 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria a single, 58-year-old woman. She has a 23-year-old son and makes clothing for a living.

She is a good mother, patient, generous, optimistic, responsible, and hard-working. She has her business in the southern area of the city, which is the most industrialized region, mainly known for its farming and forestry. It is the most important area in hydrocarbon production. It is located at a height of 437 meters above sea level, with a tropical climate where the day temperature varies between 21 and 34 degrees Celsius.

María is olive-skinned, with long, black hair tied back, dark eyes with glasses, short stature, and medium build. Her mother language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish in daily life and her business.

She shares her life with her son, who goes to school and works. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. It has running water, electricity, and plumbing.

She works making women's clothing such as skirts, blouses, dresses, and other articles of clothing. She does this from her home and sells in large amounts to regular customers who order by the dozen. "I make blouses, pants, and whatever kind of clothing the customer requests," she says. The advantage of her business is that she enjoys regular customers; the disadvantage is a lack of capital to invest in purchasing cloth.

Her dream is to open a clothing store. She wants to buy cloth wholesale to fulfill the orders she has. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in her 20 years in the business.

For these reasons, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase cloth wholesale to meet her customers' requests and open a store.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale to meet her customers' requests and open a store

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: Gladys tiene 37 años de edad es casada vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar tiene 2 hijos. Ella trabaja en un estudio juridico, solicita el credito para la compra de materiales de construccion para el arreglo de la casa, los materiales compra en Guaranda su sueño es terminar su casita y vivir independientemente, en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 37 years old and married. She lives in Guaranda in the Bolivar province. She has 2 children and works in a legal office.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction material to fix up her house. She will buy the materials in Guaranda. Her dream is to finish her little home and live independently.

In her free time, she likes to spend time with her children.

loans.use: to fix up her home

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old and married with two children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

Myrna has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Waled

texts.en:
Waled is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a small house. 
During the day he works as an employee in the public sector. He receives a very low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Waled is also a student in a local university where he studies social science. He wants to complete his study and find a better job in the future.
Waled took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him buy a new laptop for his study. The laptop will help him in doing his homeworks and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
Liway is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of banana to sell for her business.

Liway has been in this business for 5 years. She had successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Liway has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of banana to sell

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
A villager living in Thala Barivat of Steung Treng province, Saran is 41 years old and a mother of four children.
Two of her children are still dependent on her and currently studying in high school. 

For a living, Saran grows cassava and it is her main source of income. She has been doing this work for 20 years and it earns her family about 15,000 KHR per day. 

This loan is her second loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. This time she will spend her loan portion to buy solar system for her house. She hopes that she can improve her house and has enough electricity to use for day-to-day living.

loans.use: To buy solar system for her house.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Thala Barivat District

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son and three daughters. 

Khalida's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. 
Unfortunately in the past few days his rickshaw hasn't been working properly because of wear and tear from regular uses. He finds that most of its parts are out of order and in need of repair. He is currently unable to generate any amount of income. 

Khalida's husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but due to lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Because of this Khalida has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Khalida is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Kimheng's Group

texts.en:
Kimheng, 44 years old, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She is a mother of two schoolchildren. 
She sells grocery items as the main source of income. Moreover, she earns extra income through rice cropping. 

For Kimheng, this is her seventh cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back all her past loans successfully. 
She leads a group of two to get this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy more grocery items for sell and pay for labors fee. 

She hopes that she can generate more income to improve her family’s living condition to be better than last year's.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell and to pay for labors fee.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a tailor and very good in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years and has a lot of experience. 

Recently his sewing machine has become out of order and it needs to be replaced with a new one. However, he does not have sufficient money to buy a new machine. Because of this Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy a new professional sewing machine for her husband. 

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: A 41 ans, Akouwa est une femme mariée et avec ses deux enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Akouwa est une marchande de chaussures qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Akouwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans un marché local. Akouwa réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Akouwa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des tapettes afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouwa is a 41-year-old married woman with two children.  They live in the Adidogomé district.  Akouwa is a shoe saleswoman and she walks through the streets of her district to make her sales.

Twice a month, she buys new supplies from the local market.  Her business is very profitable.  She has requested this loan to buy flipflops to improve her earnings level more and be able to provide for the school education of her children.

loans.use: to buy flipflops for resale.

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 40 ans, Essivi est une femme avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Essivi habite à Adidogomé et est une commerçante de produits d’alimentations générales. Essivi réalise favorablement son activité et pour arriver à ses fins, elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de sucre et des bidons d’huile, Essivi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider ses enfants dans leurs éducations
texts.en:
Essivi is 40 years old and married.  She is responsible for five children and lives in Adidogomé.  She sells general food products.

Three times a month, Essivi buys new stocks from the market and she manages to earn enough for the needs of her family.

Essivi has requested this loan to buy sacks of sugar and drums of oil.  This will enable her to earn enough to provide for the education of her children.
