loans.use: to buy 2 drums of oil and 2 sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Hebron city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ihab works as an employee in a local firm and earns a very low income, which is not enough to cover all his family's needs. He is also a student at a local university, where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his study and find a better job in the future.

Ihab has taken out a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay his university fees for this semester and pay some of the urgent expenses he has.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for this semester

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man from Rafah city, Palestine. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as a public sector employee and receives a very low income, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Mohammad is a student at a local university, where he studies accounting. He wants to complete his study and find a job in the future. 

Mohammad has taken out a loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his study. It will help him in doing his homework and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with one child who is still at school. She is 60 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothes such as blouses, school uniforms, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Marivic has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Uch's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Battambang province of Cambodia, Uch is 53 years old and the mother of six children. She grows cassava on two hectares of land and works for others to earn more income to support her family. For Uch, this is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans. This time, she is leading a group of two to obtain a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can get more income to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Battambang province, Vuthy is 32 years old. She is a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows sesame and corn on a two hectare area. Moreover, she can earn extra income via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can get more income to update her house and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Hin's Group

texts.en: Hin, 31, lives with family members in a rural area of the Battambang province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and the other one is too young. She earns income to support her family condition via rice cropping and pig raising. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn more income. For Hin, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets and pig feed. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una joven mujer de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno. 
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Batallas’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse en la parte oeste del lago sagrado ‘Titicaca’ a una altura promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y techo de paja, cuenta con energía eléctrica y recoge agua para todos los usos del lago. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado vacuno, el cual debe alimentar hasta su engorde para el comercio y reproducción para las nuevas generaciones. “heredé el negocio de mi padres, ellos se dedican al trabajo de la tierra y todo el trabajo de ganadería lo realizo yo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el área cuenta con ferias semanales de comercio de ganado, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de ganado y forraje. Su sueño es tener un establo grande y en buenas condiciones para que su ganado crezca más grande. Ella desea realizar la compra de ganado vacuno para su engorde y venta en las siguientes fiestas patronales del lugar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y forraje, para su engorde y venta en las próximas fiestas patronales del lugar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 18 years old, single and has no children. She has a business trading cattle.

Carmen is enterprising, optimistic, happy, and has a good attitude; she is also responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the Batallas community, an area to the west of the holy Lake Titicaca. Sitting at an altitude of around 3900 meters above sea level, the climate here is cold and dry, with the daily temperature oscillating between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Carmen has dark skin, brown eyes, and black hair that she ties back. She is short and has a medium build. She dresses fashionably. Carmen’s mother tongue is Aymara, and she also speaks Spanish in daily life and at her business. Carmen lives with her parents, who work in farming. The family lives in a home built with adobe bricks and a thatched roof. The house has electricity and has water taken from the lake. Carmen has a business trading in cattle, which she feeds until they are large enough to trade or reproduce. 

Carmen says, "I inherited the business from my parents. They work the land and while I do all the work with cattle.” The advantage of Carmen’s business is that the area has weekly cattle trade markets; the disadvantage is that Carmen does not have capital to buy livestock and fodder. 

Carmen’s dream is to have a large stable that is in good condition where her cattle grow to a larger size. 

Carmen wants to buy cattle to fatten up and sell at the next local festival. This is her first loan with the lending institution in the two years that she has been working independently in cattle raising.

It is for these reasons that Carmen is applying for a loan to buy bovine cattle and fodder to fatten up and sell the animals at the next local festivals.

loans.use: to buy bovine cattle and fodder to fatten up and sell the animals at the next local festivals.

loans.name: Novedades Brayan Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Novedades Brayan” está conformado por tres mujeres que trabajan por brindarles las mejores oportunidades a su familia. Ellas viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde la mayor parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz y muchos otros tienen un pequeño negocio.
Emma tiene 20 años de experiencia como comerciante: “Inicié con la venta de ropa porque necesitaba ayudar con los gastos de mis hijos”. Poco a poco Emma comenzó a vender otros productos como accesorios para el cabello y joyería de fantasía en las plazas y pueblos más pequeños, recuerda que en aquél tiempo no tenía un local fijo pero aun así sus ganancias eran importantes. 
Poco a poco ahorró para poder pagar la renta de un local y dejar de caminar entre las calles. En ese tiempo también decidió vender ropa, lo que le ha ayudado a aumentar sus ventas. Su dificultad es precisamente la renta del lugar y aunque ha buscado ya otras opciones de renta ha decidido que lo mejor sería tener su propio establecimiento. El nuevo préstamo lo aprovechará para comprar más mercancía y pagar la renta del local.
“Mi única meta es poder seguir ayudando a mi hijo con sus estudios, me encantaría verlo con una carrera profesional para que así pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
*En la imagen las integrantes posan en uno de los pasillos del jardín municipal. Muy cerca también se encuentran el palacio de gobierno, la plazoleta, una fuente, un quiosco y una iglesia católica.
texts.en:
The “Novedades Brayan” group is made up of three women who work to give their families better opportunities. They live in a very calm community where the majority of the population grows corn, and many others have small businesses.

Emma has 20 years of experience as a saleswoman: "I started selling clothing because I needed to help with my children's expenses." Little by little, she started to sell other products, such as hair accessories and costume jewelry, in plazas and smaller towns. At that time, she did not have a fixed business property, but her earnings were still important.

Little by little, she saved up to pay rent on a property and to stop walking from street to street. At that time, she also decided to sell clothing, which has helped her to improve her sales. Her difficulty is the rent for the property. Although she has searched for other rental opportunities, she has decided that the best option is to have her own establishment. She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise and pay rent on her property.

"My only goal is to continue helping my son with his studies. I would love to see him with a professional career so he can have a better quality of life."

*In the picture, the members pose in one of the walkways of the municipal garden. The governmental palace, town square, a fountain, a newsstand and a Catholic church are also nearby.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and pay rent on her property.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Residing in Battambang province, Kim is 43 years old and a mother of three children. She grows cassava on one hectare of land as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 40,000 KHR per day. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Familia Cedros Group

texts.es:
Doña Isidora es una mujer muy dedicada y alegre, siempre se le ve sonriendo. Tiene 47 años de edad y está casada con el señor Francisco quien trabaja en la construcción; ellos son padres de seis hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen de la pareja.
Hace 4 años Isidora comenzó a criar y vender borregos, eligió la actividad porque es el negocio principal de la región debido a que hay muchas personas que se dedican a preparar y vender barbacoa. Ella conserva los animales durante seis o siete meses y después los vende a las mismas personas de su comunidad que utilizan la carne para preparar el tradicional platillo.
Todos los días, muy temprano Isidora saca sus borregos al campo donde puede aprovechar la pastura lo que le ayuda a no invertir tanto capital en alimento. “Cuando inicié el negocio solo teníamos tres borreguitos, pero gracias al apoyo de VisionFund y Kiva hemos llegado a tener hasta 10” comentó muy contenta. El nuevo préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más corderos.
Uno de los sueños de Isidora es mejorar su vivienda y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio, Doña Isidora es la señora de mayor edad*
texts.en:
Isidora is very hapy and hard-working. She is always smiling. Isidora is 47 years old and married to Francisco, a builder. The couple are parents to six children who still depend on their parents.

Four years ago, Isidora started raising and selling lambs. She chose this type of work as it is the most common business in the region, with many people making a living preparing and selling barbeque meat. Isidora looks after the animals for six to seven months and then sells them to people who will use their meat for preparing traditional meals in the local area.

Isidora takes her lambs out to the fields very early every day. There, the lambs can eat the grass, allowing Isidora not to have to invest so much money in feed.

Very happy, Isidora says, “When I started the business, I had just three little lambs but, thanks to the support of VisionFund and Kiva, I have had up to ten of them.”

This new loan will be used to buy more lambs.

One of Isidora’s dreams is to make improvements to her home and to continue supporting her children so that they may finish a university degree and enjoy a higher quality of life.

* The photograph was taken at the town park. Isidora is at the back.

loans.use: to buy lambs.

location.town: Concepción chico, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: A 48 ans, Mana est une femme mariée et avec ses deux enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Mana vend de la pate de manioc en gros à ses clients et trouve ses gains grâce à ce commerce. Mana s’approvisionne une fois par mois dans un marché du quartier. Mana réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce et nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de pate de manioc afin de  gagner plus de  bénéfice et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en: At 48 years old, Mana is a married woman with two children. She lives in the Adidogomé district. Mana sells manioc paste wholesale to her clients and makes a living thanks to this business. Mana buys her stock once a month at a local market. Mana manages to make very good profitability from her activity and needs this loan to buy sacks of manioc paste in order to make more profits and help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of manioc paste.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 42 ans. Mariée, Yawa est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Yawa vend des tubercules dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Yawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des calebasses d’ignames, Yawa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en: Yawa lives in Adidogomé  and is 42 years old, Yawa is married with four children and works hard to facilitate their education. Yawa sells tubers locally and in her district to make enough income to provide for their subsistence. Yawa stocks up once a month at the market. To order her yam tubers, Yawa requests this loan to make her purchase and to ensure her financial viability.

loans.use: to buy 07 yam tubers.

loans.name: El Molino Del Rosal Group

texts.es:
El hornear pan es todo un arte para la familia que conforma el grupo “El Molino del Rosal”. Nietos, nueras e hijos se dedican al mismo negocio. En la comunidad donde viven, esta es la actividad por excelencia y cada familia imprime su propio toque al pan que hornea.
Cristina es una mujer muy amable y sonriente, tiene 33 años y está casada con Edgar; ellos son padres de tres niños que se encuentran estudiando. 
“Provengo de una familia de panaderos, desde pequeña tuve contacto con la actividad, la aprendí con el paso del tiempo y cuando decidí formar una familia también inicie mi propio negocio” comentó Cristina. Actualmente, cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en su negocio independiente y gracias a los préstamos de VisonFund tiene la posibilidad de invertir en todos los ingredientes necesarios. Con el nuevo préstamo comprará harina, huevo, azúcar, levadura, etc.  
Doña Cristina hornea principalmente pan de naranja o vainilla y deja volar su creatividad para crear figuras para finalmente hornear el pan durante media hora.
Cristina, al igual que los demás integrantes del grupo, busca las mejores ferias de la zona para vender su pan, aunque en algunas ocasiones esta también es su mayor dificultad, ya que las autoridades no le permiten vender libremente en cualquier punto, no sin una cuota significativa.
Sin embargo, Cristina tiene una actitud muy positiva y su meta es poner un establecimiento para vender más pan y contratar a otras personas de su comunidad.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Fermina, Jaqueline, Maria Luisa, Magdalena y Francisca quienes también solicitan su préstamo para comprar ingredientes y seguir horneando pan de fiesta.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco del municipio, Doña Cristina es quien viste el suéter blanco*
texts.en:
Baking is an art for the family which makes up the "El Molino del Rosal" group. Grandchildren, daughters-in-law and children all work in the same business. In the community where they live, this is an excellent activity and every family puts their own touch on the bread which they bake.

Cristina is a very friendly and smiling person. She is 33 years old and married to Edgar. They are the parents of three children, who are studying. "I come from a family of bakers, from a young age I had contact with this activity. I learned it over time and when I decided to start a family, I also started my own business," said Cristina. She now has 13 years of experience in her independent business and thanks to the loans from VisionFund she has the opportunity to invest in all of the necessary ingredients. With this new loan, she will buy flour, eggs, sugar, yeast, etc.

Cristina mainly bakes orange or vanilla bread. She lets her creativity soar to create figures in order to bake bread over half an hour. 

Cristina, like the other members of this group, searches for the best fairs in the area to sell her bread. However, on some occasions this is also her greatest difficulty since the authorities do not allow her to sell freely at any point without a significant quota. However, Cristina has a very positive attitude and her goal is to set up a property to sell more bread and hire other people from the community.

The other members of the group are Fermina, Jaqueline, Maria Luisa, Magdalena and Francisca, who are also applying for loans to buy ingredients and continue baking festive bread.

*The photo was taken on the stairs below the municipality's newsstand. Cristina is wearing a white sweater.*

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
“Nuevo Día” es un grupo formado por mujeres campesinas de una comunidad mazahua que trabajan por el bienestar de su familia. En VisionFund y KIVA han podido encontrar una oportunidad para mejorar su negocio y ayudar a su pareja a solventar los gastos de sus hogares. 
Ella es una chica muy alegre, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada con Miguel y tienen tres niños, de los cuales dos estudian el preescolar y la primaria.
Hace un año, Elena conoció a VisionFund y se animó a solicitar un préstamo para comprar algunos corderos, cuidarlos  y venderlos para tener un poco más de ganancias para su familia. Con ese primer préstamo, Elena compró una borrega y un codero, la primera tuvo crías a los seis meses y desde entonces ha continuado solicitando dinero como en esta ocasión para comprar más animales.
 “Estoy muy contenta y agradecida con Kiva y VisionFund porque tengo mi propia actividad y mi propio dinero” comentó muy sonriente Elena. 
Temprano por las mañanas, Elena atiende a su familia y realiza las actividades del hogar para después dedicar más de medio día a cuidar sus borregos. 
Elena quiere lo mejor para sus hijos, “Realmente todo lo que hacemos es para el  bienestar de mis niños para que puedan tener una mejora calidad de vida” comenta Elena. Elena sueña con mejorar su vivienda y terminar de estudiar la preparatoria, lo que quizá le permitirá tener otro trabajo o negocio. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son María Luisa y Magdalena quienes invierten en una tienda de abarrotes, María Juana, Angelina y Constantina invierten en borregos y Matilde en pollos.
*En la imagen aparecen todas las integrantes del grupo, Elena es quien tiene el suéter negro, la fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del municipio, al lado del quiosco y de la iglesia católica.
texts.en:
“Nuevo Día” ("New Day") is a group made up of rural women in a Mazahua community who work for their families' well-being. In VisionFund and Kiva they have been able to find an opportunity to improve their businesses and help their partners with the household expenses.

This borrower is a very happy girl with great aspirations in life. She is 28 years old and is married to Miguel. They have three children, of whom two are studying in preschool and elementary school.

One year ago, Elena learned about VisionFund and was inspired to apply for a loan to buy some lambs to raise and sell, earning a little extra income for her family. With that first loan, Elena bought a sheep and a lamb. The sheep gave birth to lambs after six months. Since then, she has been applying for loans such as this one to buy more animals.

"I am very happy and grateful to Kiva and VisionFund because I have my own business and my own money," said Elena with a big smile. Early in the mornings, she takes care of her family and does household chores in order to dedicate more than half of the day to taking care of her sheep. Elena wants the best for her children. "Really, everything we do is for the well-being of my children so they can have a better quality of life," says Elena. She dreams of improving her home and finishing her studies, which may allow her to have another job or business.

The other members of the group are María Luisa and Magdalena, who will invest in a grocery store; María Juana, Angelina and Constantina, who will invest in buying sheep; and Matilde, who will buy chickens.

*All of the group members appear in the photo. Elena is wearing a black sweater. The photo was taken on the stairs of the municipality, next to the newsstand and Catholic church.

loans.use: to buy more lambs.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 37 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 37 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Ils habitent dans le même quartier et font différentes activités comme la vente de poisson, de légumes et des crustacés. Ils se réunissent chaque fin de mois pour organiser des tontines et discuter des problèmes de l'environnement du quartier. NDIEME est la présidente, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est veuve  et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des poissons. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité. NDIEME sollicite ce montant pour aller dans la petite cote acheter des poissons pour revenir les vendre dans le marché local. Elle commence sa journée à 6 h pour la terminer à 16 H. Elle prend en charge toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle voudrait avec l'aide de l'institution, avoir une place dans le marché et y déposer son stock ainsi elle pourra augmenter et diversifier ses produits. De ce fait elle pourra épargner de l'argent et améliorer les condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Jiguène Bakhna 37 is a sub group of the Association of Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. They live in the same locality and run different businesses such as selling fish, vegetables and shellfish. They meet up at the end of every month to organise savings groups and discuss problems of the local environment. Ndieme is the president, she has her hand raised in the photo. She is a widow who has children and she sells fish. She has more than ten years experience in this activity. Ndieme requests this loan to go to the Petite Cote to buy fish that she will sell at the local market on her return. She starts work at 0600 and works until 1600. She assumes all the daily family expenses and her children's school fees. With a little help from the institution, she would like to obtain a stall at the market to deposit her stock to give her a chance to diversify and increase her products. In this way she would be able to save up some money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Las Coquetas Group

texts.es:
En un municipio del estado de Veracruz, hay dos fábricas que representan una fuente de empleo para más de 1500 personas: un frigorífico y una vidriera. En el lugar también se pueden observar pequeños negocios que son el medio de vida de propietarios como los integrantes del grupo “Las Coquetas”. Los miembros del grupo y sus actividades son:

Ana – Venta de Antojitos 
Arianna - Venta de Abarrotes
Candy - Venta de Ropa 
María Del Carmen - Venta de Bisutería 
Gladis - Venta de Colchas, Cortinas, Oro Laminado
Osiris,  María Teresita - Bisutería
Verónica – Club Nutricional
María - Venta de Repostería 
Gladys - Taller Mecánico 
Celia - Venta de Carne Y Ropa 
Epifanio – Servicio de Construcción
Juan - Venta de Jugos De Naranja 
Isaías - Venta de Carne

Gladys tiene 37 años de edad y se convirtió en madre de una joven hace 16 años. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el taller mecánico que abrió hace 6 años al volver de Estados Unidos invirtiendo en las herramientas más elementales. 

Gladys es la representante legal del taller, es ella quien está inscrita ante hacienda para poder otorgar facturas a los clientes que así lo solicitan. Además de ser ama de casa y dueña oficial del taller, hace un mes comenzó a vender ropa. “Mi madre fue quien me prestó el capital para iniciar el negocio” este es el segundo mes de experiencia de Gladys y está muy contenta con los resultados por lo que ha decidido continuar con la actividad.

El préstamo anterior le ayudo significativamente ya que lo invirtió en la compra de pinzas y llaves que les son necesarias a diario en el taller, pero esta vez invertirá en la compra de un gato, grasa, aceite y algunas llaves ya que son las que con más facilidad se extravían.

Su mayor logro ha sido ahorrar lo necesario para comprar un terreno e iniciar con la construcción de una casa de tal manera que ha dejado de pagar renta. Además, para Gladys es importante ir formando un patrimonio para su hija, brindarle la posibilidad de estudiar y una mejor calidad de vida. 

“Gracias por brindarnos una oportunidad de crecimiento en cada una de nuestras actividades logrando que nuestros sueños se hagan realidad” son las palabras del grupo.

*El grupo se reúne en casa de Arianna quien vede abarrotes, la fotografía fue tomada en el negocio, la señora Gladys  viste playera color gris.
texts.en:
In a municipality in the state of Veracruz, there are two factories that represent a source of employment for more than 1500 people, one for refrigerators and one for windows. In this place one can also see small business that are the means of life for owners like the members of the Los Coquetas group.  The member of the group and their businesses are:

Ana – snack sales 
Arianna - grocery sales
Candy - clothing sales 
María Del Carmen - costume jewelry sales 
Gladis - bedding, curtains, and gold leaf sales
Osiris,  María Teresita - costumer jewelry
Verónica – nutritional club
María - baked good sales
Gladys - auto repair shop 
Celia - meat and clothing sales
Epifanio – construction services
Juan - orange juice sales 
Isaías - meat sales

Gladys is 37 years old and became a mother as a young woman 16 years ago.  Her husband works in an auto repair shop which he opened 6 years ago after returning from the United States and investing in the most essential tools. 

Gladys is the legal representative of the shop. It is she who is registered in the treasury to be able to provide bills for the customers who ask for them.

In addition to being a housewife and official owner of the shop, a month ago, she began to sell clothing. "My mother was the one who lent me the capital to begin the business." This is the second month of experience for Gladys and she is very happy with the results so she has decided to continue with the work. 

The previous loan helped her significantly since she invested it in the purchase of pliers and wrenches that are necessary on a daily basis in the shop, but this time she will invest in the purchase of a jack, grease, oil, and some wrenches since they are what get misplaced most easily.

Her greatest accomplishment has been to save what she needed to purchase a plot of land and begin with the construction of a house so she has stopped paying rent. In addition, for Gladys it is important to create a legacy for her daughter, offering her the possibility of schooling and a better quality of life. 

“Thank you for offering us an opportunity for growth in each of our businesses, making our dreams come true" are the words of the group.

*The group meets in Arianna's house, who sells groceries; the photo was taken in the business. Gladys is wearing a grey t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase a jack, grease, oil and wrenches.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 104 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 104 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Il  est composé de 5 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes et qui habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent différentes activités. La présidente Madame OUMOU est celle qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et des articles de merceries, elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et augmenter ses revenus. Elle souhaite à l'avenir ouvrir une mercerie dans le marché local pour diversifier ses produits.
texts.en: Jiguène Bakhna 104 is a sub group of the Association of Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. It is made up of five members who are all women who live in the same locality and run different businesses. Mrs. Oumou is the president, she has her hand raised in the photo. She is married with children and she is in the fabric and haberdashery goods trade. She has over five years experience in this activity. She starts work at 0800 and works until 1800. She requests this loan to reinforce her stock of merchandise and increase her income. In the future she would like to open a haberdashery shop at the local market to diversify her products.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, perfume and haberdashery articles for resale.

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Eduviges es una mujer de campo, vive en una comunidad mazahua que cuenta con la presencia y apoyo de la empresa socia de VisionFund, incluso sus hijos son parte de los programas de la institución de ayuda humanitaria.
 
Hace 7 años, Eduviges utilizó su primer préstamo para iniciar a criar cerdos. “Siempre había querido tener animales porque mi papá ya tenía la experiencia  en la actividad pero nos hacía falta dinero para iniciar por eso estoy muy agradecida con VisionFund”. Entonces, Eduviges compró siete lechones y con el paso del tiempo, las ganancias y los demás préstamos, ha llegado a tener hasta 20 cerdos. 
Eduviges vende los animales a personas de su comunidad, especialmente cuando hay fiestas como bodas, XV Años y bautizos ya que la carne se utiliza para los platillos que ofrecen a los asistentes. Recientemente vendió todos los cerdos que tenía y por eso necesita invertir nuevamente para comprar 5 lechones más y alimento. 
En los últimos meses, Eduviges también ha invertido en otro tipo de animales como pollos y pavos para tener un poco más de ganancias. Su sueño es terminar de arreglar su vivienda y construir tres locales en el mismo espacio para vender ropa y zapatos. Aun así, le gustaría conservar la actividad que también le ha ayudado a mejorar sus ganancias para que sus tres hijos continúen estudiando. 
*En la imagen: Eduviges con algunos de los pollos que tiene en casa.
texts.en:
Eduviges is a country woman. She lives in a Mazahua community where the field partner VisionFund works and supports the people. Even her children are part of the institution's programs for humanitarian aid.

Seven years ago, Eduviges requested her first loan to start rearing pigs. 'I had always wanted to have animals because my father already had experience in the sector, but we needed money to start up. I am very grateful to VisionFund'.

With the first loan, Eduviges bought 7 piglets. After that, with time, the profits she made and other loans, she has had up to 20 pigs.

Eduviges sells the animals to people in her community, especially when there are parties such as weddings, 'quinceñeras' and christenings. In those celebrations the dishes offered to the guests are commonly made with pork.

Recently, she sold all the pigs she had and now she needs to invest in her business again and buy 5 piglets more and pig feed.

In the last few months, Eduviges has also bought other animals, like chicken and turkey, to make more profits.

She wishes to finish fixing her house and to add three rooms to it so that she can sell clothes and shoes. But even then, she would like to keep her animal sales business, because it helped her increase her income and provide for her three children so that they could go on studying.

In the picture: Eduviges with some of the chickens she has at home.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Zyanya Group

texts.es:
Zyanya lleva por nombre un grupo ubicado en una de las colonias de un municipio de Veracruz conocido como La Novia del Sol. Se le conoce así por las altas temperaturas de la región que también propician el cultivo de caña y naranja, principalmente.

El nombre del grupo hace honor a una de las hijas de la representante. Los integrantes se unieron para solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México e invertir en cada una de sus actividades:

Rosalía, María - Antojitos 
Fabiola - Cosméticos, Plata Y Perfumes 
Rafael - Técnico Celulares
Maura -Perfumes Y Cosméticos 
Verónica - Cosméticos 
Gregorio -Albañil 
Iván - Piñatas Y Sandalias
Margarita -Perfumes, Oro Laminado 
Laura -Calzado Por Catalogo
Sonia – Ropa

Rosalía es madre soltera de dos jóvenes mayores de edad, con el firme propósito de apoyar a sus hijos para que continuaran estudiando inició a vender antojitos en su casa. Todos los días Rosalía coloca cuatro mesas en patio de su casa, prepara la carne desde la tarde, dora las tortillas, hace la salsa, raya el queso, hierve las papas y acomoda todos los trastes que regularmente utiliza. De 6:30 pm a 13:30 am, Rosalía atiende y limpia nuevamente el patio. “Ganar mi propio dinero, sin descuidar a mi familia es lo mejor de mi actividad”. Además la madre de Rosalía trabaja con ella, vendiendo las bebidas que acompañan la comida. 

Invertir un nuevo préstamo le permitirá comprar carne, queso, crema, aceite, una parrilla de 4 quemadores y dos comales  para dejar de preparar la mayor parte de la comida en su cocina y optimizar el tiempo que pasa atendiendo a los comensales. 

Con las ganancias obtenidas, Rosalía solventa los gastos del hogar, del negocio, logró comprar un televisor, un refrigerador, una licuadora y una plancha para renovar poco a poco su hogar.

Muy pronto, Rosalía iniciará la venta de cosméticos por catálogo con el fin de obtener más ganancias y ampliar su negocio de antojitos.

*En la fotografía doña Rosalía es quien viste blusa color verde.
texts.en:
Zyanya is the name of a group located in one of the communities in a municipality of Veracruz known as La Novia del Sol. It is known as this due to the high temperatures in the region that also promote the cultivation of sugar cane and oranges, primarily.

The group's name is in honor of one of the daughters of the representative. The members got together to ask VisionFund México for a loan and invest it in each of their businesses:

Rosalía, María - snacks 
Fabiola - cosmetics, silver and perfumes 
Rafael - cell phone technician
Maura - perfumes and cosmetics 
Verónica - cosmetics 
Gregorio - bricklayer 
Iván - piñatas and sandals
Margarita - perfumes, gold leaf items 
Laura - footwear from a catalog
Sonia – clothing

Rosalía is the single mother of two young adults, with the firm goal of supporting her children so that they continue their schooling, she began to sell snacks in her house. Every day, Rosalía sets out four tables on the patio of her house, prepares the meat in the afternoon, warms the tortillas, makes the sauce, grates the cheese, boils the potatoes, and sets up the dishes that she regularly uses. From 6:30 pm to 1:30 am, Rosalía serves and cleans the patio. "To earn my own money, without neglecting my family, is the best part of my work." In addition, Rosalía's mother works with her, selling the drinks that go with the food. 

To invest another loan will allow her to purchase meat, cheese, cream, oil, a grill with 4 burners, and two hotplates to stop preparing the majority of the food in her kitchen and optimize the time that she spends serving the diners. 

With the earnings she gets, Rosalía covers the household expenses, and those of the business. She managed to purchase a television, a refrigerator, a blender, and a griddle to, little by little, renovate her home. 

Very soon, Rosalía will begin to sell cosmetics from a catalog with the goal of getting more earnings and expanding her snack business. 

*In the photo Rosalía is the one wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to purchase meat, cheese, cream, oil, a grill with 4 burners, and 2 hotplates.

loans.name: Louisette Yolande

texts.fr:
Louisette est une femme courageuse de 32 ans. Elle élève 3 enfants avec son mari dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe. Elle vend du charbon devant son domicile depuis plus de 4 ans.

Le partenariat entre Louisette et Vahatra a démarré en 2013 et lui a surtout permis d’augmenter son stock de marchandise et de ne plus vendre le charbon au détail mais en plus grande quantité. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbon et ainsi d’augmenter son activité.

La priorité pour Louisette est aujourd’hui de pouvoir faire vivre sa famille et d’assurer une éducation correcte à ses enfants encore en bas âge. Elle espère pouvoir être un jour pleinement autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
Louisette is a brave woman of 32. She is raising three children with her husband in the urban commune of Antsirabe. She has been selling charcoal from in front of her home for four years.

Louisette started to collaborate with Vahatra in 2013 and this has enabled her above all to increase her stock of merchandise and no longer sell her goods retail, but in greater quantity. This loan will enable her to buy new sacks of charcoal and in this way expand her activity.

Louisette's priority today is to be capable of providing for her family and to ensure a proper education for her children who are still very young. She hopes to be completely financially independent one day.

loans.use: To buy a stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a very low income that is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies English literature. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job in the future.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mamitiana Dieudonne

texts.fr:
Mamitiana est un homme courageux de 43 ans. Il est originaire de la côté ouest de Madagascar et est venu s’installer il y a quelques années sur les hauts plateaux où il y a plus d’opportunités pour se lancer dans sa propre activité. Il vit donc dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe avec sa femme et ses 2 garçons. Il tient un stand au marché où il vend divers articles en plastiques (seaux, bassines) ainsi que de la vaisselle. 

Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Les différents prêts qu’il a obtenus lui ont permis d’offrir une plus large gamme de choix d’articles à proposer à sa clientèle. Il a donc pu diversifier sa marchandise et s’orienter également vers la vente de sandales en plastique. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira notamment à augmenter son stock de sandales afin qu’il devienne plus conséquent.

Il espère, à terme, pouvoir être entièrement autonome financièrement et surtout pouvoir garantir une éducation satisfaisante à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mamitiana is a brave man of 43. He comes from the West Coast of Madagascar and has moved to the High Plateau, where there is more opportunity to set up an independent business, a few years ago. He lives in the urban commune of Antsirabe, with his wife and two sons. He has a stall at the market where he sells various plastic articles (buckets, bowls) as well as crockery.

He started to collaborate with Vahatra two years ago. The different loans that he has obtained have enabled him to offer a wider range of articles to his customers. He has been able to diversify his merchandise and also add the sale of plastic sandals to his offer. This new loan will in particular be used to increase his stock of sandals to make his offer more substantial.

Over time, he hopes to become completely financially autonomous and above all to be able to guarantee his children a satisfactory education.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sandals.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
A local resident from Kampong Cham province, Sokhoeun is 56 years old and a mother of eight children. She can earn income to support her family’s living via cleaning on the public road. Moreover, she can earn extra income via driving a motor taxi. She has been involved in this for ages and it earns her about $12 USD per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a decent motor to support her business. She hopes that she can get more income to update her family's living conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy a decent motor to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
Nuon is originally from a rural area of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is aged 40 years old, and she is a married mother of three children; they are all dependent children that she needs to look after. Only one among the three dependent children is in school. 

The main source of her family income has come from potato farming and rice farming for 22 years. She could earn around 48,000 KHR per day.  

Nuon’s group consists of two members, and this is the first loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has now decided to lead the group to apply for this loan, with her portion being used to buy farming supplies for her farm. She hopes that she could earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Patron San Sebastian De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas, y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank group "Patron San Sebastian de Cusco". This bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

Luz Marina is single and is 39 years old and has 2 children. She works in her business selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and meat stir-fries. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has had this business for 8 years now and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She asks for the loan to purchase cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members work selling construction materials, selling clothing, at a grocery store and a restaurant.

The member is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Don Marco Tulio se dedica desde hace más de seis años a la venta y elaboración de dulces típicos. Sus dulces los elabora con ingredientes propios de la región, y los lleva a vender a las ferias departamentales y municipales. Los dulces gustan a toda le gente debido a la buena elaboración y sabor. Este es su tercer crédito y sus pagos los realizo siempre en la fecha de pago. Solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, coco, camote, pepita, manías y panela. Agradece a Kiva y Fape por el apoyo que le han brindado ya que con esto sus ventas y ganancias han aumentado.
texts.en: Marco Tulio has made and sold traditional candies for more than six years.  He makes his candies with ingredients from the region and he takes them to sell at the departmental and municipal fairs. Everyone likes the sweets because of their flavor and because they are made well. This is his third loan and he always makes his payments on time. He is asking for the loan to buy sugar, coconut, yams, pumpkin seeds, peanuts and whole cane sugar. He thanks Kiva and Fape for the support they have given him, because with is his sales and profits have increased.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional candies.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
Mi prieta linda es el vagón de una locomotora que hace homenaje a los ferrocarrileros y a este tipo de transporte en la ciudad donde se conformó el grupo “Las Vecinas”. Ellas crearon un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México y mejorar cada una de sus actividades:

Carmen – Venta de Perfumes 
Victoria - Venta de Comida Y Cosméticos 
Ana - Venta de Ropa 
Itzel - Venta de Cosméticos Y Colchas

Doña Victoria, mejor conocida como Viki, se ha dedicado a vender antojitos los fines de semana desde hace ya 3 años. Ella atiende a sus clientes de 7 am a 10 pm con un intermedio para dedicar tiempo a las tareas de su hogar. Su esposo Nicolás la apoya en todo cuanto puede además de acompañarla por las tardes mientras ella vende.

La pasión por cocinar, acompañada de la experiencia después de trabajar en un restaurant e, es lo que motivó a doña Viki, a iniciar su propio negocio sin descuidar a su familia. Desde que comenzó la actividad, ha vendido en un pequeño local comercial donde tiene tres mesas, una parrilla de tres quemadores y un refrigerador y es allí mismo donde también muestra los catálogos de cosméticos a sus clientas para aprovechar el tiempo de espera. 

El préstamo anterior le fue de mucha utilidad al invertirlo en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los antojitos, con las ganancias adquirió un refrigerador nuevo, una licuadora, una plancha, ropa y zapatos para ella. “Dios da para todos” son las palabras de doña Viki quien afronta sin problema alguno la competencia.

Con el nuevo préstamo comprará  leche, jamaica, avena, plátanos, crema, queso, masa, carne, chile, cebolla y platos de plástico ya que es lo que más necesita para preparar y seguir vendiendo sus antojitos.

La meta de Viki es tener una fonda de comida corrida donde pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de platillos. También le gustaría tener su propio local para dejar de gastar en rentas.

“Las Vecinas” agradecen a Kiva y  a VisionFund México los préstamos otorgados, que han favorecido el crecimiento de cada actividad, de tal manera que con parte de las ganancias aportan para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

*En la fotografía las integrantes están de pie frente a un a antiguo pozo, doña Viki es quien viste  la blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
"Mi prieta linda" is the name of the locomotive wagon which honors the railway workers and this type of transportation in the city where “Las Vecinas” (The Neighbors) group was formed. They created a group in order to request a loan to VisionFund México and to improve each of their businesses: Carmen – Perfume sales; Victoria - Food and cosmetics sale; Ana - clothes sale; Itzel - Cosmetics and blankets sales.
Victoria, better known as Viki, has worked for 3 years already selling snacks on the weekends. She serves her customers from 7 am to 10 pm with a break devoted to household chores. Her husband Nicolas supports her with all he can besides helping her in the afternoons when she is selling. Her cooking passion as well as her experience after having worked at a restaurant, motivated Viki to start her own business without neglecting her family.  Since she started this business she has sold at a small commercial store where she has three tables, a grill with three burners and a refrigerator. This is also where she shows the cosmetic catalogs to her customers in order to take advantage of the wait time. Her previous loan was very helpful because she invested it in buying ingredients to prepare snacks, and with the earnings she purchased a new refrigerator, a blender, an iron, clothes and shoes for herself. "God provides for everyone", are Viki's words, who faces competition without problems. With the new loan she will buy milk, hibiscus flowers (jamaica), oatmeal, bananas, cream, cheese, dough, meat, chile, onion and plastic dishes, because this is what she needs the most to keep on selling her snacks. Viki's goal is to have a restaurant with a set menu where she can offer a larger variety of dishes. She would also like to own a place so she does not need to pay rent. “Las Vecinas” are grateful to Kiva and to VisionFund México for the given loans that have favored the growth of each of their businesses in a way in which they are able to offer a better quality of life to their families with part of their earnings.  
*On the picture, the members are standing in front of an old well. Viki is wearing a pink blouse.

loans.use: to buy milk, hibiscus flower (jamaica), oatmeal, bananas, cream, cheese, dough, meat, chili, onions and plastic dishes.

loans.name: Media Luna Group

texts.es:
Ubicada en la parte de mayor potencial de ganadería en la ciudad, donde en diciembre se celebra la feria ganadera, con carreras de caballo, jaripeo y corridas de toros, se encuentra la colonia donde se integró el grupo “Media Luna”. Los integrantes están solicitando un crédito a VisionFund México para invertir y mejorar cada una de sus actividades:

Hada, América – Venta de Comida 
Lluvia - Venta de Cosméticos 
Xochilt - Venta de Bisutería 
Itzel - Venta de Ropa 
Rocio - Venta de Cosméticos Y Hortalizas
José - Venta de Ropa Y Calzado

Roció está casada con Irán con quien ha procreado  dos hijos de 12 y 7 años quienes estudian en la primaria de la colonia, donde ella es mejor conocida como Chío. 

Desde hace 4 años Chío se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo obteniendo el 50% de la venta total como ganancia. Antes de ser vendedora directa ayudaba a su comadre quien la motivó para inscribirse y tener sus propios catálogos y clientes.

Hace 5 meses Chío inició otra actividad: invirtió un préstamo en semillas de chile, cilantro, jitomate, rábano y maíz, y convirtió el patio de su casa en un huerto. Además de obtener ganancias de la venta ambulante de los productos antes mencionados ya no gasta en la compra autoconsumo. “Lo mejor de todo es compartir tiempo con mis hijos quienes me ayudan a regar y a cosechar”. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en semillas de cebolla, maíz, jitomate, chile, bolsas y una báscula. 

Por ahora chío solo vende su cosecha de manera ambulante pero no descarta la idea de poner un pequeño puesto fuera de su casa para exhibir mejor sus productos que además son orgánicos ya que no utiliza ningún químico. La Limpieza la realiza ella misma a mano o con ayuda de un azadón dependiendo del tipo de maleza.

Todos los integrantes se muestran muy agradecidos por la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo.

*La fotografía tomada frente a la casa de lluvia, Rocío es quien viste playera color anaranjado.
texts.en:
The community where the group 'Media Luna' was formed is located in the area of greatest farming potential of the city. There, a livestock fair is held in December, which includes rodeos, horse races and bullfighting.

The group members are requesting a loan to VisionFund México to invest in and improve each one of their businesses:

Hada and América - Food sales
Lluvia - Cosmetics sales
Xochilt - Jewelry sales
Itzel - Clothing sales
Rocío - Cosmetics sales and vegetable sales
José - Clothing and footwear sales

Rocío, better known as Chío in the community, is married with Irán. They have two children, aged 12 and 7, who go to primary school.

Chío has made a living selling cosmetics for 4 years now. She sells the products using mail-order catalogues getting 50% of each sale. Before being a seller, she used to help her Godmother, who encouraged her to sign in herself and have her own catalogues and clients.

Five months ago, Chío started another business. She used a loan to buy different types of seeds (chili pepper, coriander, tomato, radish and corn) and turned her backyard into a garden. This way, besides making an income with the cosmetics sales, she doesn't have to spend as much in food. "The best part is sharing time with my kids, they help me water and harvest the crops".

She will use the new loan to buy onion, corn, tomato and chili pepper seeds, bags and a scale.

For now, Chío only sells her vegetables as a street vendor. But she is open to the idea of setting up a small stall outside her house to show her products better. They are completely organic, she doesn't use any chemicals, she tends the crops herself by hand or using a hoe, depending on the type of weeds.

All the group members are very grateful for the opportunity of getting a loan.

The picture was taken in front of Lluvia's house. Rocío is the one wearing an orange t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy onion, corn, tomato and chili pepper seeds, bags and a scale

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 49 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 49 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Ils est composé de 5 personnes dont 4 femmes et un homme qui habitent tous dans le même quartier et pratiquent différentes activités. Ils se réunissent tous les fins de mois et organisent des tontines. Madame Penda est la présidente de ce sous groupe, c'est elle qui levée la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des bijoux. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des bracelets, des boucles d'oreilles et des bagues pour les revendre à ses clients potentiels. Avec les revenus qu'elle aura dans cette activité, elle va aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l'avenir, elle voudrait avoir une boutique de vente de bijoux dans le marché, ainsi elle pourra augmenter et diversifier ses produits. De ce fait elle va épargner un peu d'argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jiguène Bakhna 49 is a sub group of the Association of Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. It is composed of five members of which four women and a man, who live in the same locality and run different businesses. They meet up at the end of every month to organise savings groups.
Mrs. Penda is the president of this sub group and she has her hand raised in the photo. She is married with children and she has more than ten years experience. She sells jewellery. She requests this loan to buy bracelets, earrings, and rings for resale to her potential clients. With the income she will make from this business, she will help her husband to manage the daily family expenses and her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to have a stall in the market to sell jewellery. This would enable her to increase and diversify her products. In this way she will be able to save up some money and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy jewellery such as bracelets, earrings, and rings for resale.

loans.name: Aura Marina

texts.es: La señora Aura Marina de 28 años de edad,quien recide en Aldea Cruz Blanca ,San Juan Sacatepequez,tiene una venta de Consumo Diario por lo que tiene un año de trabajar y nos cuenta que con el credito anterior pudo incrementar un poco sus ventas, pero ahora que es época de verano necesita comprar leña y almacenarla para el tiempo de invierno y también surtir mas su negocio ya que eso ayudaría a mejorar su economía familiar y asi es como ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar . Nos cuenta también que el credito le ha sido de bastante ayuda y por eso nuevamente pide de su colaboración y desde ya esta muy agradecida.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en: Aura Marina is 28 years old. She lives in Aldea Cruz Blanca, San Juan Sacatepequez. She has a daily consumption store. She has had it for a year and she tells us that with the previous loan she was able to increase her sales a little, but now it is summer and she needs to buy firewood and put it away for winter. She also needs to stock her business more, because this will help her improve her family's finances, and it is also how she helps her husband with the household expenses.  She also tells us that the loan has been a big help to her and that is why she is asking for your cooperation again and she is already very thankful. She is asking for this loan to buy daily consumption products.

loans.use: to buy daily consumption products.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Simeng's Group

texts.en:
Simeng, a woman living in Kampong Cham province, is 26 years old. She is a mother of four children; two are in school and the other two are too young. She grows bitter gourd and sells snacks as her main sources of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Olivier

texts.es: Olivier, tiene la edad  de 32 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra e frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra principalmente en hacer curvas a nivel para evitar la erosión del suelo por la agua dd lluvia y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Olivier is 32 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his biggest priority. With his loan, he intends to buy fertilizer and other products to apply to his bean crop so that it will germinate well, as well as good quality bean seed. He also wants to pay for labor, mainly to make contours to avoid soil erosion from rain and to apply the products and help the crop once it is growing. This way, he can ensure good work. What he intends to do is take advantage of the good weather conditions and the soil that the are has for the this crop. He also wants to put his experience of several years managing basic grains into practice. He want to be able to buying the best products of better quality so his crop will have good growth and health and an adequate harvest, so in the short term he will have an important yield. He wants to use the income from the harvest he is expecting for the well being and education of his family, and meet some family goals and keep investing more in the crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Jose Serafin

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia la carrera de diseño gráfico.
Él es inteligente, feliz, alegre, entusiasta, responsable y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la zona ‘San Pedro’ un lugar caracterizado por el servicio para autos; repuestos, chapa y pintura, llanterías, lavado, etc.
Jose es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el Aymará por herencia familiar. Su vida al realiza en casa de sus padres que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera técnica de diseño gráfico y se prepara para concebir, programar, proyectar y realizar comunicaciones visuales, para transmitir mensajes con objetivos claros y determinados. Sus cualidades más destacables son su constante preocupación por aprender y estar al día con las modernas tecnologías informáticas y softwares, y se mantiene actualizado sobre lo que ocurre en el ámbito profesional y académico. “quiero finalizar mi carrera para trabajar ejerciendo mi profesión…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera es la demanda del sector por profesionales en ese rubro, la desventaja es que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, eso acorta sus horas de estudio. Su sueño es trabajar como diseñador gráfico para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y ayudar a sus padres.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is a 22 year old man. He is single, has no children and studies graphic design. He is intelligent, happy, cheerful, responsible and very hardworking. 
He works in the ‘San Pedro’ area, an area characterized by auto service: replacement parts, bodywork, painting, tires, car washing, etc.  

Jose has dark skin, short black hair, brown eyes, medium stature, and a thin build. His mother tongue is Spanish and he knows Aymará by family heritage. He lives in his parents' house which they own. It is made of bricks and cement with a metal sheeting roof. It has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. He is studying the technical major of graphic design. He is preparing to conceive, program, project and make visual communications to transmit messages with clear and determined messages. His most notable qualities are his constant wish to learn and be up to date with modern information technology and software. He stays up to date with everything that happens in the professional and academic fields. “I want to finish my major so I can practice my profession…”, he says. The advantage of his major is the demand in that area for people with degrees in that area. The disadvantage is that he studies and works at the same time, and that shortens his study time. His dream is to work as a graphic designer to increase his income and help his parents. 

These are the reasons why Jose is asking for a loan to buy a laptop computer to finish his major.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to finish his major.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita toils the land and grows rice. She engages in farming and sells rice. She also engages in food vending as supplemental income. 

She is a 32-year-old woman with two dependents residing in Talibon, Bohol. It has been four years now that she has engaged in these kind of businesses.

Merlita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pay for the laborers and have additional capital for food vending. These are very essential tools in uplifting her livelihood. She could now grow and sell more rice. At the same time, she could now purchase ingredients needed in preparing her food vending business.
Thus, she could now earn more, and start to expand her business.

With the additional capital, she is determined to handle it properly for the improvement of  her livelihood and to be able to support the needs of her children, including quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay the laborers and have additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 41-year-old widow with a 10-year-old child. 

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like chips, noodles, sugar, canned goods, coffee, soap, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioner and many others. 

Annaliza has requested a loan to purchase assorted goods like canned goods, soft drinks, rice and feeds. These stocks are very helpful in attracting prospective buyers. Thus, she will slowly improve her daily earnings and be able to pay her obligation. 

In this way, she could now set aside some savings for emergency purposes. She could be able to expand her business for a sustainable living and also to be able to continue send her child to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase assorted goods like canned goods, soft drinks, rice and feeds.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 51 years old and has five children.  Florenda is married, and two of her children are in school.

Florenda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Florenda requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Florenda has been raising pigs for 21 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florenda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.en:
A mother of seven dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Ngor is 44 years old. To support her family, she works as a construction worker and works for others for a fee to earn more income. 

For Ngor, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan to renovate her house. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Kampong Cham District

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai lives in a rural area of Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. She is 34 years old and she is a married woman who has two children who are both in school.

The family's source of income is from rice farming and corn farming for 16 years. She can earn around 29,000 KHR per day and save around 14,000 KHR each day for when needed.

This is the first loan cycle for Khai with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She applies for this first loan in order to buy farming supplies for her farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to better support her family and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham province, Kea is 43 years old and single. To support her family’s living, she weaves cotton scarves and grows sesame. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 45,000 KHR per day. 

For Kea, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy cotton and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cotton and pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Chanthou is 33 years old and a mother of one school child. 

Nowadays, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is the fifth cycle for Chanthou with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol is 32 years old. She is a married woman who has two children, and they are dependent children that she needs to care for. Only one dependent child among the two is in school. 

Thol lives in a rural area of Kampong Svay district of Kampong Thom province. The sources of her family income have been generated from rice farming and selling groceries for 12 years. 

Thol’s group consists of five members, and this is the fifth loan for her with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. Now, she is leading the group to apply for this loan and will use her portion to build a toilet for her family. She hopes that her family will have a better standard of living and have good health.

loans.use: to build a toilet

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Chea is 28 years old and married. She has three dependent children; two of them are still in school while the other one is too young to study. For the past ten years, Chea has been a rice farmer to support her big family. Her family earns about 37,000 KHR per day to meet their needs. She has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from the Kiva partner VisionFund. Chea used her loans to increase her living standards and send her children to school

Chea is the leader of a five-member loan group. She will use her portion of their loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. Chea hopes that her loan will help her to earn more income to support her family and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Seum's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Seum is 40 years old and married. She has three dependent children; two of them are still in school while the other one is too young to study. For the past 20 years, Seum has been a rice farmer to support her big family. She also works as a construction worker. Seum’s current businesses earn about 55,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. This will be her second loan cycle for with the Kiva partner, VisionFund. Seum used her previous loan to increase her living standards and repair her house.

Seum is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of their loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Seum hopes that she will earn more income to be better support her family and expend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen lives in a rural area of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is 53 years old and is a married woman who has no children. For the past 33 years, Hen and her husband have been rice farmers who also raise chickens. She can earn around 58,000 KHR per day and is able to save around 25,000 KHR each day.

Hen is the leader of a two-member loan group. This will be their first micro-loan. Hen will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and hire workers to work on her farm. In the future, she hope to earn more income and expend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire workers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Cosoltepec Group

texts.es:
Caña, maíz y frijol son los cultivos sobresalientes de la región donde se consolidó el grupo “Cosoltepec”, además también se caracteriza por un balneario muy conocido cuya agua corre libremente al ser el cruce de un nacimiento. 

Los integrantes se unieron para solicitar un préstamo y que les permita fortalecer sus actividades económicas: 

Michel, José  - Venta de Maíz 
Emiliana – Venta de Tamales 
Andrea – Venta de Antojitos 
Narahunda  - Venta de Manualidades
Mara,  Clara - Venta de Ropa 
Refugio - Venta de Antojitos 
Luis – Servicio de Contrucción

Doña Narahunda, mejor conocida como Nara, es madre de tres jóvenes todos ellos mayores de edad (sólo uno continúa estudiando). Nara trabaja en la gasolinera que se encuentra a 20 minutos de su comunidad, pero en sus tiempos libres se dedica a bordar, tejer y hacer figuras de fieltro.

“Me gusta mi trabajo pues atiendo a bastantes personas, tengo mi propio sueldo y un poco de dinero extra con las manualidades” son las palabras de doña Nara a quien siempre se le ve riendo. Ella prendió la elaboración de las manualidades gracias a su madre “Por ella y por mis hijos he luchado día a día”. Hace ya 6 años que Nara se dedica a su pequeña actividad, si algún cliente le solicita algún diseño especial para bordar, solo necesita ver el dibujo impreso y lo realiza sin problema. 

Con la intención de ampliar la variedad de creaciones, en dos semanas Nara iniciará un curso de repujado y figuras elaboradas con neumáticos lo que también ayudará a reciclar y disminuir la contaminación de su comunidad.

El tiempo es el principal oponente de doña Nara pues sus clientes suelen hacer los pedidos una semana antes de utilizar las pequeñas piezas. Cuando Nara trabaja en el turno de la mañana en la gasolinera, dedica todas las horas de la tarde a las manualidades y viceversa. Sin embargo, en muchas ocasiones, también tiene que dedicar horas de la noche para entregar sus pendidos puntualmente y con calidad ya que estas características son la base de su éxito. Con el nuevo préstamo comprará pinceles, silicón, pintura, hilos y el material para el curso de repujado que está a punto de iniciar. 

El grupo agradece a VisionFund  México  por la oportunidad de otorgarles un préstamo  para mejorar su actividad.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Nara quien usa short y blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
Sugar cane, corn, and beans care the crops that stand out in the region where the group Cosoltepec got together. In addition, it is also characterized by a well-known spa whose water flows freely since it is at a spring. 

The members got together to ask for a loan which allows them to strengthen their businesses:

Michel, José  - corn sales 
Emiliana – tamale sales 
Andrea – snack sales 
Narahunda  - craft sales
Mara,  Clara - clothing sales 
Refugio - snack sales 
Luis – construction service

Narahunda, better known as Nara, is the mother of three young adults (only one is still a student). Nara works in the gas station that is 20 minutes from her community, but in her free time she works embroidering, knitting and making figures from felt. 

“I like my work since I serve many people, I have my own wages and a little extra money with the crafts" are the words of Nara who is always laughing.  She began to make the crafts thanks to her mother "For her and for my children, I have struggled each day." For 6 years now, Nara has worked at this small business. If a customer asks for some special design to embroider, she only needs to see the printed drawing and she creates it without a problem. 

With the intention of expanding the variety of her creations, in two weeks Nara will begin a course on embossing and making figures with tires that will also help her to recycle and reduce the contamination of her community. 

Time is Nara's primary opponent since the customers tend to place their orders one week before using the small pieces. When Nara works in the morning shift at the gas station, she works all afternoon at the crafts and vice versa. However, many times, she also has to spend hours at night to finish the orders on time and with quality since these characteristics are the base of her success. With the new loan, she will purchase brushes, silicon, paint, thread and the material for the course in embossing which she is about to begin. 

The group is grateful to VisionFund México for the opportunity to offer them a loan to improve their work. 

*The photo was taken at Nara's house, who is wearing shorts and a red shirt.

loans.use: to purchase brushes, silicon, paint, thread and material for the embossing course.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
