Michelle is a hardworking mother from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children ranging from one to 20. For the past four years, Michelle has operated a fishing business. Her husband works in a private company. 

Michelle is requesting a loan to buy fishing materials such as a fishing net, nylon, and fish feed. Her loan will help her improve her ongoing catch and allow her to sell more fish. In this way, she will be able to balance her finances and prepare nutritious food for her family. In the future, Michelle hopes to manage her business successfully to make it sustainable to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon, and fish feed

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosalina has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a food production business in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income from a general store. 

Josephine is requesting a 21,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She dreams of one day saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four children living in Kampong Cham province, Oeun is 43 years old. 

She grows cassava on a three-hectares area as the main source of her income. Moreover, she can earn more income via rice cropping on a half-hectare area. For Oeun, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. 

She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Olivio

texts.es: Olivio, tiene la edad  de 53 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra e frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra de trabajos a realizar en los terrenos a sembrar y en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Olivia is 53 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and children, who are his greatest priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to the crop so he can have good germination, as well as good quality bean seeds. He will also pay for labor costs to apply the products and help with the crop once it has some growth and in this way ensure good work. He intends on taking advantage of the good weather and soil conditions the area has for this crop.  He will also put into practice his years of experience managing basic grains. 

He also wants to buy the best products of the best quality so his farm will have good growth and a good harvest and an important yield in the short term. He wants to use the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain for the well-being and education for his family, to meet some family goals, and to keep investing more in the crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to care for his bean crop.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Seang is originally from a rural area of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is 55 years old, and she is a married woman. She has four children, and one of them is a dependent child. 

The main source of her family income is from rice farming for 35 years. To earn more income to support her family, she also works as a construction worker. She can earn around 63,000 KHR per day and save around 40,000 KHR daily for when needed.
 
This is the first micro loan for Seang’s group, which consists of five members. Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, and she will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that she can earn more income and enough ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol is originally from a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 35 years old, and she is a married woman who has four dependent children, three of whom are in school. 

The main source of her family income is from rice farming for 17 years. She can earn around 43,000 KHR per day and save around 25,000 KHR daily for when needed.
 
This is the first micro loan for Thol’s group, which consists of two members. She is leading the group to apply for this loan and will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes that she can earn enough income to expand her current business and rebuild her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokleang's Group

texts.en:
Sokleang, 27, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children; two are in school and the other is too young. 

She grows cassava on a four-hectare area and rice on a one-hectare area to earn income. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. 

In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Agasi

texts.en:
Agasi is a 51-year-old man who is married with a daughter and two sons. His wife is a housekeeper and he is a hardworking farmer. Their house is very small, and he is working to renovate it. For the past 25 years, Agasi has been working with animal husbandry. He raises cows and his wife makes different dairy products and helps her husband. Agasi sells dairy products and meat at the local bazaar and to neighbors. His monthly income is 200 AZN. 

Agasi is requesting a 1,200 AZN loan to install a new water system and buy a new water tank for his farm.

loans.use: to install a new water system and buy a water tank for his cattle

loans.name: Sobira

texts.en:
Sobira is a kind woman. She was born in a small village in 1966. She is married and lives in a rural area with her family. Her husband works in agriculture. Sobira has four sons and two daughters. Feeding and growing them is not easy.

Each year she plants cereals and wheat. The season was not good, and she could not gain a good harvest. Sobira is planning to enlarge her business and earn more income to increase her standard of living. She participated at startup training that was provided by IMON and learnt a lot about how to be an entrepreneur.

This year she wants to get a loan to buy onion seeds and cattle. She wants to use the gained money from her business for family expenditures.

She awaits Kiva lenders’ mercy.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and cattle.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 50 years old and lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile shop for many years to generate income for their family. He troubleshoots mobile phone problems and sells accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cable, and other items as well as providing recharging facilities for various networks. Shamim’s son has a lot of demand for his services and sometimes he has to refuse customers. Her son does not have savings to further invest into his business because he spends his income on household expenses for the family. 

Shamim is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phone accessories and extra recharging credit for her son’s business. She thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories and extra recharging credit for her son’s business

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel is from Vinogradovo. Last time, he used funds from a Kiva loan to remodel his house exterior. He plastered it with foam cellular plastic. Since his last loan, Pavel’s younger daughter got married. He was also in a car accident and his car was badly damaged. Pavel managed to repair his car and today it is running again. 

Pavel is requesting a 25,000 UAH loan to cover the front of his house with decorative rustic-textured coating. He will love to use his loan to give his house a neat and harmonious look. This has been Pavel’s dream for awhile.

loans.use: to cover the front of his house with decorative rustic-textured coating

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en:
Eloy is a single man; he doesn't have children but he helps his parents. In fact he lives with them. Eloy is an experienced farmer and he makes cheese every day to have a better income. 

Eloy needs a loan to buy a milk cow that will be very helpful for him because he needs to sell more cheese. Eloy's parents are senior citizens so Eloy needs to make more money to help them.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 27 years old she lives with her parents. Carmen has a 5 years old child and does her best to care for her son and to help her parents.

 Carmen is an artisan and makes earrings and key chains.  She needs a loan to buy supplies to make more items because she needs to make more money.   Carmen has been an artisan for 8 years so she knows how to make a good product. She hopes you can trust her.

loans.use: to buy craft supplies to make key chains and earrings.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning income for her family as well. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Elisa wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 49 years old and a mother of five children. She looks after her children in her old age. Nusrat’s son owns a metal shop in Lahore, Pakistan, where he sells iron sheets and rods for concrete roof construction and manufacturing purposes. Her son has been running his business since he was a child and was not able to get an education. Nusrat’s son wants to be able to support his siblings and be able to educate and feed them. He wants to generate the maximum amount of income he can to reduce the financial difficulties of supporting his family but he does not have extra cash in hand.

Nusrat is requesting a loan to purchase materials and iron goods for her son’s shop. She wants to financially support her son so he will be able to meet his goals. Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva lenders and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase materials and iron goods for her son’s shop

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 55-year-old married woman who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vicenta has had a general store business for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to restock  her general store.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build an extra room and expand her house

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit  is a 37-year-old married man who lives in the village of Kakhati. He has wife, 2 daughters and mother, and  is the breadwinner in the family. His mother is a saleswoman and earns approximately 300 GEL. This small income is hardly enough for family-of-five to meet even basic needs. 

Davit is eager to have his own business income, as he was unable to start any stable job. He requested a loan, but was rejected several times as having no business experience and stable revenue. His loan application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start up loan program envisages provisions to business start-up credits, with soft conditions, which don't have access to regular credit providers. 

 Davit plans to open car washing service locally.  He will get the chance to generate significant income and thus cover all his family's needs. 
The loan will be great help to this motivated man and his family, as their living conditions will significantly increase.

loans.use: to open a car washing service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to replace the use of candles so that her children will be able to study for longer hours and have a better future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad  has been manufacturing handbags for  11 years.   She is married and says that thanks to her work, she has been able to support her family and buy a piece of land. 

Natividad asks for a loan to buy materials to manufacture the handbags.  She has taken some previous loans and has always repaid  on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to manufacture handbags.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en: Maria del Rosario is 39 years old and has been selling shoes for more than 15 years to her friends and neighbors. She sells through a catalog and asks for a loan to buy more inventory.  She wants to offer more variety.  She says that her biggest achievement has been  to maintain her business. She  has a strong character that helps her overcome difficult times. She is pleased to  have the unconditional support of her husband.

loans.use: to buy shoes..

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables and clothing items for resale.

loans.name: Marta Patricia

texts.es: Marta de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, el negocio lo inicio con capital propio  hace mas de 8 años,  con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She has a shop where she sells staple goods. She started the business with her own capital more than 8 years ago, and with the earnings she receives she manages to pay for some of her household expenses. 

Marta is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets and pastries etc. so that she can improve her income and have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets and pastries etc.

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan is from Drogobych. He is a private entrepreneur who works in construction. He builds  houses. Bogdan lives in a private house with his wife and 5 children.
 
Bogdan requests 40 000 UAH to  roof  his house and change windows. Bogdan is good with his hands and will  do most of the work himself. However, he needs the money to buy supplies for the project.

loans.use: to repair his roof and windows.

loans.name: Maria Arely

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ya tiene 6 años de experiencia y trabaja todos los días, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como logra sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her 5 children. She works selling tortillas from her home. She has 6 years of experience and works every day. Thanks to her sales she has managed to raise her children. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime to be able to continue making tortillas. Then she can have greater income to enjoy a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is from Vinogradovo. He is an assembler in a local furniture store. He has been in this position for 7 years. At the moment Ivan lives in a one-room apartment  with his wife and a daughter. Ivan loves fishing. 

Ivan is planning to invest 15,000 UAH from KIVA to remodel his bathroom. He needs these additional funds to buy tiles and tile glue to finish this project. 

The funding will help the family to turn their bathroom into a  nice and tidy place because at the moment, the conditions are poor.

loans.use: to buy tiles and tile glue to remodel his bathroom.

loans.name: María Alondra

texts.es: María Alondra, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposo y sus hijo, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra de frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad que se adpte bien a las condiciones de clima y suelo de la zona, además pagar mano de obra de trabajos a realizar en los terrenos a sembrar y en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maria Alondra is 19 years old. She lives in a civil union with her husband and son, who are her top priority. With her loan she intends to buy fertilizer and other products to apply to her beans when she plants them so they will germinate. She also intends to buy good quality bean seeds that are adaptable to the local climate and soil conditions. In addition she'll use it to pay for labor in the fields to help with applying the products and planting once things develop, to ensure that the job is well done. 

She will take advantage of the good climate and soil of the region, which are favorable to growing beans. She’ll also put into practice years of experience managing staple grains. In addition to buying the best products of the highest quality to ensure that she has a good harvest, short-term production is important. 

She will use the income she hopes to obtain from her harvest for the well being of her family and to meet some of their goals and invest in her crops. This is her first loan from Fudecosur. She has not had loans before from state banks, but Fudecosur has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Yanali

texts.en:
Yanali is 32 years old and started selling clothing two years ago.  She started the business to support her husband and children.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise for the spring season.  Her biggest accomplishment is maintaining her business and helping her husband.

loans.use: to buy women and children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  She has a food stall to sell sandwiches, snacks, and candies. 

She asks for a loan to buy some food and snacks for her food stall. She says that she works outside near a public school and has many recurring clients. Her biggest accomplishment is being independent and reliable; her challenge is to continue to support her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy food and snacks for her food stall.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.en:
Humberto is 64 years old, married, and describes his family as very solid.  His sons are grownup and independent. He says that his children support him and his wife.  He owns a house and runs a home-based fabric store. 

They are very thrifty and like to save money. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 78 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 78 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Il est composé de 5 personnes dont 4 femmes et un homme. Ils habitent tous dans le même quartier et pratiques différentes activités. Ils se réunissent tous les fins de mois et organisent des tontines. La président est Madame Amélia, c'est elle qui levée la main sur la photo. Elle est veuve et mère de famille qui prend en charge toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité ainsi que les frais médicaux de ses enfants. Elle évolue dans la vente de légumes et fruits. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des fruits comme les oranges, mangues, bananes et des légumes comme le choux, aubergine, tomate, manioc etc.... . Amélia commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 21h. N'ayant pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l'institution, elle souhaite à l'avenir avoir un magasin de stockage et un frigo pour la conservation de ses marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter et diversifier ses produits et épargner de l'argent.
texts.en:
Jiguène Bakhna 78 is a subgroup of the Association of Women Merchants of Pout. It is made up of five persons, four women and one man. They all live in the same neighborhood and have varied businesses. They meet at the end of each month and organize revolving savings accounts. The president is Madame Amélia, the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is a widow and the mother of a family who is responsible for all the daily expenditures of the family, and the school fees as well as the medical fees for her children. She works at selling fruit and vegetables. She has more than 10 years' experience and is asking for this loan to buy fruit such as oranges, mangoes, and bananas, and vegetables such as cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes, manioc, etc.

Amélia begins her day at 8 am and stops working at 9 pm. She has no relative who receives benefits from the Microfinance Institution. She hopes in future to have a warehouse and a fridge so as to preserve her merchandise. Thus she would be able to grow and diversify her products and save some money.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Dúo Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dúo Fe y Esperanza
Las señora Silvia es originaria de la comunidad de patzun, ellas se dedican a la venta de productos Cosmeticos le gusta el negocio de esa forma logran ayudar a su familia ya que es tan dificil para ellas conseguir un empleo ya que tienen varios hijos y no puede  descuidarlos necesitan de ella para poder educarse. por esa razon se dedica a su negocio y el deseo de ella es ver a sus hijos con un buen trabajo mas adelante y tambien que sus negocio crezca para que ellas puedan tener una entrada siempre y puedan ayudarse con sus gastos de todos los dias.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra cosmeticos para vender.
texts.en: Dúo Fe y Esperanza: Silvia is a native of the community of Patzun. She works selling cosmetic products and she likes the business as by doing this she manages to help her family. It is very difficult to get a job as she has a number of children and can't leave them alone. They need her to educate them. For this reason she works at her business and her wish is to see her children with good jobs in the future. She also wishes that her business expands so that they always have an income and can help with the daily expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking mother of two school-age children. Her husband is a contractual carpenter. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily expenses. 

Nora has a skill in managing her beauty salon. Because of her personal touch, her customers are increasing. Now, she is applying in Paglaum for her 2nd cycle with the amount of 10,000PHP to buy new sets of her color, cutex and a salon chair.  She is very happy because she can help in supporting the daily expenses of her two children and at the same she can save for their future.

loans.use: to buy new sets of hair color, cutex and a salon chair.

loans.name: Dúo Esperanza De San Martin Group

texts.es:
Dúo Esperanza de San Martin
Este dúo esta formado por doña María Damiana es originaria de San  Martin, doña Damiana es propietaria de una  tienda de consumo diario ella lucha y se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y solicita el crédito para surtir más su negocio, y así aumentar sus ventas ofreciendo a sus clientes un mejor surtido y atención, con el crédito anterior sus ventas aumentaron y sus pagos lo realizo bien. Agradece a kiva su apoyo.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para vender.
texts.en: Dúo Esperanza de San Martin: One of the members of this group is María Damiana a native of San  Martin. Damiana is the owner of a basic food item store. She struggles and makes an effort to get her family ahead. She is requesting this loan to stock her store more and doing this increase her sales offering her clients a better variety and service. With the last loan her sales increased and she made her payments properly. She is grateful to KIva for their support. She is requesting this loan to buy food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, a hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more store inventory to increase stock. This way, she will be able to sell more goods which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more store inventory to increase stock.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 58 years old, married and currently residing in Poblacion, La Libertad, ZDN.  Her husband is a farmer who plants different types of root crops as their primary source of income. Minerva helps support their family from the income of teaching music using an organ. 

As of now, Minerva has applied for a loan in Paglaum in the amount of 50,000PHP which will be used to buy an additional organ for teaching lessons. Because of the increased number of her students, she needs to buy another one for the fast learning of her students. She very happy to help develop the talent of their young neighbors.

loans.use: to buy an additional organ for teaching lessons.

loans.name: Denisa

texts.en:
Denisa, 36, is married with one child. With her child currently in school, Denisa works very hard to provide for her family.

Denisa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, detergent, soft drinks, noodles, sugar and cereals.
 
She has requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional goods to sell, such as canned goods, detergent, soft drinks, noodles, sugar and cereals.

Denisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed, 51, is married with three children. He lives with his family in an uncompleted house in one of the poorest areas of Taiz, Yemen. The house needs a lot of renovation on the inside as well as windows for its rooms. The money that he receives from his employment is not enough for this work. 

Therefore, Ahmmed has applied for a loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He will use the loan to purchase cement and windows to renovate his house and make it a safe place for his children. This Kiva loan will enable Ahmmed to provide his children with a healthy environment. By making the necessary renovations on the inside and installing suitable windows, the house will be a warm and comfortable living space. Surely, this loan will fetch calmness inside the children.

All of Ahmmed's dreams are about providing his children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase cement and windows to renovate his house and make it a safe place for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install sanitary services, as she is a young mother who is concerned about the well-being of her family.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 25 años a la venta de pan dulce su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pan dulce por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Dolores is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling pastries for the last 25 years. Her business is located in the municipal market near her house. 

She has many customers thanks to her good prices. She is seeking a loan to buy more pastries at wholesale in order to continue with her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more pastries at wholesale.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 105 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 105 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. Ils est composé de 4 femmes et 1 homme qui habitent dans le même quartier et qui pratiques différentes activités. Ils se réunissent chaque fin de mois pour organiser des tontines et discuter de leur développement durable de leur quartier. Ils ont choisi Madame Miningua comme présidente du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle évolue dans la vente de poissons fumées, séchées et des crustacés, elle a une étale au marché. Avec ce prêt, elle va sur la petite cote pour acheter des poissons séchés et fumés et des crustacés pour revenir les vendre au marché. Miningua commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 16h. Elle souhaite avoir un grand magasin pour stocker ses marchandises ainsi elle  pourra diminuer ses voyages augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Jiguène Bakhna 105 is a sub-group of the Association of Femmes Commerçantes de Pout. It is made up of four women and a man, who live in the same locality and run different businesses. They meet at the end of every month to organise savings groups, and to discuss the sustainable development of their district. They chose Mrs. Miningua as the president of the group. She is married with children and she helps her husband to manage the daily expenses of the family.
She sells smoked fish, dried fish and shellfish, she has a stall at the market. With this loan, she will go to Petite Cote to buy dried fish and smoked fish to sell when she returns to the market. Miningua starts work at 6am and finishes at 4pm. She would like to have a big shop to stock her merchandise to enable her to reduce her journeys and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, smoked fish and shellfish at the market.

loans.name: Asalbi

texts.en:
Asalbi is a generous woman. She has 15 years experience doing business. She was born in a small village in 1953. She is a widow and has three children.

Asalbi does business buying and selling sweets and nuts and dried fruits like almonds, apricots, etc. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to expand her business and buy additional goods. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional sweets and nuts and dried fruits like almonds, apricots, etc.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr: Oumou qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang, debout avec le foulard blanc et rouge, et qui tend la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dankassa au sud de Bamako au Mali. Oumou, âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 10 enfants âgés entre 11 et 33 ans, avec 7 d’entre actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Oumou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Oumou cultive l'arachide et le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de matériels agricoles. Depuis qu’elle pratique l'agriculture, Oumou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Oumou entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison de la qualité des engrais proposés par myAgro. De plus, elle souligne l'impact positif qu'a eu dans le passé le système de paiement myAgro dans son quotidien d'agricultrice, en lui permettant d’économiser à son rythme. Cette année Oumou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Oumou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des bœufs et une charrue. Enfin Oumou ajoute que cela lui permettra aussi de « préparer l'avenir de ses enfants ».
texts.en:
Oumou, who appears in the second row in the photo, standing with the red and white scarf and holding the myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of 10 farmers registered with myAgro, who [all] live and work in the village of Dankassa, south of Bamako, in Mali. Oumou is 55 years old and the mother of 10 children between the ages of 11 and 33, with seven of them currently attending school.

The rooting of family tradition in agriculture, the household's primary source of income and food self-sufficiency, is what has driven Oumou to participate in this business for 30 years now. Oumou grows ground nuts and rice on her plot of land but, as a farmer, must cope with issues like a lack of quality fertilizer and farm equipment. Since she began farming, Oumou has grown ground nuts for their food-producing value, explaining that ground nuts are directly consumable for the family and are used as a base sauce in their diet.

Oumou is beginning her second year with myAgro; she re-registered because of the quality of the fertilizer offered by myAgro. She also highlights the positive impact myAgro's payment system has had on her daily life as a farmer in the past by allowing her to save at her own pace. This year, Oumou is making payments to purchase a pouch of myAgro fertilizer for her ground nut crop in order to increase the crop yield on her half-hectare plot. With the increase in [both] her crop yield and her revenue, Oumou plans to purchase oxen and a plow. Oumou adds that this will also allow her to "prepare for her children's future."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for ground nut farming.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.

Isabel has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Grupo Chuisanto Tomas Sector Chicay Group

texts.es:
Pascuala tiene 37 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre diez y veinte años, del cual uno de ellos ya está graduado y el resto aún se encuentra estudiando, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pascuala (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de  obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, desde hace 3 años, ella cuenta que gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Pascuala es una mujer muy optimista, que ahora ha tenido la iniciativa de mejorar su negocio, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por lo que ha organizado  a un grupo de personas, para solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en compra y venta de trajes típicos, comprando así, cortes, fajas, blusas.
El gran anhelo de  Pascuala es poder construir  su casa de block, y que sus hijos  estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Pascuala, 37, is married and has a beautiful family of four sons aged between 10 and 20 years old, one of whom has already graduated and the others are still studying. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá. 

In order to make some income, Pascuala (who appears on the farthest left in the photo) buys and sells traditional clothing for a living and has been doing so for 3 years. She says that thanks to this venture she has been able to get her family ahead.

Pascuala is a very optimistic woman and she is taking the initiative to improve her business, but one of the difficulties she faces is not having sufficient capital. For this reason, she has put together a group of people in order to request a loan which they will invest in the purchase and sale of traditional outfits; including buying skirts, belts and blouses.

Pascuala’s dream is to be able to build her house out of cement and that her children go to University.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing such as skirts, belts and blouses.

loans.name: Erick Asdrubal

texts.es: Erick de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza de tilapias, posee un año de experiencia, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar el lugar donde mantiene a las tilapias y comprar comida y concentrado y asi poder seguir con sus crianzas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Erick, aged 31, lives in his own home with his life partner. 

He farms tilapia, which he has been doing for a year, and sells his products in the various markets near his home. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can improve the area where he keeps the tilapia, and to buy feed. This way he will be able to continue with his farming which is his only work and only source of income.

loans.use: to improve the area where he keeps his tilapia, and to buy feed.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en: Balbina is 53 years old. She has four sons but they are adults already and they have their own families. She has been living alone for one year. She purchased some land where she has a room. Balbina wants a loan to build up a retaining wall on her property. She wishes she could have an entire house in the future. Balbina is an employee of the La Paz city hall.  She works as a street sweeper.

loans.use: to build up a retaining wall.

loans.name: Jiguène Bakhna 101 Group

texts.fr: Jiguène Bakhna 101 est un sous groupe de l'Association des Femmes Commerçantes et actives de Pout. Il est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent dans le même village environnant de la commune de Pout. Elles sont toutes dans le marché de la localité et vendent du poisson. Elles sont organisées et se voient tous les jours. Madame FATMA est la présidente, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui accompagne son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 17h du soir. Avec l'augmentation de ses revenus FATMA va acheter un frigo pour y conserver le reste de ses poissons invendues. Elle souhaite aussi épargner de l'argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Jiguène Bakhna 101 is a sub group of the Association of Femmes Commerçantes and active of Pout. It is made up of five women who live in the same village near the commune of Pout. They all work at the local market and sell fish there. They are well organised, and see each other every day. Mrs. Fatma is the president, she is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is married with children and she helps her husband to manage daily expenses and the school fees for her children. She requests this credit to reinforce her stock of merchandise and to diversify her products. She has over 10 years experience. She starts work at 6am and finishes at 5pm. With the increase in her income, Fatma will buy a refrigerator to conserve the fish that remains unsold. She also hopes to save some money and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell retail.

loans.name: Parin Siin 4 Group

texts.fr: Ramata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait le commerce général et cela fait 5 ans. Elle gère une boutique et elle a besoin de ce prêt pour faire l'approvisionnement. Elle va acheter des sacs de riz de diverse qualité, de l'huile, du sucre, de la mayonnaise et autre article nécessaire pour le  fonctionnement de sa boutique. A l'issue de ses ventes, le bénéfice lui permettra de faire les petites dépenses de ses enfants, de les soigner en cas de maladie et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Ramata is the representative member of the group and is married with three children of whom two go to school. This good lady sells groceries and has been doing this for five years. She manages a shop and she needs this loan to buy supplies. She intends to buy sacks of rice of different qualities, oil, sugar, mayonnaise and other articles that are necessary for her shop to function smoothly. When she has sold her merchandise, the profits will enable her to buy petty necessities for her children, to take care of them in case they are ill, and to continue her activity.

loans.use: to buy articles (rice, sugar, oil, pasta,...) to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Zhyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 63 года, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, с молодости занимается полеводством и животноводством. По характеру очень добрая, ответственная, спокойная. У Жыпаркул есть дойная корова и нетель, на 1,80 Га она выращивает фасоль и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Zhyparkul is 63 and married with five children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry since she was young. She is a very kind, responsible and level-headed person. She has a dairy cow and heifer as well as 1.8 hectares of land where she grows beans and clover.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhyparkul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 15,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer to amend the soil and grow organic beans. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her farm and into saving toward furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to amend the soil and grow organic beans

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 56 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and five children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Felisa wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase fertilizer for corn production so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn production.

loans.name: Almeda

texts.en: Almeda makes a living through her junk shop business. She runs a junk shop in Poblacion, La Libertad, Philippines and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed herself of a loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her junk shop. Almeda hopes to sustain her business and dreams of a truck for delivery.

loans.use: to buy additional junk

loans.name: Dúo Merlos Group

texts.es: Duo Merlos compuesto por doña Gregoria es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en Cañadas de San Juan. Ella se dedica al comercio, a la venta de comida y a la venta de cosmeticos necesita un poco mas de capital para invertir en su negocio y asi tener variedad de su producto. asi ampliar su negocio nos cuenta que el credito le ha sido de bastante ayuda y ha mejorado la economía familiar. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que la Fundacion le ha dado, Agradece de antemano su ayuda. Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de comidas, compra de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
One of the members of "Duo Merlos" group is Gregoria, a very hard working person who lives in Cañadas de San Juan. 

She works selling both food and cosmetics. She needs a little more capital for her business, so that she can increase the variety of products she sells, to expand her store. 

The loan has been very useful and has improved her family's economic situation. She is very grateful for the opportunity that the Foundation has given her, and is very thankful in advance for all the help. 

She is requesting a loan to buy food products for preparing the meals, and to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy food products for preparing meals.

loans.name: Dúo Lomas De San Cristóbal Group

texts.es:
Duo Lomas de San Cristobal
Está formado por la señora Brenda, tiene 50 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y van al colegio,  Brenda a solicitado un nuevo crédito para agrandar su negocio  venta de leñay obtener un  lugar propio  para su negocio pues actualmente su venta está en su casa de residencia, Brenda sueña con tener una venta de madera donde pueden hacer varios productos de decoración y así expandir su negocio.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de leña para vender.
texts.en:
Brenda is part of the Duo Lomas de San Cristobal duo. She is 50 years old and has three children who are minors and go to school. Brenda is requested a new loan so that she can expand her business selling firewood and obtain her own sales outlet for her business, as currently she sells from her home. 

Brenda's dream is to have a place to sell wood where she can make various decorative products and thus expand her business.

She is requesting this loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: To Buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell for her buy-and-sell herbal medicine business.

Jenelie has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from a general store.

Jenelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 54 years old and married with four children.

Juliet earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juliet has been farming sugarcane for seven years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anabelinda

texts.en:
Anabelinda is 42 years old and single.

Anabelinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Anabelinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Anabelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Liezel is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Julita to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as a refrigerator, water, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, cigarettes, sugar, salt and fish. She has been involved in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Julita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, water, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, cigarettes, sugar, salt and fish.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 58 years old and married with eight children.

Clarita earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Clarita has been pig fattening for years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eleonor works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and selling tobacco. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell for her buy-and-sell fruits business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Lucia supplements her income through other business ventures such as buying and selling wood. Lucia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 45 años de edad, está casada tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados y el resto se encuentra aún bajo el cuidado de la madre, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela con el afán de obtener sus ingresos, tiene una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes ubicado en el lugar de su domicilio, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace seis años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la venta de hilos, gracias a esta labor ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Para Manuela esta pequeña tienda, es muy importante por lo que ha pensado en invertir más en su tienda, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por tal motivo solicita un crédito que lo invertirá para comprar sus  productos como recitos, jugos, galletas, dulces, frijoles, azúcar y surtir mejor su tienda.
El sueño de Manuela es poder  hacer de su tienda una súper  tienda para poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la clientela.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 45 year-old woman. She is married and has a lovely family with six children. Two of them are married and the rest are still under their mother’s care. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

With the desire to earn her income, Manuela has a small grocery store located in her home. She has been doing this for six years. To improve her income she also sells thread, and in this way she has been able to support her family. 

This small store is very important to Manuela, so she has planned to invest more in it. One of her difficulties is that she does not have enough capital, so this is why she is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of products such as snack foods, juices, cookies, sweets, beans, and sugar to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries such as snack foods, juices, cookies, sweets, beans, and sugar  to better stock her store.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual es un hombre soltero de cuarenta y tres años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pascual con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica  a la venta de papas fritas en el lugar de su domicilio, esta actividad lo realiza el apenas hace algunos meses, pero para mejorar sus ingresos trabaja como músico en  donde obtiene otro  pequeño ingreso.
Él es un padre responsable y desde hace algún tiempo se ha puesto a ver las necesidades de su familia y una de las más necesarias es la adquisición de una refrigeradora porque por la larga distancia a la que se encuentran del mercado es muy necesario conservar mucha comida, aunque él  no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder comprarlo por tal motivo solicita un prestamo que lo invertirá para comprar un refrigeradora para que su familia tenga un lugar donde pueda conservar mejor sus alimento.
El gran sueño de Pascual es poder construir un local para venta de abarrotes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pascual is a single 43 year old who lives in a community in Sololá. Pascual with the urge to generate his own income and support his family works selling french fries in a part of his house. He has only done this business for a few months. In order to improve his income he works as a musician where he makes another small income.

He is a responsible and for some time has been looking after the needs of his family. One of the most needed things is the acquisition of a refrigerator. Because of the long distance they are from the market they need to keep a lot of food.

He does not have enough money to make the purchase so he is requesting a loan that will be invested in buying a refrigerator so that his family has a place to keep their food. Pascual's big dream is to be able to construct a commercial space to sell groceries and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 53-year-old divorced woman. Carmen has a daughter and she lives with her at the house that belongs to Carmen. Mother and daughter live in El Alto. 

Carmen makes a living by selling eggs. She has a chicken farm and she needs a loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her egg-laying hens. Carmen is responsible and she works hard. This is the second time she has come to Kiva and she hopes you can trust her again.

Carmen still has the dream to have a lot of chickens and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her egg-laying hens.

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es: Dúo las Victorias de San Martin La encargada de este grupo es la señora Victoria.  Desde hace 23 años se ha dedicado a la venta de calzado en general como tenis, zapatos de piel, yinas para damas caballeros y niños, también zapatillas para damas y niñas y todo es en diferente calidad y variedad de estilos.  Tiene venta de mochilas escolares adultos y niños en colores y tamaños, ropa interior para caballeros y niños y venta en general de cosméticos como shampoo, cremas, lociones en general damas y caballeros, ropa de catalogo.  Hay varios estilos de tenis que le han pedido y debe comprar por caja de cuatro docenas valorado en Q. 4000.00 cada uno.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso necesita otro préstamo para comprar lo que le están pidiendo y no quedarles mal a sus clientes que siempre la visitan.
texts.en:
Dúo las Victorias de San Martin. 
The person managing this group is Victoria. She has been selling footwear in general for 23 years; items such as trainers, leather shoes, and flip flops for women, men and children. Everything is in a variety of qualities and styles. She sells school knapsacks for adults and children in various colors and sizes, men's and children's underwear, and sells cosmetics in general for men and women, such as shampoo, creams, lotions, as well as catalog clothing.


There are various styles of tennis shoes she has been asked for and must buy by the box of four dozen, costing 4000 quetzales each. The money she has is not sufficient to do that and she needs another loan to buy what she is being asked her and not to let down the customers who visit her shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Maride

texts.en: Maride is a hardworking entrepreneur with two children who earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her animals. Maria supplements her income with earnings from sales, and dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 23 years old, single, and she works very hard to help her parents.

Riza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as soft-drinks, biscuits, sardines, noodles, etc.

Riza has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as soft-drinks, biscuits, sardines, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking female entrepreneur with nine children, four of whom attend school.

Rosemarie earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizer and to pay for her labourers' salaries.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell rice business.

Rosemarie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and to pay for her labourers' salaries

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 59 years old and married with ten children.

Arsenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Arsenia has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Arsenia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 54 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arsenia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Arsenia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Arsenia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en: Socorro is 61 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She works very hard to provide for her children by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including soap, milk, sugar, and eggs. Socorro has been in this business for four years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 49 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a loan for PHP 19,000 from NWTF to buy additional feed. Susan has been in this line of work for five years and earns additional income by sellin rice and motorcycle transportation services. She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested a new one to further build up her businesses. She is working tirelessly toward her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is 20 years old. She is a single factory worker who lives in Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been working as a factory worker since 2013, earning around $5 per day.

Now Sreyneang would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy a motorcycle.

In the future, she wants to save money to run her own business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as fattening pigs.

Conception dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina is 58 years old, married, and works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including canned goods, snacks, coffee, cereals, soft drinks, juice, and more. Agustina has borrowed and repaid seven prior loans from NWTF and has run her general store for two years. She earns additional income from raising pigs. She will use this loan to help reach her goal of continuing to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, cereals, soft-drinks, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eugenuia

texts.en:
Eugenuia, 50, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, her business partner, and has six children, one of whom is in high school; the youngest is still in the elementary level, and the rest are already working. She works hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Eugenia is into a food business. She has operated an eatery stall for five years already. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Working-class people usually buy their meals, sold at a reasonable price at food stalls, for convenience and to save money, rather than cook at home. The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their families.

Eugenuia cooks well; that is why her food stall is popular in their area with neighbors and the local working community as her regular customers. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Eugenuia is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy her raw ingredients, such as pork, fish, chicken, seasonings, beverages and mineral water as well, that are needed for her food business. She believes that with this financial assistance, her sales and earnings will increase, which will surely cover her children's education and fund their daily sustenance. She is thanking God in advance for your great help.

Eugenuia dreams to build and expand her business to secure the education of her children to allow them a better future. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients, beverages, and mineral water for her food stall.

loans.name: Taing's Group

texts.en:

For 28 years, the main source of her family income has been from rice farming, and to better support her family and earn more income, she also feeds fish for sale as well. She can earn around 73,000 KHR per day for her family’s needs. 

Taing’s group consists of four members, and this is the fourth loan for her with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. Now, she is leading the group to apply for this loan; she will use her portion to buy farming supplies. She hopes that she can earn more income and have a better ability to support her children’s studying until they have a good job.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, eggs, cigarettes, salt, oils, fish, water, fanta, sprite, sagiko, coca cola and slippers.

She hopes that she can earn more income and have enough ability to expend her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

texts.en:

She will buy some additional supplies such as eggs, a refrigerator, noodles, fanta, water, sprite, cigarettes, oils, salt and candles. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Josefa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future.

After graduation, she wants to save money to run her own business; therefore she will be able to help her parents to improve the family’s living standards.

She will use her portion to buy seeds and pay for labor to work on her farm. She hopes that she can earn more and have a better standard of living.

She does a business in agriculture and keeps livestock. Also she sells dairy products to her neighbors and domestic market at weekends. Each weekend is a market day in her area. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy calves. 

Additionally she has a land where she plants apricot trees and other things. She is capable to make repayment of her loan. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy calves.
